explanation: An adverb indicating that someone feels that it is too late to do something.
japanese: この問題を今更議論したところで無意味でしょう。
reading: この問題を今更議論したところで無意味でしょう。
english: It would be meaningless to discuss this issue now.

translation: Too late (for/to ~); now
explanation: An adverb indicating that someone feels that it is too late to do something.
japanese: 卒業してから二十年だが今更ながら母校の教育の質のよさが分かってきた。
reading: 卒業してから二十年だが今更ながら母校の教育の質のよさが分かってきた。
english: It's been 20 years since I graduated, but now (too late) l've ﬁnally come to appreciate the educational quality of my alma mater.

translation: Too late (for/to ~); now
explanation: An adverb indicating that someone feels that it is too late to do something.
japanese: あなたはあの男とはきっぱり別れたはずなのに、今更なんで会おうとしているの。
reading: あなたはあの男とはきっぱり<ruby title="別(わか)"><rb>別</rb><rt>わか</rt></ruby>れたはずなのに、今更なんで会おうとしているの。
english: I thought you had broken up with that guy. Why in the world are you still trying to see him?

translation: Too late (for/to ~); now
explanation: An adverb indicating that someone feels that it is too late to do something.
japanese: 今更ですが、「明けましておめでとうございます」。
reading: 今更ですが、「明けましておめでとうございます」。
english: I'm afraid it is too late, but let me wish you a Happy New Year.

translation: Too late (for/to ~); now
explanation: An adverb indicating that someone feels that it is too late to do something.
japanese: 今日の講師は皆さんよくご存じの方ですから、今更ご紹介する必要はないとは思いますが…。
reading: 今日の講師は皆さんよくご存じの方ですから、今更ご紹介する必要はないとは思いますが…。
english: All of you know today's lecturer very well, so I believe it is not necessary to introduce him now, but . . .

translation: Too late (for/to ~); now
explanation: An adverb indicating that someone feels that it is too late to do something.
japanese: 会議の日程はすでに全員に電子メールで通知を出したのだから、今更変更することはできない。
reading: 会議の日程はすでに全員に電子メールで通知を出したのだから、今更変更することはできない。
english: Because we have already e-mailed information on the conference schedule to everybody, it is impossible to change it now.

translation: Too late (for/to ~); now
explanation: An adverb indicating that someone feels that it is too late to do something.
japanese: 喜んでプロジェクトに加わりたいと言った手前、今更断れないよ。
reading: 喜んでプロジェクトに加わりたいと言った手前、今更断れないよ。
english: Because I told them that I would participate in the project with great pleasure, I can't decline now.

translation: Too late (for/to ~); now
explanation: An adverb indicating that someone feels that it is too late to do something.
japanese: 子供時代に過ごした村を訪ねたいと思っていますが、今更行ったところで、古いものは何も残っていないでしょうね。
reading: 子供時代に過ごした村を訪ねたいと思っていますが、今更行ったところで、古いものは何も残っていないでしょうね。
english: I'd like to visit the village where I spent my childhood, but even if I go, I guess nothing of the old times will still be there.

translation: Too late (for/to ~); now
explanation: An adverb indicating that someone feels that it is too late to do something.
japanese: 母親を失って十年、自分も親になってみて、今更ながら、親不孝だったことを反省しています。
reading: 母親を失って十年、自分も親になってみて、今更ながら、親不孝だったことを<ruby title="反省(はんせい)"><rb>反省</rb><rt>はんせい</rt></ruby>しています。
english: It has been 10 years since I lost my mother, and I am now a parent myself. It is too late, but I regret that I was not a devoted son.

translation: Only; always; continue to; keep ~ing; be steadily ~ing; become ~er and ~er
explanation: A phrase indicating that “something happens continuously” or “someone does something repeatedly”.
japanese: 物価は上げる一方だ。
reading: 物価は上げる一方だ。
english: (Commodity) prices are rising steadily.

translation: Only; always; continue to; keep ~ing; be steadily ~ing; become ~er and ~er
explanation: A phrase indicating that “something happens continuously” or “someone does something repeatedly”.
japanese: 久子は私にものを頼む一方で、何もしてくれたことがない。
reading: 久子は私にものを頼む一方で、何もしてくれたことがない。
english: Hisako is always requesting favours but has never done anything for me.

translation: Only; always; continue to; keep ~ing; be steadily ~ing; become ~er and ~er
explanation: A phrase indicating that “something happens continuously” or “someone does something repeatedly”.
japanese: 電話や電子メールを利用した詐欺は巧妙化する一方だ。
reading: 電話や電子メールを利用した詐欺は巧妙化する一方だ。
english: Telephone and email fraud is becoming cleverer and cleverer.

translation: Only; always; continue to; keep ~ing; be steadily ~ing; become ~er and ~er
explanation: A phrase indicating that “something happens continuously” or “someone does something repeatedly”.
japanese: この市は急増した人口にインフラ整備が追いつかず、犯罪も増える一方だ。
reading: この市は急増した人口にインフラ整備が追いつかず、犯罪も増える一方だ。
english: Improvements to the infrastructure in this city have not kept pace with the sudden population increase, and crime keeps increasing as well.

translation: Only; always; continue to; keep ~ing; be steadily ~ing; become ~er and ~er
explanation: A phrase indicating that “something happens continuously” or “someone does something repeatedly”.
japanese: ビジネスのグローバル化が進む今日、英語によるコミュニケーション能力の重要性は増す一方だ。
reading: ビジネスのグローバル化が進む今日、英語によるコミュニケーション能力の重要性は<ruby title="増(ま)"><rb>増</rb><rt>ま</rt></ruby>す一方だ。
english: English communication skills are becoming more and more important today as businesses continue to globalize.

translation: Only; always; continue to; keep ~ing; be steadily ~ing; become ~er and ~er
explanation: A phrase indicating that “something happens continuously” or “someone does something repeatedly”.
japanese: サッカー熱は高まる一方だが、少年サッカーでひざの故障を起こすケースも増えている。
reading: サッカー熱は 高[たか]まる一方だが、少年サッカーで膝の故障を起こすケースも増えている。
english: People's enthusiasm for soccer is growing steadily, but the number of cases of knee injuries in youth soccer is also growing.

translation: Only; always; continue to; keep ~ing; be steadily ~ing; become ~er and ~er
explanation: A phrase indicating that “something happens continuously” or “someone does something repeatedly”.
japanese: 深刻化する一方の医師不足に早急に何らかの対策が必要だ。
reading: 深刻化する一方の医師不足に早急に何らかの対策が必要だ。
english: We need some immediate countermeasures for the shortage of doctors, which is just getting worse.

translation: Only; always; continue to; keep ~ing; be steadily ~ing; become ~er and ~er
explanation: A phrase indicating that “something happens continuously” or “someone does something repeatedly”.
japanese: 昨日のホッケーでは我々のチームは攻められる一方だった。
reading: 昨日のホッケーでは我々のチームは攻められる一方だった。
english: In yesterday's hockey match, our team was always on the defensive.

translation: Only; always; continue to; keep ~ing; be steadily ~ing; become ~er and ~er
explanation: A phrase indicating that “something happens continuously” or “someone does something repeatedly”.
japanese: 私たちはいつも子供や犬のことでお隣に迷惑をかける一方なので、申し訳なく思う。
reading: 私たちはいつも子供や犬のことでお隣に迷惑をかける一方なので、申し訳なく思う。
english: We feel sorry for our next door neighbours because our children and our dog are always giving them trouble.

translation: While; when; (but) at the same time; on the other hand; even though; although
explanation: A conjunction used to present two concurrent actions/events/states or contrastive situations.
japanese: 我々は化石燃料による環境汚染の問題に対応する一方（で）、新しいエネルギーの開発に力を入れなければならない。
reading: 我々は化石燃料による環境汚染の問題に対応する一方（で）、新しいエネルギーの開発に力を入れなければならない。
english: We have to make more effort in developing new energy (sources) while countering the problem of environmental pollution caused by fossil fuels.

translation: While; when; (but) at the same time; on the other hand; even though; although
explanation: A conjunction used to present two concurrent actions/events/states or contrastive situations.
japanese: 企業はIT投資には熱心な一方（で）、セキュリティ意識はまだ低いところが多い。
reading: 企業はIT投資には熱心な一方（で）、セキュリティ意識はまだ低いところが多い。
english: Many companies are still not very conscious about (information) security, even though they are eager to invest in information technology.

translation: While; when; (but) at the same time; on the other hand; even though; although
explanation: A conjunction used to present two concurrent actions/events/states or contrastive situations.
japanese: 軍事予算拡大の一方（で）、教育や社会福祉関連は大きく切り捨てられた。
reading: 軍事予算拡大の一方（で）、教育や社会福祉関連は大きく切り捨てられた。
english: While the military budget has increased, budgets related to education and social welfare have been cut drastically.

translation: While; when; (but) at the same time; on the other hand; even though; although
explanation: A conjunction used to present two concurrent actions/events/states or contrastive situations.
japanese: 日本は工作機械の分野では依然優位に立っている。しかしその一方（で）、最終製品の生産でシェアを下げつつある。
reading: 日本は工作機械の分野では依然優位に立っている。しかしその一方（で）、最終製品の生産でシェアを下げつつある。
english: Japan maintains its superiority in the ﬁeld of machine tools. However (literally: However, on the other hand), its (market) share in the production of ﬁnished goods is falling.

translation: While; when; (but) at the same time; on the other hand; even though; although
explanation: A conjunction used to present two concurrent actions/events/states or contrastive situations.
japanese: テレビはソファに深々ともたれ「後傾姿勢で受動的」に見る。一方、インターネットは椅子に浅く腰を掛け「前傾姿勢で能動的」にやる。
reading: テレビはソファに深々ともたれ「後傾姿勢で受動的」に見る。一方、インターネットは椅子に浅く腰を掛け「前傾姿勢で能動的」にやる。
english: Sinking into your sofa, you watch TV passively, while leaning back. On the other hand, the Internet is something you do actively in a forward leaning position, while sitting on the edge of your chair.

translation: While; when; (but) at the same time; on the other hand; even though; although
explanation: A conjunction used to present two concurrent actions/events/states or contrastive situations.
japanese: 我が社は新製品を開発する一方で、多岐にわたる現在のモデルを少数に統合する計画だ。
reading: 我が社は新製品を開発する一方で、多岐にわたる現在のモデルを少数に統合する計画だ。
english: At our company we plan to consolidate our present broad range of models into only a few, while at the same time developing new products.

translation: While; when; (but) at the same time; on the other hand; even though; although
explanation: A conjunction used to present two concurrent actions/events/states or contrastive situations.
japanese: 政府は各種の予算を削減している一方、無駄遣いも目につく。
reading: 政府は各種の予算を削減している一方、無駄遣いも目につく。
english: While on the one hand the government is reducing its various budgets, on the other, it's wasteful spending becomes more noticeable.

translation: While; when; (but) at the same time; on the other hand; even though; although
explanation: A conjunction used to present two concurrent actions/events/states or contrastive situations.
japanese: 就職できない若者がたくさんいる一方で、国民の生活に欠かせない仕事の分野で人手が不足しているそうだ。
reading: 就職できない若者がたくさんいる一方で、国民の生活に欠かせない仕事の分野で人手が不足しているそうだ。
english: While a lot of young people cannot ﬁnd a job, it is said that there is a shortage of manpower in fields essential for maintaining people's lifestyles.

translation: While; when; (but) at the same time; on the other hand; even though; although
explanation: A conjunction used to present two concurrent actions/events/states or contrastive situations.
japanese: 花粉症は完治が難しい一方、予防はしやすい。
reading: 花粉症は完治が難しい一方、予防はしやすい。
english: Although (literally: While) pollen allergies are hard to cure completely, they are easy to prevent.

translation: While; when; (but) at the same time; on the other hand; even though; although
explanation: A conjunction used to present two concurrent actions/events/states or contrastive situations.
japanese: 外国の食品がどこでも手に入るということは、便利な一方で、世界で食材不足を起こす危険性もある。
reading: 外国の食品がどこでも手に入るということは、便利な一方で、世界で食材不足を起こす危険性もある。
english: It is convenient to be able to buy foreign foods anywhere but, at the same time, there is the danger of causing a shortage of foodstuff world-wide.

translation: While; when; (but) at the same time; on the other hand; even though; although
explanation: A conjunction used to present two concurrent actions/events/states or contrastive situations.
japanese: 日本では高齢人口が増加する一方、少年人口の減少が進んでいる。
reading: 日本では高齢人口が増加する一方、少年人口の減少が進んでいる。
english: In Japan, the elderly population is increasing, while the population of young people is decreasing.

translation: While; when; (but) at the same time; on the other hand; even though; although
explanation: A conjunction used to present two concurrent actions/events/states or contrastive situations.
japanese: 今日では海外に出かける日本人の数は、日本に来る外国人観光客の数の三倍もあります。しかしその一方で、海外から日本への観光客も、１９７０年以降、確実に増加しています。
reading: 今日では海外に出かける日本人の数は、日本に来る外国人観光客の数の三倍もあります。しかしその一方で、海外から日本への観光客も、１９７０年以降、確実に増加しています。
english: Today, the number of Japanese who go abroad is three times the number of foreign tourists who come to Japan. At the same time, the number of tourists who come to Japan from abroad has been increasing steadily since 1970.

translation: While; when; (but) at the same time; on the other hand; even though; although
explanation: A conjunction used to present two concurrent actions/events/states or contrastive situations.
japanese: 情報というものは簡単に複製し共有することができる。一方、物理的なモノの場合は、完全に複製するのは容易ではない。
reading: 情報というものは簡単に複製し共有することができる。一方、物理的なモノの場合は、完全に複製するのは容易ではない。
english: Information is something that can be easily reproduced and shared. Physical objects, on the other hand, are not so easily reproduced.

translation: Since
explanation: An adverb meaning “since”
japanese: 大統領の支持率が就任以来最低となった。
reading: 大統領の支持率が<ruby title="就任(しゅうにん)"><rb>就任</rb><rt>しゅうにん</rt></ruby>以来最低となった。
english: The president's approval ratings have hit their lowest level since his presidency began.

translation: Since
explanation: An adverb meaning “since”
japanese: G社が、創業以来初めてホームページのデザインを変更した。
reading: G社が、創業以来初めてホームページのデザインを変更した。
english: Company G changed the design of its homepage for the ﬁrst time since it opened for business.

translation: Since
explanation: An adverb meaning “since”
japanese: 植村に会うのは十年前の高校のクラス会以来だ。
reading: <ruby title="植村(うえむら)"><rb>植村</rb><rt>うえむら</rt></ruby>に会うのは十年前の高校のクラス会以来だ。
english: This will be the ﬁrst time since our high school class reunion 10 years ago that I've seen Uemura.

translation: Since
explanation: An adverb meaning “since”
japanese: 二年ほど前に重いスーツケースを持ち上げようとして腰を痛めてしまった。それ以来、重いものは持てなくなった。
reading: 二年ほど前に重いスーツケースを持ち上げようとして<ruby title="腰(こし)"><rb>腰</rb><rt>こし</rt></ruby>を痛めてしまった。それ以来、重いものは持てなくなった。
english: About two years ago I damaged my back when I tried to lift a heavy suitcase. Since then I haven't been able to lift heavy things.

translation: Since
explanation: An adverb meaning “since”
japanese: 国の教育ローンの利用者が制度発足以来初めて三百万人を超えた。
reading: 国の教育ローンの利用者が制度発足以来初めて三百万人を超えた。
english: The number of users of the state's education loan (program) has exceeded 3 million for the ﬁrst time since the inauguration of the system.

translation: Since
explanation: An adverb meaning “since”
japanese: 当ホテルは、明治42年創業以来９０年の歴史を持っています。
reading: 当ホテルは、明治42年創業以来９０年の歴史を持っています。
english: Our hotel boasts a 90-year history, having been established in the 42nd year of Meiji.

translation: Since
explanation: An adverb meaning “since”
japanese: 半導体市場は９５年以来の二桁成長が予測されている。
reading: 半導体市場は９５年以来の二桁成長が予測されている。
english: Two-digit growth is predicted in the semiconductor market for the ﬁrst time since 1995.

translation: Since
explanation: An adverb meaning “since”
japanese: ジョンソン氏が社長に就任して以来、この会社は次々に大きな改革を行った。
reading: ジョンソン氏が社長に就任して以来、この会社は次々に大きな<ruby title="改革(かいかく)"><rb>改革</rb><rt>かいかく</rt></ruby>を行った。
english: Since Mr. Johnson became president, this company has carried out one major reform after another.

translation: Since
explanation: An adverb meaning “since”
japanese: 生の舞台を見て以来、すっかり歌舞伎のファンになってしまった。
reading: <ruby title="生(なま)"><rb>生</rb><rt>なま</rt></ruby>の<ruby title="舞台(ぶたい)"><rb>舞台</rb><rt>ぶたい</rt></ruby>を見て以来、すっかり歌舞伎のファンになってしまった。
english: Ever since seeing my first live performance, I've become a big fan of kabuki.

translation: Since
explanation: An adverb meaning “since”
japanese: この空港始まって以来の大事故となった。
reading: この空港始まって以来の大事故となった。
english: This is the worst accident since this airport opened.

translation: Since
explanation: An adverb meaning “since”
japanese: 先週清美と大げんかをした。それ以来、彼女とは口をきいていない。
reading: 先週 清美[きよみ]と大げんかをした。それ以来、彼女とは口をきいていない。
english: I had a ferocious quarrel with Kiyomi last week. Since then, I haven't talked to her.
extra_notes: 口を利く = to speak (to, with); to utter

translation: Not ~ at all; absolutely not; not ~ whatsoever
explanation: A structure that means “not at all”.
japanese: 飛行機事故の原因は一切分からない。
reading: 飛行機事故の原因は一切分からない。
english: We have no idea what caused the airplane accident.

translation: Not ~ at all; absolutely not; not ~ whatsoever
explanation: A structure that means “not at all”.
japanese: この製品には遺伝子組み換え大豆は一切使用していません。
reading: この製品には遺伝子組み換え大豆は一切使用していません。
english: For this product we haven't used any genetically modiﬁed soybeans at all.

translation: Not ~ at all; absolutely not; not ~ whatsoever
explanation: A structure that means “not at all”.
japanese: 盗難に関しては当社は一切責任を負いません。
reading: 盗難に関しては当社は一切責任を負いません。
english: Our company will not take any responsibility whatsoever for thefts.

translation: Not ~ at all; absolutely not; not ~ whatsoever
explanation: A structure that means “not at all”.
japanese: 私はその汚職事件とは一切関係ない。
reading: 私はその汚職事件とは一切関係ない。
english: I have nothing whatsoever to do with the bribery scandal.

translation: Not ~ at all; absolutely not; not ~ whatsoever
explanation: A structure that means “not at all”.
japanese: 謝金は一切いただくわけにはまいりません。
reading: 謝金は一切いただくわけにはまいりません。
english: I couldn't possibly accept any honorarium at all.

translation: Not ~ at all; absolutely not; not ~ whatsoever
explanation: A structure that means “not at all”.
japanese: 私は有害物質を一切含んでいない洗剤を使うことにしている。
reading: 私は有害物質を一切含んでいない洗剤を使うことにしている。
english: I make it a rule to use detergents that contain no harmful ingredients.

translation: Once; for a time; temporarily; for the moment; for the present; now
explanation: An adverb meaning “once” or “for a short time”.
japanese: このは小説一旦読み始めたらやめられない。
reading: この小説は一旦読み始めたらやめられない。
english: Once you begin reading this novel, you won't be able to put it down (literally: stop reading it).

translation: Once; for a time; temporarily; for the moment; for the present; now
explanation: An adverb meaning “once” or “for a short time”.
japanese: 邦彦は一旦やめたタバコをまた吸い出した。
reading: <ruby title="邦彦(くにひこ)"><rb>邦彦</rb><rt>くにひこ</rt></ruby>は一旦やめたタバコをまた吸い出した。
english: Kunihiko resumed smoking, which he had quit for a time.

translation: Once; for a time; temporarily; for the moment; for the present; now
explanation: An adverb meaning “once” or “for a short time”.
japanese: 開演までまだだいぶ時間があるので、一旦ホテルに帰ってから出直そう。
reading: 開演までまだだいぶ時間があるので、一旦ホテルに帰ってから出直そう。
english: There's still a lot of time before the performance begins, so let's go back to the hotel for the moment and come again later.

translation: Once; for a time; temporarily; for the moment; for the present; now
explanation: An adverb meaning “once” or “for a short time”.
japanese: この大学は、一旦入学してしまえば、そんなに勉強しなくても必ず卒業できる。
reading: この大学は、一旦入学してしまえば、そんなに勉強しなくても必ず卒業できる。
english: Once you've entered this university, you will definitely be able to graduate, even if you don't study very hard.

translation: Once; for a time; temporarily; for the moment; for the present; now
explanation: An adverb meaning “once” or “for a short time”.
japanese: この電子掲示板は一旦書き込むと消せないので、自分のメッセージを書く時に注意しないといけない。
reading: この電子掲示板は一旦書き込むと消せないので、自分のメッセージを書く時に注意しないといけない。
english: Once you write a message on this electronic bulletin board, you cannot delete it, so you have to be careful (when you write a message).

translation: Once; for a time; temporarily; for the moment; for the present; now
explanation: An adverb meaning “once” or “for a short time”.
japanese: 石田は、一旦約束した以上は必ず守る男だ。
reading: 石田は、一旦約束した以上は必ず守る男だ。
english: Ishida is someone who keeps his promise (once he has made one), no matter what.

translation: Once; for a time; temporarily; for the moment; for the present; now
explanation: An adverb meaning “once” or “for a short time”.
japanese: 一旦こじれた我々の関係は、容易には元に戻らなかった。
reading: 一旦拗れた我々の関係は、容易には元に戻らなかった。
english: Our relationship, once it had become complicated, did not recover easily.

translation: Once; for a time; temporarily; for the moment; for the present; now
explanation: An adverb meaning “once” or “for a short time”.
japanese: 予算が厳しくなったので、無料健康相談サービスを一旦中止します。
reading: 予算が厳しくなったので、無料健康相談サービスを一旦中止します。
english: Because the budget has become tight, we are going to discontinue our free health consultation service temporarily.

translation: Once; for a time; temporarily; for the moment; for the present; now
explanation: An adverb meaning “once” or “for a short time”.
japanese: 新型ウイルスの被害は一旦終息したように見えた。
reading: 新型ウイルスの被害は一旦終息したように見えた。
english: It appeared that damage from the new virus had subsided temporarily.

translation: Once; for a time; temporarily; for the moment; for the present; now
explanation: An adverb meaning “once” or “for a short time”.
japanese: ひょっとすると違う原因かもしれないので、今飲んでいる薬を一旦やめてしばらく様子を見てみましょう。
reading: ひょっとすると違う原因かもしれないので、今飲んでいる薬を一旦やめてしばらく様子を見てみましょう。
english: There might be a different cause, so stop taking the current drug for the moment and see what happens.

translation: Once; for a time; temporarily; for the moment; for the present; now
explanation: An adverb meaning “once” or “for a short time”.
japanese: 今使っているプログラムを一旦終了して、再起動してみて下さい。
reading: 今使っているプログラムを一旦終了して、再起動してみて下さい。
english: Please quit the program you are using now temporarily and reboot.

translation: Once; for a time; temporarily; for the moment; for the present; now
explanation: An adverb meaning “once” or “for a short time”.
japanese: 一旦日本へ帰って、親と相談してからアメリカで就職するかどうかを決めたい。
reading: 一旦日本へ帰って、親と相談してからアメリカで就職するかどうかを決めたい。
english: I'd like to go back to Japan for a time and, after talking to my parents, decide whether or not I'll look for a job in the U.S.

translation: Figuratively speaking; so to speak; metaphorically speaking; in a manner of saying
explanation: A phrase signalling a comparison (including the use of simile and metaphor), a deﬁnition, or an explanation.
japanese: 言ってみれば、人生は航海（のようなもの）だ。
reading: 言ってみれば、人生は航海（のようなもの）だ。
english: Figuratively speaking, life is (like) a voyage.

translation: Figuratively speaking; so to speak; metaphorically speaking; in a manner of saying
explanation: A phrase signalling a comparison (including the use of simile and metaphor), a deﬁnition, or an explanation.
japanese: 彼女の家は、言ってみれば、お城のように作られている。
reading: 彼女の家は、言ってみれば、お城のように作られている。
english: You could say her house is built like a castle.

translation: Figuratively speaking; so to speak; metaphorically speaking; in a manner of saying
explanation: A phrase signalling a comparison (including the use of simile and metaphor), a deﬁnition, or an explanation.
japanese: 日本の文化には厳しいしきたりがあって、言ってみれば、それは宗教のようなものだ。
reading: 日本の文化には厳しいしきたりがあって、言ってみれば、それは宗教のようなものだ。
english: Japanese culture has a set of strict conventions; you could almost call it a religion.

translation: Figuratively speaking; so to speak; metaphorically speaking; in a manner of saying
explanation: A phrase signalling a comparison (including the use of simile and metaphor), a deﬁnition, or an explanation.
japanese: 結婚は言ってみれば人生の墓場だ。
reading: 結婚は言ってみれば人生の墓場だ。
english: Marriage is, in a manner of speaking, the graveyard of life.

translation: Figuratively speaking; so to speak; metaphorically speaking; in a manner of saying
explanation: A phrase signalling a comparison (including the use of simile and metaphor), a deﬁnition, or an explanation.
japanese: 医者と弁護士は、言ってみれば、神様のように振る舞う。
reading: 医者と弁護士は、言ってみれば、神様のように振る舞う。
english: One could say medical doctors and lawyers act like God.

translation: Figuratively speaking; so to speak; metaphorically speaking; in a manner of saying
explanation: A phrase signalling a comparison (including the use of simile and metaphor), a deﬁnition, or an explanation.
japanese: 学生たちが学んだ多くの知識は、頭の中に放置されたままで、言ってみれば、死んだ状態になっているのである。
reading: 学生たちが学んだ多くの知識は、頭の中に放置されたままで、言ってみれば、死んだ状態になっているのである。
english: A lot of the knowledge that students have learned remains piled up in their brains, and ﬁguratively speaking, it is dead to them.

translation: Figuratively speaking; so to speak; metaphorically speaking; in a manner of saying
explanation: A phrase signalling a comparison (including the use of simile and metaphor), a deﬁnition, or an explanation.
japanese: シリコンバレーも、結局は日本の、言ってみれば商店街なり地域作りの話と本質的には同じなんだと思いました。
reading: シリコンバレーも、結局は日本の、言ってみれば<ruby title="商店(しょうてん)"><rb>商店</rb><rt>しょうてん</rt></ruby> <ruby title="街(がい)"><rb>街</rb><rt>がい</rt></ruby>なり地域作りの話と本質的には同じなんだと思いました。
english: I would say Silicon Valley is, after all, essentially the same story as commercial district or community development in Japan.

translation: Figuratively speaking; so to speak; metaphorically speaking; in a manner of saying
explanation: A phrase signalling a comparison (including the use of simile and metaphor), a deﬁnition, or an explanation.
japanese: 著作権とは、言ってみれば、創造者の権利を守る法律だ。
reading: 著作権とは、言ってみれば、創造者の権利を守る法律だ。
english: Copyright can be thought of as a law to protect the rights of creators.

translation: Figuratively speaking; so to speak; metaphorically speaking; in a manner of saying
explanation: A phrase signalling a comparison (including the use of simile and metaphor), a deﬁnition, or an explanation.
japanese: このブログは言ってみれば僕の絵日記のようなものだ。
reading: このブログは言ってみれば僕の<ruby title="絵日記(えにっき)"><rb>絵日記</rb><rt>えにっき</rt></ruby>のようなものだ。
english: I like thinking of this blog as my picture journal.

translation: It is needless to say that ~; needless to say; it goes without saying
explanation: A phrase indicating that what the speaker/writer expresses is generally known but that he/she presents it as a reminder.
japanese: 寿司が日本の代表的な料理であることは言うまでもない。
reading: 寿司が日本の代表的な料理であることは言うまでもない。
english: It goes without saying that sushi is representative of Japanese cuisine.

translation: It is needless to say that ~; needless to say; it goes without saying
explanation: A phrase indicating that what the speaker/writer expresses is generally known but that he/she presents it as a reminder.
japanese: 言うまでもなく、日本の社会は世界一の高齢化社会になっている。
reading: 言うまでもなく、日本の社会は世界一の高齢化社会になっている。
english: That Japan has become the most rapidly aging society in the world goes without saying.

translation: It is needless to say that ~; needless to say; it goes without saying
explanation: A phrase indicating that what the speaker/writer expresses is generally known but that he/she presents it as a reminder.
japanese: 少子化が日本の社会を変えていくことは言うまでもない。
reading: 少子化が日本の社会を変えていくことは言うまでもない。
english: It goes without saying that the shrinking population of children will change Japanese society.

translation: It is needless to say that ~; needless to say; it goes without saying
explanation: A phrase indicating that what the speaker/writer expresses is generally known but that he/she presents it as a reminder.
japanese: 「アジアの人々は貧しい」「貧しいのは可哀想」「開発援助しなくては」という固定観念が有害なのは言うまでありません。
reading: 「アジアの人々は貧しい」「貧しいのは可哀想」「開発援助しなくては」という固定観念が有害なのは言うまでありません。
english: The set of ﬁxed ideas that "Asians are poor,” "Being poor is pitiable,” and "We should provide development assistance,” is, needless to say, harmful.

translation: It is needless to say that ~; needless to say; it goes without saying
explanation: A phrase indicating that what the speaker/writer expresses is generally known but that he/she presents it as a reminder.
japanese: 二人はパーティーで会って、すぐ意気投合しました。そのあと毎日のようにデートをしたのは言うまでもありません。
reading: 二人はパーティーで会って、すぐ意気投合しました。そのあと毎日のようにデートをしたのは言うまでもありません。
english: The two met at a party, and right away they hit it off. I hardly need to mention that after that they went out on a date almost every day.

translation: It is needless to say that ~; needless to say; it goes without saying
explanation: A phrase indicating that what the speaker/writer expresses is generally known but that he/she presents it as a reminder.
japanese: オープンネットワークコンピューティング環境では、日々増大するネットワークデータをいかに敏速にかつ効率よくバックアップするかが重要であることは言うまでもありません。
reading: オープンネットワークコンピューティング環境では、日々増大するネットワークデータをいかに敏速にかつ効率よくバックアップするかが重要であることは言うまでもありません。
english: Needless to say, in an open network computing environment, it is important how quickly and effectively you back up the continually expanding network data.

translation: It is needless to say that ~; needless to say; it goes without saying
explanation: A phrase indicating that what the speaker/writer expresses is generally known but that he/she presents it as a reminder.
japanese: 言うまでもありませんが、大学の成績の優秀な学生が社会で成功するとは限りません。
reading: 言うまでもありませんが、大学の成績の優秀な学生が社会で成功するとは限りません。
english: Needless to say, students whose grades in college were superb do not always succeed in society.

translation: It is needless to say that ~; needless to say; it goes without saying
explanation: A phrase indicating that what the speaker/writer expresses is generally known but that he/she presents it as a reminder.
japanese: いまさら言うまでもなく、地球の温暖化は生態系に悪影響をもたらしている。
reading: いまさら言うまでもなく、地球の温暖化は生態系に悪影響をもたらしている。
english: It's obvious now, but global warming is having an adverse effect on the ecosystem.

translation: It is needless to say that ~; needless to say; it goes without saying
explanation: A phrase indicating that what the speaker/writer expresses is generally known but that he/she presents it as a reminder.
japanese: 菜穂子はとびきりの美人でもなかったが、誰とでもにこやかに話し、いつも溌溂としていた。言うまでもないことだが、彼女の周りには人が自然に集まり、職場のみんなにも好かれていた。
reading: 菜穂子はとびきりの美人でもなかったが、誰とでもにこやかに話し、いつも溌溂としていた。言うまでもないことだが、彼女の周りには人が自然に集まり、職場のみんなにも好かれていた。
english: Nahoko was not especially beautiful, but she had a smile for everybody and was always cheerful. Needless to say, people spontaneously gathered around her, and everybody at her ofﬁce loved her.

translation: So to speak; as it were; like; sort of
explanation: An adverb that means “if I were to say it some way (or a different way)”.
japanese: この本は、言わば私のバイブルだ。
reading: この本は、言わば私のバイブルだ。
english: This is, as it were, my Bible.

translation: So to speak; as it were; like; sort of
explanation: An adverb that means “if I were to say it some way (or a different way)”.
japanese: この試験は言わばアメリカの大学に留学する際のTOEFLに当たる。
reading: この試験は言わばアメリカの大学に留学する際のTOEFLに当たる。
english: This test is, so to speak, the equivalent of the TOEFL, which people take when they (want to) study at a university in the U.S.
extra_notes: に当たる here means, "〔相当する・対応する〕 be equal [equivalent] 《to…》; correspond [answer] to…"

translation: So to speak; as it were; like; sort of
explanation: An adverb that means “if I were to say it some way (or a different way)”.
japanese: ここまでは、言わばウォーミングアップのようなもので、ここからが本番だ。
reading: ここまでは、言わばウォーミングアップのようなもので、ここからが本番だ。
english: This has been sort of a warm-up, and starting now, the real business begins.

translation: So to speak; as it were; like; sort of
explanation: An adverb that means “if I were to say it some way (or a different way)”.
japanese: その判決は言わばこの国の良心を代弁したものだった。
reading: その判決は言わばこの国の良心を代弁したものだった。
english: The court's ruling was something that represented this country's conscience, so to speak.

translation: So to speak; as it were; like; sort of
explanation: An adverb that means “if I were to say it some way (or a different way)”.
japanese: 言わば趣味で始めたことがいつの間にか大きなビジネスになってしまった。
reading: 言わば<ruby title="趣味(しゅみ)"><rb>趣味</rb><rt>しゅみ</rt></ruby>で始めたことがいつの間にか大きなビジネスになってしまった。
english: What I started as sort of a hobby became a large-scale business before I knew it.

translation: So to speak; as it were; like; sort of
explanation: An adverb that means “if I were to say it some way (or a different way)”.
japanese: 当地区には、言わば幽霊人口である非合法居住者が7~10万人いますが、この人たちは補助金対象外となります。
reading: 当地区には、言わば幽霊人口である非合法居住者が7~10万人いますが、この人たちは補助金対象外となります。
english: In this district there are 70,000 to 100,000 illegal residents, who form, as it were, a ghost population. These people are not eligible to receive assistance subsidies.

translation: So to speak; as it were; like; sort of
explanation: An adverb that means “if I were to say it some way (or a different way)”.
japanese: こうして見てみると、かつてはサダム・フセインも、ソ連やイランと戦ってきた、言わばアメリカの盟友だったわけである。
reading: こうして見てみると、かつてはサダム・フセインも、ソ連やイランと戦ってきた、言わばアメリカの盟友だったわけである。
english: When we view it this way, the fact is that Saddam Hussein, who fought against Soviet Russia and Iran, used to be America's bosom buddy, so to speak.

translation: So to speak; as it were; like; sort of
explanation: An adverb that means “if I were to say it some way (or a different way)”.
japanese: ファッション写真は、１９３０年代までは、言わば「新参者」の分野と見られていたらしい。
reading: ファッション写真は、１９３０年代までは、言わば「新参者」の分野と見られていたらしい。
english: Up to the 1930s, fashion photography was apparently considered a "newcomer” ﬁeld, so to speak.

translation: So-called; what we call; known as
explanation: A noun modifier that means “known generally by this term”.
japanese: 伊藤さんはいわゆる「エリート」の大学を卒業した。
reading: <ruby title="伊藤(いとう)"><rb>伊藤</rb><rt>いとう</rt></ruby>さんはいわゆる「エリート」の大学を卒業した。
english: Ms. Ito graduated from one of the so-called "elite” universities.

translation: So-called; what we call; known as
explanation: A noun modifier that means “known generally by this term”.
japanese: いわゆるリストラのために失業した人は非常に多い。
reading: いわゆるリストラのために失業した人は非常に多い。
english: Many people lost their jobs because of what is called restructuring.

translation: So-called; what we call; known as
explanation: A noun modifier that means “known generally by this term”.
japanese: 1986年から９０年代初めにかけてのいわゆる「バブル経済」の時代には土地や株が高騰した。
reading: 1986年から９０年代初めにかけてのいわゆる「バブル経済」の時代には土地や株が高騰した。
english: During the so-called "bubble economy,” from 1986 through the early 90's, land and stocks prices soared.

translation: So-called; what we call; known as
explanation: A noun modifier that means “known generally by this term”.
japanese: 21世紀には多くの国でいわゆる安楽死が合法化されていくだろう。
reading: 21世紀には多くの国でいわゆる安楽死が合法化されていくだろう。
english: In the 21st century what is called euthanasia will be legalized in many countries.

translation: So-called; what we call; known as
explanation: A noun modifier that means “known generally by this term”.
japanese: いわゆる「いじめ」の問題は、自分と異なる人間を認めるメンタリティーが日本に根づかないと容易にはなくならないであろう。
reading: いわゆる「いじめ」の問題は、自分と異なる人間を認めるメンタリティーが日本に根づかないと容易にはなくならないであろう。
english: The problem we know as bullying will not easily be solved unless the mentality of accepting someone different from oneself takes root in Japan.

translation: So-called; what we call; known as
explanation: A noun modifier that means “known generally by this term”.
japanese: いわゆるIT、すなわち情報技術の開発に、日本政府は本腰を入れ始めた。
reading: いわゆるIT、すなわち情報技術の開発に、日本政府は本腰を入れ始めた。
english: The Japanese government has started to put its weight behind developing "IT,” or information technology.
extra_notes: 入れる here means to accept; to comply; to grant; to adopt (a policy, etc.); to take (advice, etc.); to listen to; to pay attention to

translation: So-called; what we call; known as
explanation: A noun modifier that means “known generally by this term”.
japanese: 内分泌撹乱化学物質、いわゆる環境ホルモンは、人間と野生生物へ悪影響を与えると言われている。
reading: 内分泌撹乱化学物質、いわゆる環境ホルモンは、人間と野生生物へ<ruby title="悪影響(あくえいきょう)"><rb>悪影響</rb><rt>あくえいきょう</rt></ruby>を与えると言われている。
english: Endocrine disrupting chemicals, also known as environmental hormones, are said to adversely affect humans and wildlife.

translation: Oneself; in and of itself; the very
explanation: A dependent noun that is used to emphasize the referent of the preceding noun.
japanese: インターネット自体は情報の通路であって、内容は持たない。
reading: インターネット自体は情報の通路であって、内容は持たない。
english: The Internet is a path for information and does not contain any content itself.

translation: Oneself; in and of itself; the very
explanation: A dependent noun that is used to emphasize the referent of the preceding noun.
japanese: 私にとってはこの試合に出られること自体が光栄なことです。
reading: 私にとってはこの試合に出られること自体が光栄なことです。
english: For me, being able to participate in this match in and of itself is an honour.

translation: Oneself; in and of itself; the very
explanation: A dependent noun that is used to emphasize the referent of the preceding noun.
japanese: ケータイ自体には問題はない。問題は使う人のマナーや気配りだ。
reading: ケータイ自体には問題はない。問題は使う人のマナーや気配りだ。
english: There is no problem with cell phones in and of themselves. The problems exist in the manners and considerateness of the users.

translation: Oneself; in and of itself; the very
explanation: A dependent noun that is used to emphasize the referent of the preceding noun.
japanese: いまの仕事自体には満足していますが、職場の人間関係がうまくいかず悩んでいます。
reading: いまの仕事自体には満足していますが、職場の人間関係がうまくいかず悩んでいます。
english: I'm satisﬁed with the job itself, but what troubles me is that I cannot maintain good relationships with the people at my workplace.

translation: Oneself; in and of itself; the very
explanation: A dependent noun that is used to emphasize the referent of the preceding noun.
japanese: 音声データ自体に異常があるので、どのプレーヤーで再生してもノイズが入ってしまう。
reading: <ruby title="音声(おんせい)"><rb>音声</rb><rt>おんせい</rt></ruby>データ自体に異常があるので、どのプレーヤーで再生してもノイズが入ってしまう。
english: The sound data itself contains some defects, so no matter what player you use to play it back, you'll get noise.

translation: Oneself; in and of itself; the very
explanation: A dependent noun that is used to emphasize the referent of the preceding noun.
japanese: 世の中が大きく変わった今、この組織の存在自体が疑われている。
reading: 世の中が大きく変わった今、この組織の存在自体が<ruby title="疑(うたが) "><rb>疑</rb><rt>うたが</rt></ruby>われている。
english: The world has changed greatly, and the very existence of this organization is now in doubt.

translation: Oneself; in and of itself; the very
explanation: A dependent noun that is used to emphasize the referent of the preceding noun.
japanese: この広告は、販売より広告それ自体が目的だ。
reading: この広告は、販売より広告それ自体が目的だ。
english: The goal of this advertisement is the advertisement (of the product) itself rather than sales.

translation: Oneself; in and of itself; the very
explanation: A dependent noun that is used to emphasize the referent of the preceding noun.
japanese: 裁判所はこれらのファイル交換ソフト自体の違法性は認められないという判決を下した。
reading: 裁判所はこれらのファイル交換ソフト自体の違法性は認められないという判決を下した。
english: The court ruled that these ﬁle-exchange software programs in and of themselves are not illegal.

translation: Oneself; in and of itself; the very
explanation: A dependent noun that is used to emphasize the referent of the preceding noun.
japanese: そういうところから金を借りること自体が間違っている。
reading: そういうところから金を借りること自体が間違っている。
english: The very act of borrowing money from that kind of place is wrong.

translation: Oneself; in and of itself; the very
explanation: A dependent noun that is used to emphasize the referent of the preceding noun.
japanese: 問題は個々の差別表現自体ではなく、そういう表現が出てくる背景なのだ。
reading: 問題は個々の差別表現自体ではなく、そういう表現が出てくる背景なのだ。
english: The problem is not the individual discriminatory expressions themselves, but the context from which they arise.

translation: Oneself; in and of itself; the very
explanation: A dependent noun that is used to emphasize the referent of the preceding noun.
japanese: 音楽のデジタル化やインターネット配信が音楽業界の主流になってきたが、私はそのこと自体は悪いことではないと思う。問題は、それによって不正コピーや大量配布がしやすくなったことだ。
reading: 音楽のデジタル化やインターネット配信が音楽業界の主流になってきたが、私はそのこと自体は悪いことではないと思う。問題は、それによって不正コピーや<ruby title="大量(たいりょう)"><rb>大量</rb><rt>たいりょう</rt></ruby> <ruby title="配布(はいふ)"><rb>配布</rb><rt>はいふ</rt></ruby>がしやすくなったことだ。
english: Music digitization and distribution via the Internet has become mainstream in the music industry, but I don't think that itself is a bad thing. The problem is that it has become easier to make illegal copies and mass-distribute them.

translation: extremely
explanation: A phrase that indicates the extreme degree of the speaker’s/writer’s emotion — happiness, sorrow, envy, shame or loneliness, among others
japanese: いろいろなところに行っておられるんですね。うらやましい限りです。
reading: いろいろなところに行っておられるんですね。うらやましい限りです。
english: You are traveling to all sorts of places. I'm extremely envious of you.

translation: extremely
explanation: A phrase that indicates the extreme degree of the speaker’s/writer’s emotion — happiness, sorrow, envy, shame or loneliness, among others
japanese: 電子メールでご連絡いただければ、嬉しい限りです。
reading: 電子メールでご連絡いただければ、嬉しい限りです。
english: I would be extremely happy if you would kindly contact me by e-mail.

translation: extremely
explanation: A phrase that indicates the extreme degree of the speaker’s/writer’s emotion — happiness, sorrow, envy, shame or loneliness, among others
japanese: あなたの明るい顔が見られなくなって、寂しい限りです。
reading: あなたの明るい顔が見られなくなって、寂しい限りです。
english: I cannot see your cheerful face any longer, and I couldn't feel lonelier.

translation: extremely
explanation: A phrase that indicates the extreme degree of the speaker’s/writer’s emotion — happiness, sorrow, envy, shame or loneliness, among others
japanese: 私がかいた絵をお見せするのはお恥ずかしい限りです。
reading: 私がかいた絵をお見せするのはお恥ずかしい限りです。
english: [a humble expression] It really makes me feel embarrassed to show you my painting.

translation: extremely
explanation: A phrase that indicates the extreme degree of the speaker’s/writer’s emotion — happiness, sorrow, envy, shame or loneliness, among others
japanese: その頃は大阪に単身赴任で行っていたが、家族から離れて夜一人でアパートで食事をするのはわびしい限りだった。
reading: その頃は大阪に単身赴任で行っていたが、家族から離れて夜一人でアパートで食事をするのはわびしい限りだった。
english: During that time I was working in Osaka, but leaving my family behind and eating dinner alone in my apartment made me feel so miserable.

translation: Worth; meaning; effect; result
explanation: A dependent noun that means something is worth someone’s effort.
japanese: 日本語をよく勉強したかいがあって、日本語関係の会社に就職することができた。
reading: 日本語をよく勉強したかいがあって、日本語関係の会社に就職することができた。
english: It was worth studying Japanese hard because (literally: and) I was able to get a Japan-related job.

translation: Worth; meaning; effect; result
explanation: A dependent noun that means something is worth someone’s effort.
japanese: 社員一同の努力のかいがあって一時低調だった会社も上向きになった。
reading: 社員一同の努力のかいがあって一時低調だった会社も上向きになった。
english: The combined efforts of the company employees paid off, and the company, which had been in a slump for a while, started improving.

translation: Worth; meaning; effect; result
explanation: A dependent noun that means something is worth someone’s effort.
japanese: あなたにとって生きがいとは何ですか。
reading: あなたにとって生きがいとは何ですか。
english: What makes life worth living for you?

translation: Worth; meaning; effect; result
explanation: A dependent noun that means something is worth someone’s effort.
japanese: 彼は東南アジア諸国の旅行中、毎日詳しく日記をつけておいた。そのかいがあって、日本に戻って旅行記を書く時にとても書きやすかった。
reading: 彼は東南アジア諸国の旅行中、毎日詳しく日記をつけておいた。そのかいがあって、日本に戻って旅行記を書く時にとても書きやすかった。
english: He kept a detailed diary during his trip to South East Asia. It paid off, as it made it easy for him to write his travelogue when he returned to Japan.

translation: Worth; meaning; effect; result
explanation: A dependent noun that means something is worth someone’s effort.
japanese: 一生懸命やったかいがあって、マラソン大会ごとに順位が上がってきました。
reading: 一生懸命やったかいがあって、マラソン大会ごとに順位が上がってきました。
english: My efforts paid off, and I finished higher in the ranking with each race.

translation: Worth; meaning; effect; result
explanation: A dependent noun that means something is worth someone’s effort.
japanese: 寒い中待っていたかいがあって、見事な日の出を見ることができた。
reading: 寒い中待っていたかいがあって、見事な日の出を見ることができた。
english: Waiting in the cold paid off, as I was able to see a wonderful sunrise.

translation: Worth; meaning; effect; result
explanation: A dependent noun that means something is worth someone’s effort.
japanese: せっかく富士山に登ったのに頂上からは下が全然見えず、登ったかいがなかった。
reading: せっかく富士山に登ったのに頂上からは下が全然見えず、登ったかいがなかった。
english: I climbed Mt. Fuji with great effort, but I couldn't see anything from the summit, so it wasn't worth the climb.

translation: Worth; meaning; effect; result
explanation: A dependent noun that means something is worth someone’s effort.
japanese: 弟は看病のかい(も)なく五歳の短い生涯を閉じた。
reading: 弟は看病のかい(も)なく五歳の短い生涯を閉じた。
english: In spite of all the medical care (he received), my little brother's life ended when he was only ﬁve.

translation: Worth; meaning; effect; result
explanation: A dependent noun that means something is worth someone’s effort.
japanese: 辛抱のかいがあって、運が開けた。
reading: 辛抱のかいがあって、運が開けた。
english: My patience paid off, and my fortunes have changed for the better.

translation: Worth; meaning; effect; result
explanation: A dependent noun that means something is worth someone’s effort.
japanese: この大学の学生はよく勉強するから、本当に教えがいがある。
reading: この大学の学生はよく勉強するから、本当に教えがいがある。
english: The students of this college study so hard that they are really worth teaching.

translation: Worth; meaning; effect; result
explanation: A dependent noun that means something is worth someone’s effort.
japanese: 私の料理をおいしく食べてくれる人がいるから、作りがいがあるのです。
reading: 私の料理をおいしく食べてくれる人がいるから、作りがいがあるのです。
english: Because there are people who enjoy eating my cooking, it is worth doing it.

translation: Worth; meaning; effect; result
explanation: A dependent noun that means something is worth someone’s effort.
japanese: 交通事故で脚に大怪我をして、毎日リハビリに通うことになった。そのかいがあって、今では元どおり歩けるようになった。
reading: 交通 事故で<ruby title="脚(あし)"><rb>脚</rb><rt>あし</rt></ruby>に 大怪我[おおけが]をして、毎日リハビリに<ruby title="通(かよ)"><rb>通</rb><rt>かよ</rt></ruby>うことになった。そのかいがあって、今では元どおり歩けるようになった。
english: My legs were injured in a trafﬁc accident, and I went to the hospital for rehabilitation every day. It paid off, and now I can walk as before.

translation: Whether X or not
explanation: A conjunctive phrase indicating that the speaker/writer is wondering whether something is the case or not.
japanese: このソフトが役に立つか否かは保証の限りではありません。
reading: このソフトが役に立つか否かは保証の限りではありません。
english: I cannot guarantee whether this software is useful or not.

translation: Whether X or not
explanation: A conjunctive phrase indicating that the speaker/writer is wondering whether something is the case or not.
japanese: 選挙の時に、有権者は候補者が倫理観のある政治家（である）か否かを見抜かなければならない。
reading: 選挙の時に、有権者は候補者が倫理観のある政治家（である）か否かを見抜かなければならない。
english: In an election, the voter has to judge (literally: see through) whether or not a candidate is a politician of integrity.

translation: Whether X or not
explanation: A conjunctive phrase indicating that the speaker/writer is wondering whether something is the case or not.
japanese: アメリカの大学では教授が外国人であるか否かは問題にならないが、日本ではそれがよく問題になるようだ。
reading: アメリカの大学では<ruby title="教授(きょうじゅ)"><rb>教授</rb><rt>きょうじゅ</rt></ruby>が外国人であるか否かは問題にならないが、日本ではそれがよく問題になるようだ。
english: In the U.S., whether or not a professor is a foreigner is not a problem, but in Japan, it appears that it is frequently an issue.

translation: Whether X or not
explanation: A conjunctive phrase indicating that the speaker/writer is wondering whether something is the case or not.
japanese: 子供に携帯電話を持たせるべきか否かは議論が分かれる。
reading: 子供に携帯電話を持たせるべきか否かは議論が分かれる。
english: Opinions differ as to whether we should allow a child to have a cell phone.
extra_notes: 分かれる here is "to branch off from" and "to divide into two", and not the potential form of 分かる

translation: Whether X or not
explanation: A conjunctive phrase indicating that the speaker/writer is wondering whether something is the case or not.
japanese: 家を探す場合、その地域が安全であるか否かが一番大事なポイントになる。
reading: 家を探す場合、その地域が安全であるか否かが一番大事なポイントになる。
english: When you search for a house, whether or not the area is safe is the most important point.

translation: Whether X or not
explanation: A conjunctive phrase indicating that the speaker/writer is wondering whether something is the case or not.
japanese: クラシック音楽を聞く時、私は旋律が美しいか否かよりその音楽が生命を感じさせるか否かに注意を払う。
reading: クラシック音楽を聞く時、私は旋律が美しいか否かよりその音楽が生命を感じさせるか否かに注意を払う。
english: When I listen to classical music, I pay attention to whether or not it causes me to feel life rather than whether or not the melody is beautiful.

translation: Whether X or not
explanation: A conjunctive phrase indicating that the speaker/writer is wondering whether something is the case or not.
japanese: 大学の入試要項をよく読んでから受験するか否かを決めるべきだ。
reading: 大学の入試要項をよく読んでから受験するか否かを決めるべきだ。
english: You should decide whether or not to take the entrance examination after reading the university's guidelines carefully.

translation: Whether X or not
explanation: A conjunctive phrase indicating that the speaker/writer is wondering whether something is the case or not.
japanese: 愛されたら愛しかえすべきか否かという疑問は愚問です。
reading: 愛されたら愛しかえすべきか否かという疑問は愚問です。
english: The question of whether or not one should return love when one is loved is a silly one.

translation: Whether X or not
explanation: A conjunctive phrase indicating that the speaker/writer is wondering whether something is the case or not.
japanese: 容疑者に遺体を見せると、真犯人か否かが分かることがある。
reading: 容疑者に遺体を見せると、真犯人か否かが分かることがある。
english: There are cases in which you can tell whether or not a suspect is the real culprit when you show him or her the dead body.

translation: How ~ !; what a(n) ~ !; to my/our ~; it is ~ that
explanation: An interjection that expresses deep felt emotion.
japanese: 悲しいかな、年を取って往年の記憶力がなくなってしまった。
reading: 悲しいかな、年を取って往年の記憶力がなくなってしまった。
english: How sad (it is) that I no longer have as strong a memory as I had in my younger days.

translation: How ~ !; what a(n) ~ !; to my/our ~; it is ~ that
explanation: An interjection that expresses deep felt emotion.
japanese: 悲しいかな、自分の能力を過大評価する人間がいる。
reading: 悲しいかな、自分の能力を過大評価する人間がいる。
english: It's so sad that there are people who overestimate their ability.

translation: How ~ !; what a(n) ~ !; to my/our ~; it is ~ that
explanation: An interjection that expresses deep felt emotion.
japanese: インターネットを使うといろいろ面白いことが分かるそうですが、惜しいかな、私はコンピュータを買うお金がないんです。
reading: インターネットを使うといろいろ面白いことが分かるそうですが、惜しいかな、私はコンピュータを買うお金がないんです。
english: They say that you can find out many interesting things if you use the Internet, but, to my great regret, I don't have the money to buy a computer.

translation: How ~ !; what a(n) ~ !; to my/our ~; it is ~ that
explanation: An interjection that expresses deep felt emotion.
japanese: 画面では絵も動きます。チャットもできます。惜しいかな、全部英語ですが。
reading: 画面では絵も動きます。チャットもできます。惜しいかな、全部英語ですが。
english: On the screen, pictures move, and you can chat, too. Regrettably, everything is in English.

translation: How ~ !; what a(n) ~ !; to my/our ~; it is ~ that
explanation: An interjection that expresses deep felt emotion.
japanese: 秋の訪れを知ると共に、大空は広大なるかなと驚く。
reading: 秋の訪れを知ると共に、大空は広大なるかなと驚く。
english: With the coming of autumn, I am astonished by how broad the sky is.

translation: How ~ !; what a(n) ~ !; to my/our ~; it is ~ that
explanation: An interjection that expresses deep felt emotion.
japanese: みんな退職後の生活の甘いイメージを抱いている。しかし、残念なるかな、現実には、熟年離婚や体の不調にさいなまれている。
reading: みんな退職後の生活の甘いイメージを抱いている。しかし、残念なるかな、現実には、熟年離婚や体の不調にさいなまれている。
english: Everybody has a rosy image of post-retirement life. But, to our great regret, the reality is not as it seems; people are vexed by "vintage year divorce” and poor physical condition.

translation: How ~ !; what a(n) ~ !; to my/our ~; it is ~ that
explanation: An interjection that expresses deep felt emotion.
japanese: 途中に教会があったので期待して入ってみると、果たせるかな、クリスマス礼拝で荘厳な雰囲気であった。
reading: 途中に教会があったので期待して入ってみると、果たせるかな、クリスマス礼拝で荘厳な雰囲気であった。
english: There was a church on my way, so I entered it, hoping (for a feeling of Christmas). Just as I expected, there was a solemn atmosphere for the Christmas service.

translation: As if
explanation: A conjunctive phrase that forms an adverbial clause which describes the way someone/something appears to the writer, contrary to reality.
japanese: 彼女は(まるで)整形手術したかのようにきれいになった。
reading: 彼女は(まるで)整形手術したかのようにきれいになった。
english: Her looks improved, as though she had undergone cosmetic surgery.

translation: As if
explanation: A conjunctive phrase that forms an adverbial clause which describes the way someone/something appears to the writer, contrary to reality.
japanese: 彼女の病気は年内に治るかのように見えた。
reading: 彼女の病気は年内に治るかのように見えた。
english: It looked as though her illness would be cured before the end of the year.

translation: As if
explanation: A conjunctive phrase that forms an adverbial clause which describes the way someone/something appears to the writer, contrary to reality.
japanese: あたかも日本の製造業全体の競争力は強いかのように思われてきた。
reading: あたかも日本の製造業全体の競争力は強いかのように思われてきた。
english: The competitiveness of the Japanese manufacturing industry has been perceived as (though it were) strong.

translation: As if
explanation: A conjunctive phrase that forms an adverbial clause which describes the way someone/something appears to the writer, contrary to reality.
japanese: 彼は有能な政治学者であるかのように言われているが、実は無能極まりない。
reading: 彼は有能な政治学者であるかのように言われているが、実は無能極まりない。
english: People say (literally: he is spoken of as if) he is a capable political scientist, but actually he is extremely incapable.

translation: As if
explanation: A conjunctive phrase that forms an adverbial clause which describes the way someone/something appears to the writer, contrary to reality.
japanese: あの男は不確かなことをあたかも正確であるかのように断言する。
reading: あの男は不確かなことをあたかも正確であるかのように断言する。
english: That man speaks deﬁnitively about something uncertain as if it were a sure thing.

translation: As if
explanation: A conjunctive phrase that forms an adverbial clause which describes the way someone/something appears to the writer, contrary to reality.
japanese: その教師は私がまるでカンニングをしたかのように私を問いただした。
reading: その<ruby title="教師(きょうし)"><rb>教師</rb><rt>きょうし</rt></ruby>は私がまるでカンニングをしたかのように私を問いただした。
english: The teacher pressed me hard as if I had cheated on the exam.

translation: As if
explanation: A conjunctive phrase that forms an adverbial clause which describes the way someone/something appears to the writer, contrary to reality.
japanese: 彼は心理学のことは何も知らないのにあたかもよく知っているかのように心理学のことを話したがる。
reading: 彼は心理学のことは何も知らないのにあたかもよく知っているかのように心理学のことを話したがる。
english: He doesn't know anything about psychology, but he likes to talk about it as if he knows it very well.

translation: As if
explanation: A conjunctive phrase that forms an adverbial clause which describes the way someone/something appears to the writer, contrary to reality.
japanese: あたかも僕の心を解かすかのように、白くて透明な雪が降っている。
reading: あたかも僕の心を解かすかのように、白くて透明な雪が降っている。
english: White, transparent snow is falling as though it would melt my heart.

translation: As if
explanation: A conjunctive phrase that forms an adverbial clause which describes the way someone/something appears to the writer, contrary to reality.
japanese: まるで私の結婚を祝ってくれているかのように空は完璧に晴れていた。
reading: まるで私の結婚を 祝[いわ]ってくれているかのように空は完璧に晴れていた。
english: The sky was perfectly clear, as if it were celebrating my wedding.

translation: As if
explanation: A conjunctive phrase that forms an adverbial clause which describes the way someone/something appears to the writer, contrary to reality.
japanese: あの教師は学生が何を考えているかまるで意に介していないかのように見える。
reading: あの教師は学生が何を考えているかまるで意に介していないかのように見える。
english: The instructor looks as if he didn't care at all about what his students are thinking.

translation: As if
explanation: A conjunctive phrase that forms an adverbial clause which describes the way someone/something appears to the writer, contrary to reality.
japanese: 平凡でつまらないかのようにみえる彼らの人生とて起伏がないわけではない。
reading: 平凡でつまらないかのようにみえる彼らの人生とて起伏がないわけではない。
english: Even their life, which looks as if it were ordinary and boring, is not without its ups and downs.

translation: As if
explanation: A conjunctive phrase that forms an adverbial clause which describes the way someone/something appears to the writer, contrary to reality.
japanese: 空港での持ち物検査の時、うっかりはさみをポケットに入れていたので、犯罪者であるかのように扱われた。
reading: 空港での持ち物検査の時、うっかりはさみをポケットに入れていたので、犯罪者であるかのように<ruby title="扱(あつか)"><rb>扱</rb><rt>あつか</rt></ruby>われた。
english: When I went through the security check at the airport, I was treated as if I were a criminal because I inadvertently had put a pair of scissors in my pocket.

translation: As if
explanation: A conjunctive phrase that forms an adverbial clause which describes the way someone/something appears to the writer, contrary to reality.
japanese: イスラム系組織のテロがあるからと言って、イスラム系の人があたかもすべて危険であるかのように考えるのは単純すぎる。
reading: イスラム系組織のテロがあるからと言って、イスラム系の人があたかもすべて危険であるかのように考えるのは単純すぎる。
english: It is simplistic to think that all Muslims are dangerous just because some terrorist acts are perpetrated by Islamic groups.

translation: In terms of; from the viewpoint of; judging from
explanation: A phrase that means either “in terms of” or “judging from”.
japanese: 燃費から言ってこの車は非常に経済的だ
reading: <ruby title="燃費(ねんぴ)"><rb>燃費</rb><rt>ねんぴ</rt></ruby>から言ってこの車は非常に経済的だ。
english: In terms of gas mileage, this car is extremely economical.

translation: In terms of; from the viewpoint of; judging from
explanation: A phrase that means either “in terms of” or “judging from”.
japanese: 学生の評価から言って鈴木先生はいい先生に違いない。
reading: 学生の評価から言って鈴木先生はいい先生に違いない。
english: Judging from his student evaluations, Professor Suzuki must be a fine teacher.

translation: In terms of; from the viewpoint of; judging from
explanation: A phrase that means either “in terms of” or “judging from”.
japanese: 性能から言って、このエンジンを凌ぐものは少ない。
reading: 性能から言って、このエンジンを凌ぐものは少ない。
english: In terms of performance, few engines can surpass this one.

translation: In terms of; from the viewpoint of; judging from
explanation: A phrase that means either “in terms of” or “judging from”.
japanese: この小説は内容から言って子供向きではない。
reading: この小説は内容から言って子供向きではない。
english: The content of this novel is not suitable for children.

translation: In terms of; from the viewpoint of; judging from
explanation: A phrase that means either “in terms of” or “judging from”.
japanese: 仕事の効率から言って週休二日の方がいい。
reading: 仕事の効率から言って週休二日の方がいい。
english: In terms of efﬁciency a ﬁve-day work week (literally: two days off a week) is better.

translation: In terms of; from the viewpoint of; judging from
explanation: A phrase that means either “in terms of” or “judging from”.
japanese: DNA鑑定から言って、彼が犯人であることは確実だ。
reading: DNA鑑定から言って、彼が犯人であることは確実だ。
english: Judging from the DNA evidence, there is no doubt that he is the culprit.

translation: In terms of; from the viewpoint of; judging from
explanation: A phrase that means either “in terms of” or “judging from”.
japanese: 顔の色つやから言って、父は間違いなく健康だ。
reading: 顔の色つやから言って、父は間違いなく健康だ。
english: Judging from his facial complexion, my father is deﬁnitely healthy.

translation: In terms of; from the viewpoint of; judging from
explanation: A phrase that means either “in terms of” or “judging from”.
japanese: 日本語能力試験の結果から言って、ジョンの日本語はすばらしいに違いない。
reading: 日本語能力試験の結果から言って、ジョンの日本語はすばらしいに違いない。
english: Judging from the results of his Japanese Proﬁciency Test, John’s Japanese must be superb.

translation: Consist of; be composed of
explanation: A phrase indicating that something consists of more than one member/constituent.
japanese: 英語の”relax”はラテン語の”re-”(再び)と”laxare”（緩む）とからなっている。
reading: 英語の”relax”はラテン語の"re-"(再び)と"laxare"（緩む）とからなっている。
english: The English word “relax” consists of the Latin “re-” (again) and “laxare” (to loosen).

translation: Consist of; be composed of
explanation: A phrase indicating that something consists of more than one member/constituent.
japanese: タンパク質はアミノ酸からなっている。
reading: タンパク質はアミノ酸からなっている。
english: Proteins are composed of amino acids.

translation: Consist of; be composed of
explanation: A phrase indicating that something consists of more than one member/constituent.
japanese: 夫婦と子供からなる世帯は今後減るのだろうか。
reading: 夫婦と子供からなる世帯は今後減るのだろうか。
english: I wonder if households that consist of married couple and their children will decrease in the future.

translation: Consist of; be composed of
explanation: A phrase indicating that something consists of more than one member/constituent.
japanese: 日本の神社は拝殿と本殿とからなっている。
reading: 日本の神社は拝殿と本殿とからなっている。
english: A Japanese Shinto shrine consists of a front shrine and an inner shrine.

translation: Consist of; be composed of
explanation: A phrase indicating that something consists of more than one member/constituent.
japanese: この大学の東洋学科は言語、文学と歴史からなっている。
reading: この大学の東洋学科は言語、文学と歴史からなっている。
english: This university’s East Asian Studies Department consists of language, literature and history (programs).

translation: Consist of; be composed of
explanation: A phrase indicating that something consists of more than one member/constituent.
japanese: 日本は島国で、本州と北海道と四国と九州と沖縄とからなっている。
reading: 日本は<ruby title="島国(しまぐに)"><rb>島国</rb><rt>しまぐに</rt></ruby>で、本州と北海道と<ruby title="四国(しこく)"><rb>四国</rb><rt>しこく</rt></ruby>と九州と沖縄とからなっている。
english: Japan is an island country consisting of Honshu, Hokkaido, Shikoku, Kyushu and Okinawa.

translation: Consist of; be composed of
explanation: A phrase indicating that something consists of more than one member/constituent.
japanese: ブラームスのレクイエムは演奏に約一時間半を要する大作で、全7楽章からなっている。
reading: ブラームスのレクイエムは演奏に約一時間半を要する大作で、<ruby title="全(ぜん)"><rb>全</rb><rt>ぜん</rt></ruby>7楽章からなっている。
english: Brahms’s Requiem is a magnum opus that takes about an hour and a half to perform and consists of a total of seven movements.
extra_notes: 全 here means "a total of."

translation: Consist of; be composed of
explanation: A phrase indicating that something consists of more than one member/constituent.
japanese: フィリピンは多くの島々からなっている。
reading: フィリピンは多くの島々からなっている。
english: The Philippines is made up of many islands.

translation: Consist of; be composed of
explanation: A phrase indicating that something consists of more than one member/constituent.
japanese: このボランティア団体は約１５０名の会員からなる団体です。
reading: このボランティア団体は約１５０<ruby title="名(な)"><rb>名</rb><rt>めい</rt></ruby>の会員からなる団体です。
english: This volunteer organization is a group made up of about 150 members.
extra_notes: 名 - counter for people (usu. seating, reservations and such)

translation: Once; now that ~; as long as ~; so long as ~; if
explanation: A subordinate conjunction meaning “now that,” “once someone does / has done something” or “so long as”.
japanese: いったん引き受けたからには最後まで責任をもってやります。
reading: いったん引き受けたからには最後まで責任をもってやります。
english: Once I take on (the job), I will fulﬁll my responsibility and complete it.

translation: Once; now that ~; as long as ~; so long as ~; if
explanation: A subordinate conjunction meaning “now that,” “once someone does / has done something” or “so long as”.
japanese: 裁判と言うからには弁護人が不可欠だ。
reading: 裁判と言うからには弁護人が不可欠だ。
english: Since it is a trial, a defence attorney will be indispensable.

translation: Once; now that ~; as long as ~; so long as ~; if
explanation: A subordinate conjunction meaning “now that,” “once someone does / has done something” or “so long as”.
japanese: 生まれてきたからには長生きしたい。
reading: 生まれてきたからには長生きしたい。
english: So long as I'm here, I'd like to live a long time.

translation: Once; now that ~; as long as ~; so long as ~; if
explanation: A subordinate conjunction meaning “now that,” “once someone does / has done something” or “so long as”.
japanese: 行くって言ったからにはちゃんと行かなきゃ駄目だよ。
reading: 行くって言ったからにはちゃんと行かなきゃ駄目だよ。
english: Now that you've said you're going there, you have to go, OK?

translation: Once; now that ~; as long as ~; so long as ~; if
explanation: A subordinate conjunction meaning “now that,” “once someone does / has done something” or “so long as”.
japanese: ネット上で文章を書いたからには、必ずそれを読む人が存在するのです。
reading: ネット上で文章を書いたからには、必ずそれを読む人が存在するのです。
english: Once you write a passage on the Internet, there are deﬁnitely people who will read it.

translation: Once; now that ~; as long as ~; so long as ~; if
explanation: A subordinate conjunction meaning “now that,” “once someone does / has done something” or “so long as”.
japanese: 写真をカラーで撮るからには、色にこだわりたい。
reading: 写真をカラーで撮るからには、色にこだわりたい。
english: As long as I am taking pictures with colour ﬁlm, I want to be very particular about the colour.

translation: Once; now that ~; as long as ~; so long as ~; if
explanation: A subordinate conjunction meaning “now that,” “once someone does / has done something” or “so long as”.
japanese: マラソンに出るからには、絶対に勝ちたい。
reading: マラソンに出るからには、絶対に勝ちたい。
english: Now that I am taking part in the marathon, I absolutely want to win.

translation: Once; now that ~; as long as ~; so long as ~; if
explanation: A subordinate conjunction meaning “now that,” “once someone does / has done something” or “so long as”.
japanese: アメリカに住んでいるからには郷に入っては郷に従えで、批判ばっかりしていたって仕方がない。
reading: アメリカに住んでいるからには郷に入っては郷に従えで、批判ばっかりしていたって仕方がない。
english: As long as you are living in the U.S., do as the Americans do; it won't help if you just complain.

translation: Once; now that ~; as long as ~; so long as ~; if
explanation: A subordinate conjunction meaning “now that,” “once someone does / has done something” or “so long as”.
japanese: 「ブレーンストーミング」と言うからには、発言に制限を設けてはならない。
reading: 「ブレーンストーミング」と言うからには、発言に制限を設けてはならない。
english: Since you are calling it brainstorming, you shouldn't restrict statements people make.

translation: Once; now that ~; as long as ~; so long as ~; if
explanation: A subordinate conjunction meaning “now that,” “once someone does / has done something” or “so long as”.
japanese: 世界一周と言うからには、軽度の基準点であるグリニッジ天文台から出発しおうと決め込んだ。
reading: 世界一周と言うからには、経度の基準点であるグリニッジ天文台から出発しおうと決め込んだ。
english: Because I was going to travel around the world, I decided to start my trip from London's Greenwich Observatory, which is the base point of longitude.

translation: Even; judging from
explanation: A phrase that singles out something for emphasis or presents something as a basis for judgment.
japanese: 社長からして会社再建の意欲がないんだから、社員の志気が上がらないのは当たり前だ。
reading: 社長からして会社再建の意欲がないんだから、社員の志気が上がらないのは当たり前だ。
english: Even the president has no desire to reconstruct the company; so, of course, his employees' morale is low.

translation: Even; judging from
explanation: A phrase that singles out something for emphasis or presents something as a basis for judgment.
japanese: あの日本語の話し方からして彼は日本に行ったことがあるに違いない。
reading: あの日本語の話し方からして彼は日本に行ったことがあるに違いない。
english: Judging from the way he speaks Japanese, he must have been to Japan.

translation: Even; judging from
explanation: A phrase that singles out something for emphasis or presents something as a basis for judgment.
japanese: あの男は歩き方からして他の人と違う。
reading: あの男は歩き方からして他の人と違う。
english: Even in the way he walks, he is different from other people.

translation: Even; judging from
explanation: A phrase that singles out something for emphasis or presents something as a basis for judgment.
japanese: プロの銀行員からして、初歩的な経済の分析に必要な数学に弱い。
reading: プロの銀行員からして、初歩的な経済の分析に必要な数学に弱い。
english: Even professional bankers are weak in the math necessary for elementary economic analysis.

translation: Even; judging from
explanation: A phrase that singles out something for emphasis or presents something as a basis for judgment.
japanese: 週末の彼女とのデートでは、待ち合わせの場所からして間違えてしまった。
reading: 週末の彼女とのデートでは、待ち合わせの場所からして間違えてしまった。
english: When I went out on a date with her last weekend, I even got the meeting place wrong.

translation: Even; judging from
explanation: A phrase that singles out something for emphasis or presents something as a basis for judgment.
japanese: 沈没した原子力潜水艦を引き揚げるのは、その大きさからして技術的な限界に近い。
reading: 沈没した原子力潜水艦を引き揚げるのは、その大きさからして技術的な限界に近い。
english: Judging from its size, pulling up the sunken atomic submarine is close to being technologically limited.

translation: Even; judging from
explanation: A phrase that singles out something for emphasis or presents something as a basis for judgment.
japanese: 「車は走る凶器」「飲んだら乗るな」の掛け声も、事故の実態からして死語同然となっている。
reading: 「車は走る凶器」「飲んだら乗るな」の掛け声も、事故の<ruby title="実態(じったい)"><rb>実態</rb><rt>じったい</rt></ruby>からして死語同然となっている。
english: Judging from the reality of car accidents, slogans like "A car is a running weapon," and "Don't drink and drive" are just empty (literally: dead) words.

translation: Supposing that; suppose; providing that; (even) if
explanation: An adverb that indicates the speaker’s/writer’s tentative supposition.
japanese: 仮に一億円｛もらう/もらった｝と｛したら/すれば｝何に使いますか。
reading: 仮に一億円｛もらう/もらった｝と｛したら/すれば｝何に使いますか。
english: Supposing you received 100 million yen, what would you use it for?

translation: Supposing that; suppose; providing that; (even) if
explanation: An adverb that indicates the speaker’s/writer’s tentative supposition.
japanese: 仮に月収が30万円｛ある/あった｝として、どのようなアパートを借りることができるだろうか。
reading: 仮に月収が30万円｛ある/あった｝として、どのようなアパートを借りることができるだろうか。
english: Supposing that I had an income of 300,000 yen, I wonder what kind of an apartment I could rent.

translation: Supposing that; suppose; providing that; (even) if
explanation: An adverb that indicates the speaker’s/writer’s tentative supposition.
japanese: 仮にこれが日本の教育の現状だったら、構造改革の余地は大いにある。
reading: 仮にこれが日本の教育の現状だったら、構造改革の余地は大いにある。
english: If this were the current state of Japanese educational affairs, a lot would have to be restructured.

translation: Supposing that; suppose; providing that; (even) if
explanation: An adverb that indicates the speaker’s/writer’s tentative supposition.
japanese: 仮に手術が成功｛する/した｝としても、高齢だから父の体が元に戻ることはないだろう。
reading: 仮に手術が成功｛する/した｝としても、高齢だから父の体が元に戻ることはないだろう。
english: Even if the operation is successful, my father, who is quite old, will probably not regain his original health.

translation: Supposing that; suppose; providing that; (even) if
explanation: An adverb that indicates the speaker’s/writer’s tentative supposition.
japanese: 仮にあなたがベンチャー企業の経営権を持っていたら、どのようなアプローチを取りますか。
reading: 仮にあなたがベンチャー企業の経営権を持っていたら、どのようなアプローチを取りますか。
english: Supposing that you managed a business venture, what sort of approach would you take?

translation: Supposing that; suppose; providing that; (even) if
explanation: An adverb that indicates the speaker’s/writer’s tentative supposition.
japanese: よくある質問ですが、仮にあなたが今小さい島で一人で暮らすとして、一冊だけ本を持って行けるとしたら、どの本を持って行きますか。
reading: よくある質問ですが、仮にあなたが今小さい島で一人で暮らすとして、一冊だけ本を持って行けるとしたら、どの本を持って行きますか。
english: This is a common question, but supposing that you were going to live alone on a small island and were allowed to bring only one book, what would it be?

translation: Supposing that; suppose; providing that; (even) if
explanation: An adverb that indicates the speaker’s/writer’s tentative supposition.
japanese: 仮に今の調子で老齢化が進むとすれば、21世紀後半には日本の人口の5割以上が６５歳以上になる可能性がある。
reading: 仮に今の調子で老齢化が進むとすれば、21世紀後半には日本の人口の5割以上が６５歳以上になる可能性がある。
english: If Japan ages at the current rate, in the latter half of the 21st century more than half of the Japanese population will be 65 or older.

translation: Supposing that; suppose; providing that; (even) if
explanation: An adverb that indicates the speaker’s/writer’s tentative supposition.
japanese: 仮に日本に一年ぐらい行って日本語を勉強すれば、君たちの日本語はすごく上達するよ。
reading: 仮に日本に一年ぐらい行って日本語を勉強すれば、君たちの日本語はすごく上達するよ。
english: If you go to Japan to study Japanese for about a year, your Japanese will make an impressive progress.

translation: Supposing that; suppose; providing that; (even) if
explanation: An adverb that indicates the speaker’s/writer’s tentative supposition.
japanese: 信号を待っている時、仮に前の車が青になったのに進まなかったとしても、クラクションは鳴らさない方がよいでしょう。
reading: 信号を待っている時、仮に前の車が青になったのに進まなかったとしても、クラクションは鳴らさない方がよいでしょう。
english: When you are waiting for the light, even if the car in front of you doesn't move ahead when it turns green, it's better not to honk.

translation: Supposing that; suppose; providing that; (even) if
explanation: An adverb that indicates the speaker’s/writer’s tentative supposition.
japanese: 仮に話を経済学の「理論」に限定するとしても、今日までのあらゆる経済学理論が結局においてはすべてゲーム理論だと言っていいだろう。
reading: 仮に話を経済学の「理論」に限定するとしても、今日までのあらゆる経済学理論が結局においてはすべてゲーム理論だと言っていいだろう。
english: Even if we limit the discussion to economic theory, I can safely say that all economic theories are, in the end, game theory.

translation: Supposing that; suppose; providing that; (even) if
explanation: An adverb that indicates the speaker’s/writer’s tentative supposition.
japanese: 仮に仲介者を通して売る場合、利益が少なくなるのは当然だ。
reading: 仮に仲介者を通して売る場合、利益が少なくなるのは当然だ。
english: If you sell it through a go-between, your proﬁt, of course, will become smaller.

translation: As soon as (one notices that) ~; soon after; when one thinks/feels that ~
explanation: A phrase indicating that an action or state in the dependent clause occurs very closely with another action or state in the clause, or causes another action or state in the main clause.
japanese: 最近は、肌寒くなったかと思うと、翌日には暖かくなったりする。
reading: 最近は、<ruby title="肌寒(はださむ)"><rb>肌寒</rb><rt>はださむ</rt></ruby>くなったかと思うと、翌日には暖かくなったりする。
english: These days, just when you think it's gotten chilly, the next day it turns warm again.

translation: As soon as (one notices that) ~; soon after; when one thinks/feels that ~
explanation: A phrase indicating that an action or state in the dependent clause occurs very closely with another action or state in the clause, or causes another action or state in the main clause.
japanese: 私の書いた小説が出版されるかと思うと、とても嬉しい。
reading: 私の書いた小説が出版されるかと思うと、とても嬉しい。
english: When I think that the novel I wrote will be published, I feel very happy.

translation: As soon as (one notices that) ~; soon after; when one thinks/feels that ~
explanation: A phrase indicating that an action or state in the dependent clause occurs very closely with another action or state in the clause, or causes another action or state in the main clause.
japanese: ハワイでは、雨が降ってきたかと思うと、すぐやんでしまう。
reading: ハワイでは、雨が降ってきたかと思うと、すぐやんでしまう。
english: In Hawaii, as soon as it begins to rain, it stops right away.

translation: As soon as (one notices that) ~; soon after; when one thinks/feels that ~
explanation: A phrase indicating that an action or state in the dependent clause occurs very closely with another action or state in the clause, or causes another action or state in the main clause.
japanese: 花火は、あがったかと思うとすぐ消えてしまうからいいのだ。
reading: 花火は、あがったかと思うとすぐ消えてしまうからいいのだ。
english: I like ﬁreworks because they disappear as soon as they go up.

translation: As soon as (one notices that) ~; soon after; when one thinks/feels that ~
explanation: A phrase indicating that an action or state in the dependent clause occurs very closely with another action or state in the clause, or causes another action or state in the main clause.
japanese: うちの小学生の子供は、テレビを見終わったかと思うと、コンピュータゲームをやり始める。
reading: うちの小学生の子供は、テレビを<ruby title="見(み)"><rb>見</rb><rt>み</rt></ruby><ruby title="終(お)"><rb>終</rb><rt>お</rt></ruby>わったかと思うと、コンピュータゲームをやり始める。
english: Our elementary school child starts to play computer games soon after he ﬁnishes watching TV.

translation: As soon as (one notices that) ~; soon after; when one thinks/feels that ~
explanation: A phrase indicating that an action or state in the dependent clause occurs very closely with another action or state in the clause, or causes another action or state in the main clause.
japanese: 妻がおいしい夕食を作ってくれているかと思うと、家に帰る足も速まる。
reading: 妻がおいしい夕食を作ってくれているかと思うと、家に帰る足も速まる。
english: When I think about my wife preparing a delicious dinner for me, I naturally start walking home faster.

translation: As soon as (one notices that) ~; soon after; when one thinks/feels that ~
explanation: A phrase indicating that an action or state in the dependent clause occurs very closely with another action or state in the clause, or causes another action or state in the main clause.
japanese: 会社のリストラで職を失うのではないかと思うと、気が重いです。
reading: 会社のリストラで職を失うのではないかと思うと、気が重いです。
english: When I think about how I might be laid off because of restructuring at my company, I feel depressed.

translation: As soon as (one notices that) ~; soon after; when one thinks/feels that ~
explanation: A phrase indicating that an action or state in the dependent clause occurs very closely with another action or state in the clause, or causes another action or state in the main clause.
japanese: 子供たちも大学を出て一人立ちしたので、もう学費もかからないかと思うと、ほっとします。
reading: 子供たちも大学を出て一人立ちしたので、もう学費もかからないかと思うと、ほっとします。
english: When I think about how we no longer need to pay educational expenses because our children have graduated from college and are now on their own, I feel so relieved.

translation: And; and also; yet; but; and ~ as well; as well as; moreover
explanation: A conjunction meaning “and” that connects words, phrases and sentences.
japanese: スミス氏は流暢な日本語を話し、且つ日本の歴史や文化にも明るい。
reading: スミス氏は流暢な日本語を話し、且つ日本の歴史や文化にも明るい。
english: Mr. Smith is ﬂuent in Japanese and is also knowledgeable about Japanese history and culture.
extra_notes: 明るい here means to know a lot about; be knowledgeable; be well versed in

translation: And; and also; yet; but; and ~ as well; as well as; moreover
explanation: A conjunction meaning “and” that connects words, phrases and sentences.
japanese: この本は、分かりやすく、且つ味わい深い言葉で書かれている。
reading: この本は、分かりやすく、且つ味わい深い言葉で書かれている。
english: This book is written in language that is easy to understand but also profound.

translation: And; and also; yet; but; and ~ as well; as well as; moreover
explanation: A conjunction meaning “and” that connects words, phrases and sentences.
japanese: 彼女は一流のピアニストで、且つ優れた随筆家だ。
reading: 彼女は一流のピアニストで、且つ優れた随筆家だ。
english: She is a ﬁrst-class pianist, as well as a ﬁne essayist.

translation: And; and also; yet; but; and ~ as well; as well as; moreover
explanation: A conjunction meaning “and” that connects words, phrases and sentences.
japanese: 外国語は、楽しく、且つ効果的に勉強したい。
reading: 外国語は、楽しく、且つ効果的に勉強したい。
english: We'd like to study foreign languages in an enjoyable yet effective way.

translation: And; and also; yet; but; and ~ as well; as well as; moreover
explanation: A conjunction meaning “and” that connects words, phrases and sentences.
japanese: 英語ができること、且つウェブサイトの作成経験があることがこの仕事の要件だ。
reading: 英語ができること、且つウェブサイトの作成経験があることがこの仕事の要件だ。
english: Being able to speak English and having experience in constructing websites are the conditions required for this job.

translation: And; and also; yet; but; and ~ as well; as well as; moreover
explanation: A conjunction meaning “and” that connects words, phrases and sentences.
japanese: パソコンさえあれば自宅ででき、且つ高収入の仕事をご紹介します。
reading: パソコンさえあれば自宅ででき、且つ高収入の仕事をご紹介します。
english: We will introduce you to jobs that not only pay well, but can be done at home, as long as you have a computer.

translation: And; and also; yet; but; and ~ as well; as well as; moreover
explanation: A conjunction meaning “and” that connects words, phrases and sentences.
japanese: この図は、自動車を個人で利用できず、且つ家族とも共有できない６５歳以上の高齢者の外出頻度を示している。
reading: この図は、自動車を個人で利用できず、且つ家族とも共有できない６５歳以上の高齢者の外出頻度を示している。
english: This ﬁgure shows how often senior citizens over 65 who cannot drive a car and do not share one with their family get out.

translation: And; and also; yet; but; and ~ as well; as well as; moreover
explanation: A conjunction meaning “and” that connects words, phrases and sentences.
japanese: 和太鼓による若々しく、且つたくましい演奏をご堪能下さい。
reading: 和太鼓による若々しく、且つたくましい演奏をご堪能下さい。
english: Please enjoy the youthful, powerful performance on the Japanese drums.

translation: And; and also; yet; but; and ~ as well; as well as; moreover
explanation: A conjunction meaning “and” that connects words, phrases and sentences.
japanese: 当店では、スタイリッシュで、且つシンプルなトレーニングウエアを各種取り揃えております。
reading: 当店では、スタイリッシュで、且つシンプルなトレーニングウエアを各種取り揃えております。
english: Our store has various kinds of training gear that are stylish yet simple in design.

translation: And; and also; yet; but; and ~ as well; as well as; moreover
explanation: A conjunction meaning “and” that connects words, phrases and sentences.
japanese: ご注文のキャンセルについては、注文から24時間以内で、且つ注文されたご本人によりメールあるいはファックスでご連絡いただいた場合のみ認められます。
reading: ご注文のキャンセルについては、注文から24時間以内で、且つ注文されたご本人によりメールあるいはファックスでご連絡いただいた場合のみ認められます。
english: We accept cancellations only within 24 hours of an order being placed and only when we receive notiﬁcation via e-mail or fax by the person who has placed the order.

translation: And; and also; yet; but; and ~ as well; as well as; moreover
explanation: A conjunction meaning “and” that connects words, phrases and sentences.
japanese: この仕事では大量の文献を速く且つ正確に読むことが要求される。
reading: この仕事では大量の文献を速く且つ正確に読むことが要求される。
english: This job demands that you read a large volume of material both quickly and accurately.

translation: And; and also; yet; but; and ~ as well; as well as; moreover
explanation: A conjunction meaning “and” that connects words, phrases and sentences.
japanese: 当社は、個人情報を取り扱うにあたり、個人情報保護法はじめ適用される諸法令、規範遵守を徹底し、適切且つ慎重に管理いたします。
reading: 当社は、個人情報を取り扱うにあたり、個人情報保護法はじめ適用される諸法令、規範遵守を徹底し、適切且つ慎重に管理いたします。
english: At our company, when we handle personal information, we thoroughly observe the applicable laws and regulations, including (literally: starting with) the Personal Information Protection Law, and we manage the information properly and prudently.

translation: And; and also; yet; but; and ~ as well; as well as; moreover
explanation: A conjunction meaning “and” that connects words, phrases and sentences.
japanese: 売主は、製品には欠陥またはきずのある材料の使用がないこと、且つ当該製品が売主の発行した仕様に合致するものであることを保証する。
reading: 売主は、製品には欠陥またはきずのある材料の使用がないこと、且つ当該製品が売主の発行した仕様に合致するものであることを保証する。
english: The seller guarantees that the product does not use materials with defects or blemishes and that the product meets the speciﬁcations issued by the seller.

translation: Have a tendency to; tend to; have a touch of ~; have a dash of ~; smack of ~; be slightly ~
explanation: A phrase indicating that someone or something has an undesirable tendency.
japanese: 彼は物事を単純に考えるきらいがある。
reading: 彼は物事を単純に考えるきらいがある。
english: He has a tendency to think (about things) in simplistic terms.

translation: Have a tendency to; tend to; have a touch of ~; have a dash of ~; smack of ~; be slightly ~
explanation: A phrase indicating that someone or something has an undesirable tendency.
japanese: 彼は独断のきらいがある。
reading: 彼は独断のきらいがある。
english: He is slightly dogmatic (literally: has a touch of dogmatism).
