translation: Have a tendency to; tend to; have a touch of ~; have a dash of ~; smack of ~; be slightly ~
explanation: A phrase indicating that someone or something has an undesirable tendency.
japanese: 我々はとかく自分に都合がいい意見だけに耳を傾けるきらいがある。
reading: 我々はとかく自分に都合がいい意見だけに耳を傾けるきらいがある。
english: We tend to listen only to views that are convenient for us.

translation: Have a tendency to; tend to; have a touch of ~; have a dash of ~; smack of ~; be slightly ~
explanation: A phrase indicating that someone or something has an undesirable tendency.
japanese: 今の子供たちは、夜遅くまでコンピュータゲームなどをして寝ないきらいがある。
reading: 今の子供たちは、夜遅くまでコンピュータゲームなどをして寝ないきらいがある。
english: Children these days have a tendency to stay up late at night playing computer games and doing other things.

translation: Have a tendency to; tend to; have a touch of ~; have a dash of ~; smack of ~; be slightly ~
explanation: A phrase indicating that someone or something has an undesirable tendency.
japanese: 主婦は毎日の雑事に追われて、自分の体調管理がおろそかになるきらいがある。
reading: 主婦は毎日の雑事に追われて、自分の体調管理がおろそかになるきらいがある。
english: Housewives have a tendency to neglect taking care of their own health because they are busy doing everyday chores.

translation: Have a tendency to; tend to; have a touch of ~; have a dash of ~; smack of ~; be slightly ~
explanation: A phrase indicating that someone or something has an undesirable tendency.
japanese: 彼女は親切な人ですが、知らずに人を傷つけることを言うきらいがあります。
reading: 彼女は親切な人ですが、知らずに人を傷つけることを言うきらいがあります。
english: She is a kind person, but she has a tendency to say things unwittingly that hurt people.

translation: Have a tendency to; tend to; have a touch of ~; have a dash of ~; smack of ~; be slightly ~
explanation: A phrase indicating that someone or something has an undesirable tendency.
japanese: 私たちは、あまりに自分のからだを医者任せにしてきたきらいがあるのではないでしょうか。
reading: 私たちは、あまりに自分のからだを医者任せにしてきたきらいがあるのではないでしょうか。
english: Don't you think that we have tended to entrust (the care of) our bodies too much to doctors?

translation: Have a tendency to; tend to; have a touch of ~; have a dash of ~; smack of ~; be slightly ~
explanation: A phrase indicating that someone or something has an undesirable tendency.
japanese: これまでの日本の高等教育は、アジアとの共生を重視しなかったきらいがある。
reading: これまでの日本の高等教育は、アジアとの共生を<ruby title="重視(じゅうし)"><rb>重視</rb><rt>じゅうし</rt></ruby>しなかったきらいがある。
english: Japanese higher education so far has tended to not attach importance to Japan's coexistence with Asia.

translation: Have a tendency to; tend to; have a touch of ~; have a dash of ~; smack of ~; be slightly ~
explanation: A phrase indicating that someone or something has an undesirable tendency.
japanese: 現在の日本の教育は、子供を社会から保護しすぎるきらいがある。
reading: 現在の日本の教育は、子供を社会から<ruby title="保護(ほご)"><rb>保護</rb><rt>ほご</rt></ruby>しすぎるきらいがある。
english: Education in Japan today tends to overprotect children from society.

translation: Have a tendency to; tend to; have a touch of ~; have a dash of ~; smack of ~; be slightly ~
explanation: A phrase indicating that someone or something has an undesirable tendency.
japanese: 彼は家庭環境が複雑なせいか、人間不信のきらいがある。
reading: 彼は家庭環境が複雑なせいか、人間不信のきらいがある。
english: Because he was brought up in a complicated family setting, he tends not to trust people (literally: tends towards mistrust of humans).

translation: Have a tendency to; tend to; have a touch of ~; have a dash of ~; smack of ~; be slightly ~
explanation: A phrase indicating that someone or something has an undesirable tendency.
japanese: 彼は頭もよくて、仕事もばりばりやるけど、八方美人のきらいがある。
reading: 彼は頭もよくて、仕事もばりばりやるけど、八方美人のきらいがある。
english: He is sharp and works furiously, but he has a tendency to try to be everything to everybody.

translation: Have a tendency to; tend to; have a touch of ~; have a dash of ~; smack of ~; be slightly ~
explanation: A phrase indicating that someone or something has an undesirable tendency.
japanese: 健康診断で白内障のきらいがあると医者に言われました。
reading: 健康診断で白内障のきらいがあると医者に言われました。
english: When I had a physical check-up, the doctor told me that I have cataracts developing.

translation: Have a tendency to; tend to; have a touch of ~; have a dash of ~; smack of ~; be slightly ~
explanation: A phrase indicating that someone or something has an undesirable tendency.
japanese: 糖尿病のきらいがあるので、甘いものは控えています。
reading: 糖尿病のきらいがあるので、甘いものは控えています。
english: I have a borderline case of diabetes (literally: have a tendency towards diabetes), so I am refraining from eating sweets.

translation: Since; only
explanation: A conjunction indicating that since something occurred, nothing has happened and the resultant situation remains unchanged; a particle indicating a strict limitation in terms of number/quantity.
japanese: 山下氏は1964年に日本を出た（っ）きり日本には一度も帰っていない。
reading: 山下氏は1964年に日本を出た（っ）きり日本には一度も帰っていない。
english: Mr. Yamashita hasn't returned to Japan even once since he left in 1964.

translation: Since; only
explanation: A conjunction indicating that since something occurred, nothing has happened and the resultant situation remains unchanged; a particle indicating a strict limitation in terms of number/quantity.
japanese: ソウルにいるのも今夜きりです。
reading: ソウルにいるのも今夜きりです。
english: This is my last night in Seoul. / I'm only in Seoul tonight.

translation: Since; only
explanation: A conjunction indicating that since something occurred, nothing has happened and the resultant situation remains unchanged; a particle indicating a strict limitation in terms of number/quantity.
japanese: 彼女とは十年以上も前にパリで会ったきりで、その後どうしているのか、全然知らない。
reading: 彼女とは十年以上も前にパリで会ったきりで、その後どうしているのか、全然知らない。
english: I haven't seen her since we met in Paris more than 10 years ago and I have no idea how she's been doing since then.

translation: Since; only
explanation: A conjunction indicating that since something occurred, nothing has happened and the resultant situation remains unchanged; a particle indicating a strict limitation in terms of number/quantity.
japanese: 小学校六年の時に別れたっきりの同級生に気づかれるなんて、ひょっとして私って小学校の時から顔が変わってないんだろうか。
reading: 小学校六年の時に別れたっきりの同級生に気づかれるなんて、ひょっとして私って小学校の時から顔が変わってないんだろうか。
english: My classmate, whom I hadn't seen since we left 6th grade, recognized me. I wonder if I look the same as I did in elementary school (literally: my face has not changed since my grade school days).

translation: Since; only
explanation: A conjunction indicating that since something occurred, nothing has happened and the resultant situation remains unchanged; a particle indicating a strict limitation in terms of number/quantity.
japanese: フロイトの本はずいぶん前に読んだっきりなので、内容のほとんどは忘れてしまいました。
reading: フロイトの本はずいぶん前に読んだっきりなので、内容のほとんどは忘れてしまいました。
english: It's been a long time since I read Freud's books, so I've forgotten almost all of the content.

translation: Since; only
explanation: A conjunction indicating that since something occurred, nothing has happened and the resultant situation remains unchanged; a particle indicating a strict limitation in terms of number/quantity.
japanese: 父は雪の日に倒れて、腰の骨を折ってから、寝たきりになってしまった。
reading: 父は雪の日に倒れて、腰の骨を<ruby title="折(お)"><rb>折</rb><rt>お</rt></ruby>ってから、寝たきりになってしまった。
english: My father fell on a snowy day and broke his hip, and since then he's been lying in bed.

translation: Since; only
explanation: A conjunction indicating that since something occurred, nothing has happened and the resultant situation remains unchanged; a particle indicating a strict limitation in terms of number/quantity.
japanese: それっきりなの？もっとたくさんちょうだい。
reading: それっきりなの？もっとたくさんちょうだい。
english: Only this much? Give me more, please.

translation: Since; only
explanation: A conjunction indicating that since something occurred, nothing has happened and the resultant situation remains unchanged; a particle indicating a strict limitation in terms of number/quantity.
japanese: もう会うのはこれっきりにしましょう。
reading: もう会うのはこれっきりにしましょう。
english: Let's make this the last time we see each other.

translation: Since; only
explanation: A conjunction indicating that since something occurred, nothing has happened and the resultant situation remains unchanged; a particle indicating a strict limitation in terms of number/quantity.
japanese: 十年前に別れて二人はそれきりだった。
reading: 十年前に別れて二人はそれきりだった。
english: The two parted 10 years ago and have never seen each other since.

translation: Since; only
explanation: A conjunction indicating that since something occurred, nothing has happened and the resultant situation remains unchanged; a particle indicating a strict limitation in terms of number/quantity.
japanese: 彼からはあれっきり何も連絡がないの？
reading: 彼からはあれっきり何も連絡がないの？
english: You haven't heard anything from him since then?

translation: Since; only
explanation: A conjunction indicating that since something occurred, nothing has happened and the resultant situation remains unchanged; a particle indicating a strict limitation in terms of number/quantity.
japanese: 夏休みも今日一日きりで終わっちゃうね。
reading: 夏休みも今日一日きりで終わっちゃうね。
english: Today is the last day (literally: the only day left) of summer vacation, isn't it?

translation: Since; only
explanation: A conjunction indicating that since something occurred, nothing has happened and the resultant situation remains unchanged; a particle indicating a strict limitation in terms of number/quantity.
japanese: 私は母と二人っきりで暮らしています。
reading: 私は母と二人っきりで暮らしています。
english: I live alone with my mother.

explanation: A colloquial sentence final particle marking a question.
japanese: 鈴木さんは英語が話せるんだっけ。
reading: 鈴木さんは英語が話せるんだっけ。
english: Can you speak English, Mr. Suzuki? / Can Mr. Suzuki speak English?

explanation: A colloquial sentence final particle marking a question.
japanese: 今日は木曜日だ(った)っけ。
reading: 今日は木曜日だ(った)っけ。
english: Is today Thursday?

explanation: A colloquial sentence final particle marking a question.
japanese: ジェーンさんはピアノが弾けた（んだ）っけ。
reading: ジェーンさんはピアノが弾けた（んだ）っけ。
english: Can you play the piano, Jane? / Can Jane play the piano?

explanation: A colloquial sentence final particle marking a question.
japanese: パーティーは何時に始まるんだっけ。
reading: パーティーは何時に始まるんだっけ。
english: When does the party start?

explanation: A colloquial sentence final particle marking a question.
japanese: スミスさんはワシントン大学の学生だったっけ。
reading: スミスさんはワシントン大学の学生だったっけ。
english: Are (Were) you a University of Washington student, Ms. Smith? / Is (Was) Ms. Smith a University of Washington student?

explanation: A colloquial sentence final particle marking a question.
japanese: この映画、面白いんだっけ。
reading: この映画、面白いんだっけ。
english: Is this movie interesting?

explanation: A colloquial sentence final particle marking a question.
japanese: あの人って、正直なんだっけ。
reading: あの人って、正直なんだっけ。
english: Is he an honest person?

translation: Extremely; utterly; very; so; cannot be more; extreme; utmost
explanation: A phrase that indicates that something or someone is in an extreme state.
japanese: 生まれたばかりの赤ん坊を車に残して買い物に行くとは非常識この上ない。
reading: 生まれたばかりの赤ん坊を車に残して買い物に行くとは非常識この上ない。
english: It is utterly senseless to leave a newborn baby in the car and go shopping.

translation: Extremely; utterly; very; so; cannot be more; extreme; utmost
explanation: A phrase that indicates that something or someone is in an extreme state.
japanese: この部屋はクーラーも扇風機もなく、風も全然通らないので、暑いことこの上ない。
reading: この部屋はクーラーも扇風機もなく、風も全然<ruby title="通(とお)"><rb>通</rb><rt>とお</rt></ruby>らないので、暑いことこの上ない。
english: There is neither an air-conditioner nor a fan in this room, and no breeze, either, so it's extremely hot in here.

translation: Extremely; utterly; very; so; cannot be more; extreme; utmost
explanation: A phrase that indicates that something or someone is in an extreme state.
japanese: 大任を無事に果たしてこの上ない充実感に浸っている。
reading: 大任を無事に果たしてこの上ない充実感に浸っている。
english: I'm enjoying the feeling of utmost fulfilment, having completed an important mission successfully.

translation: Extremely; utterly; very; so; cannot be more; extreme; utmost
explanation: A phrase that indicates that something or someone is in an extreme state.
japanese: 最近よく食事時にセールスの電話がかかってくるが、迷惑この上ない。
reading: 最近よく食事時にセールスの電話がかかってくるが、迷惑この上ない。
english: We often get sales calls at dinnertime these days, which is extremely annoying.

translation: Extremely; utterly; very; so; cannot be more; extreme; utmost
explanation: A phrase that indicates that something or someone is in an extreme state.
japanese: 一人住まいの高齢者を狙って金を騙し取るなど卑劣この上ない。
reading: 一人<ruby title="住(ず)"><rb>住</rb><rt>ず</rt></ruby>まいの高齢者を狙って金を騙し取るなど卑劣この上ない。
english: It is utterly contemptible to target old people living alone and cheat them of their money.

translation: Extremely; utterly; very; so; cannot be more; extreme; utmost
explanation: A phrase that indicates that something or someone is in an extreme state.
japanese: こんな大事な仕事をアルバイトにさせるなんて無責任この上ない。
reading: こんな大事な仕事をアルバイトにさせるなんて無責任この上ない。
english: It is extremely irresponsible to have a part-timer do such an important job.

translation: Extremely; utterly; very; so; cannot be more; extreme; utmost
explanation: A phrase that indicates that something or someone is in an extreme state.
japanese: また選挙シーズンが来た。いつものことだが、選挙の車が連日うちの前を通り、マイクで候補者の名前を連呼する。うるさいことこの上ない。
reading: また選挙シーズンが来た。いつものことだが、選挙の車が連日うちの前を通り、マイクで候補者の名前を連呼する。うるさいことこの上ない。
english: Here we are again in election season. As always, the campaign cars pass by my house every day, shouting out their candidate's name repeatedly on the microphone. It's extremely noisy and annoying.

translation: Extremely; utterly; very; so; cannot be more; extreme; utmost
explanation: A phrase that indicates that something or someone is in an extreme state.
japanese: このコンピュータは日本語入力の時、いちいち入力方式を指定しないといけないので、面倒なことこの上ない。
reading: このコンピュータは日本語入力の時、いちいち入力方式を指定しないといけないので、面倒なことこの上ない。
english: Because we have to specify the input method on this computer every time we want to type in Japanese, it's extremely cumbersome.

translation: Extremely; utterly; very; so; cannot be more; extreme; utmost
explanation: A phrase that indicates that something or someone is in an extreme state.
japanese: 新しく入ったアパートはキッチンの流しが高くて、私のように背の低いものは使いづらいことこの上ない。
reading: 新しく入ったアパートはキッチンの流しが高くて、私のように背の低いものは使いづらいことこの上ない。
english: The sink in my new apartment is tall, which makes it extremely hard to use for someone short like me.

translation: Extremely; utterly; very; so; cannot be more; extreme; utmost
explanation: A phrase that indicates that something or someone is in an extreme state.
japanese: 一人でハワイに来て、この上ない解放感に満たされている。
reading: 一人でハワイに来て、この上ない解放感に<ruby title="満(み)"><rb>満</rb><rt>み</rt></ruby>たされている。
english: Having come to Hawaii by myself, I'm ﬁlled with a feeling of utmost freedom.

translation: Extremely; utterly; very; so; cannot be more; extreme; utmost
explanation: A phrase that indicates that something or someone is in an extreme state.
japanese: ご出席いただいた皆様からこの上ないお褒めの言葉をいただきました。
reading: ご出席いただいた皆様からこの上ないお<ruby title="褒(ほ)"><rb>褒</rb><rt>ほ</rt></ruby>めの言葉をいただきました。
english: I received the utmost praise from those who attended.

translation: Extremely; utterly; very; so; cannot be more; extreme; utmost
explanation: A phrase that indicates that something or someone is in an extreme state.
japanese: 彼とやっと一緒の生活を始めることができ、この上ない幸福感に浸っている。
reading: 彼とやっと一緒の生活を始めることができ、この上ない幸福感に浸っている。
english: Finally, I can start living with my boyfriend; I couldn't be happier.

translation: Extremely; utterly; very; so; cannot be more; extreme; utmost
explanation: A phrase that indicates that something or someone is in an extreme state.
japanese: この国は、他の国の批判に耳を貸すこともなく、この上ないごう慢さをもって自国のイデオロギーを主張し続けている。
reading: この国は、他の国の批判に耳を貸すこともなく、この上ないごう慢さをもって自国のイデオロギーを主張し続けている。
english: This country keeps insisting with utmost arrogance on its ideology without paying attention to other countries' criticisms.

translation: How ~!; what a(n) ~!
explanation: A sentence final, exclamatory phrase used in written language.
japanese: カルフォルニアは何と太陽が明るいことか。
reading: カルフォルニアは何と太陽が明るいことか。
english: How bright the sun is in California!

translation: How ~!; what a(n) ~!
explanation: A sentence final, exclamatory phrase used in written language.
japanese: 私は今までに何度オーストラリアを訪ねたことか。
reading: 私は今までに何度オーストラリアを訪ねたことか。
english: How many times have I visited Australia before now!

translation: How ~!; what a(n) ~!
explanation: A sentence final, exclamatory phrase used in written language.
japanese: アメリカの大学に比べると日本の大学は何と貧弱に見えることか。
reading: アメリカの大学に比べると日本の大学は何と貧弱に見えることか。
english: When compared with American universities, how unimpressive Japanese universities look!

translation: How ~!; what a(n) ~!
explanation: A sentence final, exclamatory phrase used in written language.
japanese: ペダルを踏み替える時に膝がハンドルにぶつかる車がどんなに多いことか。
reading: ペダルを踏み替える時に膝がハンドルにぶつかる車がどんなに多いことか。
english: How many cars are there in which the driver's knee hits the steering wheel whenever he switches pedals!

translation: How ~!; what a(n) ~!
explanation: A sentence final, exclamatory phrase used in written language.
japanese: 日本語がよく読めるようになるためにどれぐらい勉強したことか。
reading: 日本語がよく読めるようになるためにどれぐらい勉強したことか。
english: How much I studied in order to read Japanese well!

translation: How ~!; what a(n) ~!
explanation: A sentence final, exclamatory phrase used in written language.
japanese: 新鮮な魚を探して何軒の魚屋を見て歩いたことか。
reading: 新鮮な魚を探して何軒の魚屋を見て歩いたことか。
english: How many ﬁsh shops I have gone to in search of fresh ﬁsh!

translation: How ~!; what a(n) ~!
explanation: A sentence final, exclamatory phrase used in written language.
japanese: この数学の問題を解くのに何時問使ったことか。
reading: この数学の問題を解くのに何時間使ったことか。
english: How many hours I have spent to solve this mathematical problem!

translation: How ~!; what a(n) ~!
explanation: A sentence final, exclamatory phrase used in written language.
japanese: 日本人はいかにしばしば内と外の行動を区別することか。
reading: 日本人はいかにしばしば内と外の行動を区別することか。
english: How often Japanese differentiate their behaviour in inside and outside spaces!

translation: How ~!; what a(n) ~!
explanation: A sentence final, exclamatory phrase used in written language.
japanese: 二人はどれだけ強く愛し合っていたことか。
reading: 二人はどれだけ強く愛し合っていたことか。
english: How strongly the two loved each other!

translation: Because; due to; from the fact that ~; cause; trigger
explanation: A phrase that expresses a reason or a cause.
japanese: 彼はアリバイが成立しなかったことから犯行の嫌疑がかかった。
reading: 彼はアリバイが成立しなかったことから犯行の嫌疑がかかった。
english: Due to the fact that he couldn't establish an alibi, he was suspected of a criminal act.

translation: Because; due to; from the fact that ~; cause; trigger
explanation: A phrase that expresses a reason or a cause.
japanese: 妙なことから二人の関係は悪化した。
reading: 妙なことから二人の関係は悪化した。
english: The relationship between the two people deteriorated due to strange circumstances.

translation: Because; due to; from the fact that ~; cause; trigger
explanation: A phrase that expresses a reason or a cause.
japanese: その教授は学生に高圧的だったことから、学生にひどく嫌われていた。
reading: その教授は学生に高圧的だったことから、学生にひどく嫌われていた。
english: The professor was so overbearing towards his students that he was thoroughly hated by them.

translation: Because; due to; from the fact that ~; cause; trigger
explanation: A phrase that expresses a reason or a cause.
japanese: 今年は大学創立から250年に当たることから、盛大な記念祝典が開かれた。
reading: 今年は大学創立から250年に当たることから、盛大な記念祝典が開かれた。
english: Because it is the 250th year since the founding of the college, there was a magniﬁcent anniversary ceremony this year.
extra_notes: 当たる =〔相当する・対応する〕 be equivalent] 《to…》; correspond to…; 〔金銭的に換算される〕 be worth…; 〔時日が〕 fall on…

translation: Because; due to; from the fact that ~; cause; trigger
explanation: A phrase that expresses a reason or a cause.
japanese: 私が余計なことを言ったことから議論が紛糾した。
reading: 私が余計なことを言ったことから議論が紛糾した。
english: The discussion became complicated because I said something uncalled for.

translation: Because; due to; from the fact that ~; cause; trigger
explanation: A phrase that expresses a reason or a cause.
japanese: 魚を水槽内で飼って行う研究は、長期的な観察が可能であることから、汎用性のあるデータが取得しやすい。
reading: 魚を水槽内で飼って行う研究は、長期的な観察が可能であることから、汎用性のあるデータが取得しやすい。
english: Keeping ﬁsh in a tank for research allows us to obtain data for general use because long-term observation is possible.

translation: Because; due to; from the fact that ~; cause; trigger
explanation: A phrase that expresses a reason or a cause.
japanese: 首相は不用意な言動が多かったことから、不信任案が議会で可決された。
reading: 首相は不用意な言動が多かったことから、不信任案が議会で可決された。
english: Because the prime minister was often careless in his statements and behaviour, a no-conﬁdence motion was passed in Parliament.

translation: Because; due to; from the fact that ~; cause; trigger
explanation: A phrase that expresses a reason or a cause.
japanese: 本当にささいなことから会談は中止になってしまった。
reading: 本当にささいなことから会談は中止になってしまった。
english: Because of a really trivial matter the conference broke up.

translation: It is ~ that; I am ~ that; we are ~ that; to my/our ~; ~ly
explanation: A phrase that expresses the speaker’s/ writer’s emotion or subjective judgment.
japanese: 嬉しいことに、今学期は祭日が3日もある。
reading: 嬉しいことに、今学期は祭日が 3日[みっか]もある。
english: I'm glad that there are (as many as) three holidays this term.

translation: It is ~ that; I am ~ that; we are ~ that; to my/our ~; ~ly
explanation: A phrase that expresses the speaker’s/ writer’s emotion or subjective judgment.
japanese: 残念なことに、この本は絶版で、普通の本屋では手に入らない。
reading: 残念なことに、この本は絶版で、普通の本屋では手に<ruby title="入(はい)"><rb>入</rb><rt>はい</rt></ruby>らない。
english: To my regret, this book is out of print and cannot be purchased at ordinary bookstores.

translation: It is ~ that; I am ~ that; we are ~ that; to my/our ~; ~ly
explanation: A phrase that expresses the speaker’s/ writer’s emotion or subjective judgment.
japanese: 驚いたことに、村田さんはあんなに気に入っていた会社を半年で辞めてしまった。
reading: 驚いたことに、村田さんはあんなに気に入っていた会社を半年で辞めてしまった。
english: I was surprised that Mr. Murata quit his job after six months- he seemed so excited about his work.

translation: It is ~ that; I am ~ that; we are ~ that; to my/our ~; ~ly
explanation: A phrase that expresses the speaker’s/ writer’s emotion or subjective judgment.
japanese: 恥ずかしいことに、私は英文学専攻でありながら英語が話せない。
reading: 恥ずかしいことに、私は英文学専攻でありながら英語が話せない。
english: It's embarrassing, but I can't speak English despite the fact that I'm an English literature major.

translation: It is ~ that; I am ~ that; we are ~ that; to my/our ~; ~ly
explanation: A phrase that expresses the speaker’s/ writer’s emotion or subjective judgment.
japanese: 面白いことに、ハワイの日系人の方が日本人より日本の古い伝統をよく守っているという。
reading: 面白いことに、ハワイの日系人の方が日本人より日本の古い伝統をよく守っているという。
english: Interestingly, they say that Japanese-Americans in Hawaii maintain old Japanese traditions better than (Japanese) people in Japan.

translation: It is ~ that; I am ~ that; we are ~ that; to my/our ~; ~ly
explanation: A phrase that expresses the speaker’s/ writer’s emotion or subjective judgment.
japanese: 悪いことに、オーディションの前の日に風邪を引いてしまった。
reading: 悪いことに、オーディションの前の日に風邪を引いてしまった。
english: Unfortunately, I caught a cold the day before my audition.

translation: It is ~ that; I am ~ that; we are ~ that; to my/our ~; ~ly
explanation: A phrase that expresses the speaker’s/ writer’s emotion or subjective judgment.
japanese: 悔しいことに、私はロジャーに負けた。
reading: 悔しいことに、私はロジャーに負けた。
english: I was frustrated by my loss to Roger.

translation: It is ~ that; I am ~ that; we are ~ that; to my/our ~; ~ly
explanation: A phrase that expresses the speaker’s/ writer’s emotion or subjective judgment.
japanese: 吉岡さんのところの悦子ちゃんは、感心なことに、お母さんが仕事で遅くなる時は自分で晩ご飯を作るんだそうです。
reading: 吉岡さんのところの悦子ちゃんは、感心なことに、お母さんが仕事で遅くなる時は自分で晩ご飯を作るんだそうです。
english: I'm so impressed with Etsuko, Yoshioka's daughter; they say she ﬁxes dinner herself when her mother is late because of work.

translation: It is ~ that; I am ~ that; we are ~ that; to my/our ~; ~ly
explanation: A phrase that expresses the speaker’s/ writer’s emotion or subjective judgment.
japanese: 浄水器は濾過の過程で塩素をすべて取り去ってしまうため、濾過した瞬間から水は腐敗の危険にさらされる。さらに心配なことに、濾過材に残った水から大量に細菌が繁殖するといった問題が報道された。
reading: 浄水器は濾過の過程で塩素をすべて取り去ってしまうため、濾過した瞬間から水は腐敗の危険にさらされる。さらに心配なことに、濾過材に残った水から大量に細菌が繁殖するといった問題が報道された。
english: Because water purifiers remove all the chlorine in the purification process, from the moment it's been purified, there's a risk the water will get contaminated (literally: rot). What's even more worrisome, bacteria can multiply in the water left in the (puriﬁcation) ﬁxtures, according to media reports.

translation: It is ~ that; I am ~ that; we are ~ that; to my/our ~; ~ly
explanation: A phrase that expresses the speaker’s/ writer’s emotion or subjective judgment.
japanese: 厄介なことに、この種の詐欺は被害者が世間体のために警察に届けを出さないことが多く、これが犯人検挙を難しくしている。
reading: 厄介なことに、この種の詐欺は被害者が世間体のために警察に届けを出さないことが多く、これが犯人検挙を難しくしている。
english: The trouble is, this kind of fraud is seldom reported to the police because the victims want to save face, which makes it hard to arrest the culprits.

translation: It is ~ that; I am ~ that; we are ~ that; to my/our ~; ~ly
explanation: A phrase that expresses the speaker’s/ writer’s emotion or subjective judgment.
japanese: 困ったことに、日本のDVDはアメリカのプレーヤーで見られないのです。
reading: 困ったことに、日本のDVDはアメリカのプレーヤーで見られないのです。
english: The problem is that Japanese DVDs cannot be viewed on American (DVD) players.

translation: It is ~ that; I am ~ that; we are ~ that; to my/our ~; ~ly
explanation: A phrase that expresses the speaker’s/ writer’s emotion or subjective judgment.
japanese: 腹の立つことに、私のフライトは5時間も待たされたあげく、キャンセルされた。
reading: 腹の立つことに、私のフライトは5時間も待たされたあげく、キャンセルされた。
english: It was maddening: After I was kept waiting for my ﬂight for ﬁve full hours, in the end it was cancelled.

translation: In addition; and additionally; what’s more
explanation: A conjunction that means “in addition to what has just been mentioned”.
japanese: この冬のアメリカ東部は雪、雨、加えて強風の被害が大きかった。
reading: この冬のアメリカ東部は雪、雨、加えて強風の被害が大きかった。
english: This winter the East Coast of the U.S. suffered terribly from snow, rain and, in addition, strong winds.

translation: In addition; and additionally; what’s more
explanation: A conjunction that means “in addition to what has just been mentioned”.
japanese: この辺は物価が安い。（それに）加えて自然環境もすばらしい。
reading: この辺は物価が安い。（それに）加えて自然環境もすばらしい。
english: Things are inexpensive in this neighbourhood. What's more, the natural environment is amazing.

translation: In addition; and additionally; what’s more
explanation: A conjunction that means “in addition to what has just been mentioned”.
japanese: この作家の小説は想像力の豊かさ、鮮明な文体、加えて、極めて音楽的なリズム感がある。
reading: この作家の小説は想像力の豊かさ、鮮明な文体、加えて、極めて音楽的なリズム感がある。
english: The novels of this author are richly imaginative, have a clear-cut style, and, in addition, have a highly musical rhythm.

translation: In addition; and additionally; what’s more
explanation: A conjunction that means “in addition to what has just been mentioned”.
japanese: 金融業の倒産、失業率の上昇、加えて、不安定な政治状況によって、この国の経済は沈滞している。
reading: 金融業の倒産、失業率の上昇、加えて、不安定な政治状況によって、この国の経済は沈滞している。
english: The bankruptcy of ﬁnancial institutions, the rise in the unemployment rate, and, additionally, political instability are causing the stagnation of this country's economy.

translation: In addition; and additionally; what’s more
explanation: A conjunction that means “in addition to what has just been mentioned”.
japanese: 彼女はおしゃべりが好きで、とても明るい。それに加えて、なかなかユニークなキャラクターだ。
reading: 彼女はおしゃべりが好きで、とても明るい。それに加えて、なかなかユニークなキャラクターだ。
english: She likes to chat and is very cheerful. In addition, she has a unique character.

translation: In addition; and additionally; what’s more
explanation: A conjunction that means “in addition to what has just been mentioned”.
japanese: 北海道の秋は紅葉がきれいだ。加えて、空気がからっと乾燥していて気持ちがいい。
reading: 北海道の秋は紅葉がきれいだ。加えて、空気がからっと乾燥していて気持ちがいい。
english: The fall foliage in Hokkaido is beautiful. In addition, the crisp, dry air feels good.

translation: In addition; and additionally; what’s more
explanation: A conjunction that means “in addition to what has just been mentioned”.
japanese: 京都は神社仏閣がたくさんある。加えて、魅力的な日本庭園も多い。
reading: 京都は神社仏閣がたくさんある。加えて、魅力的な日本庭園も多い。
english: Kyoto has many shrines and temples. In addition, it has many charming traditional gardens.

translation: Just; merely; only
explanation: A phrase indicating someone’s decision to cope with a negative situation, or a simple, straight forward reason for his/her action.
japanese: もしTOEFLの点が悪かったらもう一度受けるまで（のこと）だ。
reading: もしTOEFLの点が悪かったらもう一度受けるまで（のこと）だ。
english: If my TOEFL score isn't good, then I'll just take the test again.

translation: Just; merely; only
explanation: A phrase indicating someone’s decision to cope with a negative situation, or a simple, straight forward reason for his/her action.
japanese: 日本語は面白そうだったので、取ったまで（このと）だ。
reading: 日本語は面白そうだったので、取ったまで（のこと）だ。
english: I took Japanese language only because it looked interesting (not for any other reason).

translation: Just; merely; only
explanation: A phrase indicating someone’s decision to cope with a negative situation, or a simple, straight forward reason for his/her action.
japanese: 結婚できなかったら、一生独身で仕事をするまでのことだ。
reading: 結婚できなかったら、一生独身で仕事をするまでのことだ。
english: If I cannot marry I will just stay single for the rest of my life and do my work.

translation: Just; merely; only
explanation: A phrase indicating someone’s decision to cope with a negative situation, or a simple, straight forward reason for his/her action.
japanese: 就職できなかったら、フリーターになるまでのことだ。
reading: 就職できなかったら、フリーターになるまでのことだ。
english: If I cannot get a regular job, I will just become a permanent part-time worker.

translation: Just; merely; only
explanation: A phrase indicating someone’s decision to cope with a negative situation, or a simple, straight forward reason for his/her action.
japanese: バスが来ないんなら歩いて帰るまでだ。
reading: バスが来ないんなら歩いて帰るまでだ。
english: If a bus doesn't come, I will just walk home.

translation: Just; merely; only
explanation: A phrase indicating someone’s decision to cope with a negative situation, or a simple, straight forward reason for his/her action.
japanese: 夕食にどうぞと言われたから彼女のアパートに行ったまでだ。とやかく言われる筋合いはない。
reading: 夕食にどうぞと言われたから彼女のアパートに行ったまでだ。とやかく言われる筋合いはない。
english: I went to her apartment just because she invited me over to dinner. You have no right to criticize.

translation: Just; merely; only
explanation: A phrase indicating someone’s decision to cope with a negative situation, or a simple, straight forward reason for his/her action.
japanese: 小説みたいなものを書いたが、別に小説家になりたいと思ったのではない。小説を書くということがどんなことか知りたかったまでのことだ。
reading: 小説みたいなものを書いたが、別に小説家になりたいと思ったのではない。小説を書くということがどんなことか知りたかったまでのことだ。
english: I've written something like a novel, but I never particularly thought I wanted to be a novelist. I just wanted to know what it was like to write a novel. That's all.

translation: Just; merely; only
explanation: A phrase indicating someone’s decision to cope with a negative situation, or a simple, straight forward reason for his/her action.
japanese: あなたに私の個人的なことを話したのは、あなたの将来に多少役立つかと思ったまでのことです。
reading: あなたに私の個人的なことを話したのは、あなたの将来に多少 役立[やくだ]つかと思ったまでのことです。
english: The reason I told you about my personal matters is just because I thought it would be somewhat useful for you in the future.

translation: To say nothing of; not to speak of; let alone; still more; much less; all the more reason why
explanation: An adverb expressing the idea that because one statement is true, the subsequent statement is naturally true.
japanese: アパートの家賃を払うのが精一杯なのに、まして（や）家を買うなんて夢物語だ。
reading: アパートの家賃を払うのが精一杯なのに、まして（や）家を買うなんて夢物語だ。
english: I am just managing to pay the rent for my apartment; how much more of a dream it is to imagine buying my own house!

translation: To say nothing of; not to speak of; let alone; still more; much less; all the more reason why
explanation: An adverb expressing the idea that because one statement is true, the subsequent statement is naturally true.
japanese: 彼女は日本語で講演もできる。まして（や）日常会話など問題ではない。
reading: 彼女は日本語で講演もできる。まして（や）日常会話など問題ではない。
english: She can give a speech in Japanese, to say nothing of (her ability to handle) everyday conversation.

translation: To say nothing of; not to speak of; let alone; still more; much less; all the more reason why
explanation: An adverb expressing the idea that because one statement is true, the subsequent statement is naturally true.
japanese: この小説は大人にも読みにくいのに、まして小学生に読めるはずがない。
reading: この小説は大人にも読みにくいのに、まして小学生に読めるはずがない。
english: This novel is hard even for adults to read much less elementary school students.

translation: To say nothing of; not to speak of; let alone; still more; much less; all the more reason why
explanation: An adverb expressing the idea that because one statement is true, the subsequent statement is naturally true.
japanese: 彼は簡単な日本語すら話せない。ましてや、書くことなど思いもよらない。
reading: 彼は簡単な日本語すら話せない。ましてや、書くことなど思いもよらない。
english: He cannot even speak Japanese; all the more reason why him writing in it would be unexpected.

translation: To say nothing of; not to speak of; let alone; still more; much less; all the more reason why
explanation: An adverb expressing the idea that because one statement is true, the subsequent statement is naturally true.
japanese: 僕は自転車さえ買えない。まして、車を買うなんて不可能だ。
reading: 僕は自転車さえ買えない。まして、車を買うなんて不可能だ。
english: I can't even buy a bike, let alone a car.

translation: To say nothing of; not to speak of; let alone; still more; much less; all the more reason why
explanation: An adverb expressing the idea that because one statement is true, the subsequent statement is naturally true.
japanese: 国内での単身赴任でもつらい。ましてや、外国での単身赴任となるともっとつらい。
reading: 国内での単身赴任でもつらい。ましてや、外国での単身赴任となるともっとつらい。
english: To be sent alone to a new post within Japan is hard. It is still harder to go overseas to work without one's family.

translation: To say nothing of; not to speak of; let alone; still more; much less; all the more reason why
explanation: An adverb expressing the idea that because one statement is true, the subsequent statement is naturally true.
japanese: この数学の問題は教授でも解けないのだから、まして、学生の僕に解けるはずがない。
reading: この数学の問題は<ruby title="教授(きょうじゅ)"><rb>教授</rb><rt>きょうじゅ</rt></ruby>でも解けないのだから、まして、学生の僕に解けるはずがない。
english: Even a professor cannot solve this math problem much less a student like me.

translation: To say nothing of; not to speak of; let alone; still more; much less; all the more reason why
explanation: An adverb expressing the idea that because one statement is true, the subsequent statement is naturally true.
japanese: 65歳の人が毎日一キロ泳いでいるんです。まして、32歳のあなたが同じことができないわけがないですよ。
reading: 65歳の人が毎日一キロ泳いでいるんです。まして、32歳のあなたが同じことができないわけがないですよ。
english: There's a 65-year-old man who swims one kilometre every day. All the more reason why a 32-year-old like you should be able to do the same.

translation: To say nothing of; not to speak of; let alone; still more; much less; all the more reason why
explanation: An adverb expressing the idea that because one statement is true, the subsequent statement is naturally true.
japanese: ニューヨークのような大都市でも犯罪率を下げることに成功している。ましてや、中小都市なら十分可能だろう。
reading: ニューヨークのような大都市でも犯罪率を下げることに成功している。ましてや、中小都市なら十分可能だろう。
english: Even a big city like New York has been successful in lowering the crime rate, which is all the more reason why mid- and small-sized cities should be able to lower theirs.

translation: To say nothing of; not to speak of; let alone; still more; much less; all the more reason why
explanation: An adverb expressing the idea that because one statement is true, the subsequent statement is naturally true.
japanese: このちっぽけな蟻だって協力し合っているんです。まして、頭脳の発達した人間にそれができないわけはないでしょう。
reading: このちっぽけな蟻だって協力し合っているんです。まして、頭脳の発達した人間にそれができないわけはないでしょう。
english: These tiny ants are cooperating with each other—all the more reason why humans with our developed brains should be able to do the same.

translation: Again; also; too; (not) ~ either; and; additionally; or
explanation: An adverb/conjunction that indicates repetition or addition.
japanese: 来年の春、またお会いします。
reading: 来年の春、またお会いします。
english: I will see you again next spring.

translation: Again; also; too; (not) ~ either; and; additionally; or
explanation: An adverb/conjunction that indicates repetition or addition.
japanese: 山田も東京出身だが、林もまた東京出身だ。
reading: 山田も東京<ruby title="出身(しゅっしん)"><rb>出身</rb><rt>しゅっしん</rt></ruby>だが、林もまた東京出身だ。
english: Yamada is from Tokyo, and Hayashi, too, is from Tokyo.

translation: Again; also; too; (not) ~ either; and; additionally; or
explanation: An adverb/conjunction that indicates repetition or addition.
japanese: 机に座ってものを考えるのもいいが、歩きながら考えるのもまたいい。
reading: 机に座ってものを考えるのもいいが、歩きながら考えるのもまたいい。
english: Thinking while sitting at a desk is ﬁne, but thinking while walking is also good.

translation: Again; also; too; (not) ~ either; and; additionally; or
explanation: An adverb/conjunction that indicates repetition or addition.
japanese: この日本語の教科書は内容も面白く、また文法の記述が正確だ。
reading: この日本語の教科書は内容も面白く、また文法の記述が正確だ。
english: This Japanese textbook is interesting, and the grammar explanations are also accurate.

translation: Again; also; too; (not) ~ either; and; additionally; or
explanation: An adverb/conjunction that indicates repetition or addition.
japanese: 発表は英語でしてもよい。また、日本語でしてもよい。
reading: 発表は英語でしてもよい。また、日本語でしてもよい。
english: You may present your paper in English. Or, you may do so in Japanese.

translation: Again; also; too; (not) ~ either; and; additionally; or
explanation: An adverb/conjunction that indicates repetition or addition.
japanese: 発表は英語でしてよいし、また、日本語でしてもよい。
reading: 発表は英語でしてよいし、また、日本語でしてもよい。
english: You may present your paper in English or you may do so in Japanese.

translation: Again; also; too; (not) ~ either; and; additionally; or
explanation: An adverb/conjunction that indicates repetition or addition.
japanese: 今日もまた雪が降った。
reading: 今日もまた雪が降った。
english: It snowed again today.

translation: Again; also; too; (not) ~ either; and; additionally; or
explanation: An adverb/conjunction that indicates repetition or addition.
japanese: また風邪をひいちゃった。
reading: また風邪をひいちゃった。
english: I caught a cold again!

translation: Again; also; too; (not) ~ either; and; additionally; or
explanation: An adverb/conjunction that indicates repetition or addition.
japanese: 大統領もまた人間だ。過ちを犯すこともあるだろう。
reading: 大統領もまた人間だ。過ちを犯すこともあるだろう。
english: The president is also human. He may sometimes make mistakes.

translation: Again; also; too; (not) ~ either; and; additionally; or
explanation: An adverb/conjunction that indicates repetition or addition.
japanese: 大学で勉強をするのはもちろん大切だが、生涯の友達を作るのもまた大切だ。
reading: 大学で勉強をするのはもちろん大切だが、生涯の友達を作るのもまた大切だ。
english: Needless to say, it is very important to study at college, but it is also important to make lifetime friends there.

translation: Again; also; too; (not) ~ either; and; additionally; or
explanation: An adverb/conjunction that indicates repetition or addition.
japanese: 彼は優れた研究者であり、また、優れた教育者でもある。
reading: 彼は優れた研究者であり、また、優れた教育者でもある。
english: He is a ﬁne researcher, and he is also a ﬁne educator.

translation: Again; also; too; (not) ~ either; and; additionally; or
explanation: An adverb/conjunction that indicates repetition or addition.
japanese: 日本は失業率が高くなってきている。また、株価も急落している。
reading: 日本は失業率が高くなってきている。また、株価も急落している。
english: In Japan, the unemployment rate is on the rise. And additionally, stock prices are rapidly dropping.

translation: Again; also; too; (not) ~ either; and; additionally; or
explanation: An adverb/conjunction that indicates repetition or addition.
japanese: この会議には出席してもよい。また、出席しなくてもよい。
reading: この会議には出席してもよい。また、出席しなくてもよい。
english: You may attend this meeting. But, you don't have to attend.

translation: Again; also; too; (not) ~ either; and; additionally; or
explanation: An adverb/conjunction that indicates repetition or addition.
japanese: 日中間の相互理解を図る上で、文化交流は大変重要だし、また大変有益だ。
reading: 日中間の相互理解を図る上で、文化交流は大変重要だし、また大変有益だ。
english: In (literally: from the viewpoint of) achieving mutual understanding between Japan and China cultural exchange is very important, and beneﬁcial as well.

translation: Rarely; seldom; hardly; almost never
explanation: A structure that indicates extremely low frequency.
japanese: この辺りでは地震は滅多に起きない。
reading: この辺りでは地震は滅多に起きない。
english: Earthquakes seldom occur in this area.

translation: Rarely; seldom; hardly; almost never
explanation: A structure that indicates extremely low frequency.
japanese: 日本の父親は忙しいので、週末でも滅多にうちにいない。
reading: 日本の父親は忙しいので、週末でも滅多にうちにいない。
english: Japanese fathers are so busy that even on weekends they are seldom at home.

translation: Rarely; seldom; hardly; almost never
explanation: A structure that indicates extremely low frequency.
japanese: 大学時代の同級生とは滅多に合えない。
reading: 大学時代の同級生とは滅多に合えない。
english: I can hardly ever see my college classmates.

translation: Rarely; seldom; hardly; almost never
explanation: A structure that indicates extremely low frequency.
japanese: 日本の車は滅多に故障しないので、外海で人気がある。
reading: 日本の車は滅多に故障しないので、外海で人気がある。
english: Because Japanese cars rarely break down, they are popular abroad.

translation: Rarely; seldom; hardly; almost never
explanation: A structure that indicates extremely low frequency.
japanese: 汚染のためにこの川では滅多に魚が泳いでいるのを見られなくなった。
reading: 汚染のためにこの川では滅多に魚が泳いでいるのを見られなくなった。
english: Due to pollution, we almost never see fish swimming in this river now.

translation: Visibly; obviously; really look; can be easily recognised as; can tell just by looking at ~
explanation: A phrase indicating that something can be (obviously) recognized through visual cues.
japanese: 太陽の光をたっぷり浴びたみかんは、見るからにおいしそうだ。
reading: 太陽の光をたっぷり浴びたみかんは、見るからにおいしそうだ。
english: The sun-bathed mandarin oranges look really delicious.

translation: Visibly; obviously; really look; can be easily recognised as; can tell just by looking at ~
explanation: A phrase indicating that something can be (obviously) recognized through visual cues.
japanese: 彼女が身につけているものは見るからに高級品だった。
reading: 彼女が身につけているものは見るからに高級品だった。
english: What she wears is obviously of high quality.

translation: Visibly; obviously; really look; can be easily recognised as; can tell just by looking at ~
explanation: A phrase indicating that something can be (obviously) recognized through visual cues.
japanese: このパンは見るからに手作りという感じですね。
reading: このパンは見るからに手作りという感じですね。
english: This bread is obviously homemade.

translation: Visibly; obviously; really look; can be easily recognised as; can tell just by looking at ~
explanation: A phrase indicating that something can be (obviously) recognized through visual cues.
japanese: その青年は見るからに聡明そうだった。
reading: その青年は見るからに聡明そうだった。
english: You could tell just by looking that the young man was intelligent.

translation: Visibly; obviously; really look; can be easily recognised as; can tell just by looking at ~
explanation: A phrase indicating that something can be (obviously) recognized through visual cues.
japanese: 老人が見るからに重そうな買い物袋を抱えて歩いている。
reading: 老人が見るからに重そうな<ruby title="買い物(かいもの)"><rb>買い物</rb><rt>かいもの</rt></ruby><ruby title="袋(ぶくろ)"><rb>袋</rb><rt>ぶくろ</rt></ruby>を抱えて歩いている。
english: The old man is walking with a shopping bag that is obviously heavy.

translation: Visibly; obviously; really look; can be easily recognised as; can tell just by looking at ~
explanation: A phrase indicating that something can be (obviously) recognized through visual cues.
japanese: その写真には見るからに寂しそうな孤児たちが写っていた。
reading: その写真には見るからに寂しそうな孤児たちが写っていた。
english: In that picture the orphans were obviously lonely.

translation: Visibly; obviously; really look; can be easily recognised as; can tell just by looking at ~
explanation: A phrase indicating that something can be (obviously) recognized through visual cues.
japanese: 半身・淡路大震災の時は見るからに新聞記者らしい人たちが大勢写真を撮っていた。
reading: 阪神・淡路大震災の時は見るからに新聞記者らしい人たちが大勢写真を撮っていた。
english: At the time of the Great Hanshin-Awaji Earthquake, a lot of people who could easily be recognized as news reporters were taking pictures.

translation: Visibly; obviously; really look; can be easily recognised as; can tell just by looking at ~
explanation: A phrase indicating that something can be (obviously) recognized through visual cues.
japanese: 見るからにジューシーなお肉にかぶりつくと、うまみが口の中に広がっていった。
reading: 見るからにジューシーなお肉にかぶりつくと、うまみが口の中に広がっていった。
english: I took a big bite into a visibly juicy piece of meat. Delicious ﬂavour started to ﬁll my mouth.

translation: Visibly; obviously; really look; can be easily recognised as; can tell just by looking at ~
explanation: A phrase indicating that something can be (obviously) recognized through visual cues.
japanese: このスープは野菜たっぷりで、見るからに体によさそう！
reading: このスープは野菜たっぷりで、見るからに体によさそう！
english: This soup has plenty of vegetables and looks really healthy!

translation: Visibly; obviously; really look; can be easily recognised as; can tell just by looking at ~
explanation: A phrase indicating that something can be (obviously) recognized through visual cues.
japanese: この男の人、見るからに誠実で優しそうね。
reading: この男の人、見るからに誠実で優しそうね。
english: This man looks really honest and kind, doesn't he?

translation: There are times when ~ and/or ~; sometimes ~ and sometimes ~; sometimes do things like ~ and ~; some (people/etc.) ~ and some (people/etc.) ~
explanation: A structure used to present typical examples of actions, events, situations, people, or things among a number of possibilities.
japanese: 父は感情的な人ではないが、時に怒りもすれば泣きもする。
reading: 父は感情的な人ではないが、時に怒りもすれば泣きもする。
english: My father is not an emotional person, but there are times when he gets angry and times when he cries.

translation: There are times when ~ and/or ~; sometimes ~ and sometimes ~; sometimes do things like ~ and ~; some (people/etc.) ~ and some (people/etc.) ~
explanation: A structure used to present typical examples of actions, events, situations, people, or things among a number of possibilities.
japanese: 私だってロックも聞けばダンスもする。
reading: 私だってロックも聞けばダンスもする。
english: Even I sometimes (do things like) listen to rock music and dance.

translation: There are times when ~ and/or ~; sometimes ~ and sometimes ~; sometimes do things like ~ and ~; some (people/etc.) ~ and some (people/etc.) ~
explanation: A structure used to present typical examples of actions, events, situations, people, or things among a number of possibilities.
japanese: 日本全国が担当地域なので、北海道（へ）も行けば沖縄（へ）も行く。
reading: 日本全国が担当地域なので、北海道（へ）も行けば沖縄（へ）も行く。
english: Because my area of responsibility covers all of Japan, I may go to Hokkaido or Okinawa (or wherever else in Japan).

translation: There are times when ~ and/or ~; sometimes ~ and sometimes ~; sometimes do things like ~ and ~; some (people/etc.) ~ and some (people/etc.) ~
explanation: A structure used to present typical examples of actions, events, situations, people, or things among a number of possibilities.
japanese: 交通事情によって三十分で行けることもあれば一時間以上かかることもある。
reading: 交通事情によって三十分で行けることもあれば一時間以上かかることもある。
english: Depending on the trafﬁc situation, sometimes it takes only 30 minutes to get there and sometimes it takes more than an hour.

translation: There are times when ~ and/or ~; sometimes ~ and sometimes ~; sometimes do things like ~ and ~; some (people/etc.) ~ and some (people/etc.) ~
explanation: A structure used to present typical examples of actions, events, situations, people, or things among a number of possibilities.
japanese: 円満な夫婦は口論もすれば不満も言い合う。
reading: 円満な夫婦は口論もすれば不満も言い合う。
english: A happy husband and wife may sometimes argue and sometimes complain to each other.

translation: There are times when ~ and/or ~; sometimes ~ and sometimes ~; sometimes do things like ~ and ~; some (people/etc.) ~ and some (people/etc.) ~
explanation: A structure used to present typical examples of actions, events, situations, people, or things among a number of possibilities.
japanese: 私は子供をよく可愛がるが、悪いことをしたら怒りもすれば叱りもする。
reading: 私は子供をよく可愛がるが、悪いことをしたら怒りもすれば<ruby title="叱(しか)"><rb>叱</rb><rt>しか</rt></ruby>りもする。
english: I adore my children, but when they do something bad, sometimes I get mad and sometimes I scold them.

translation: There are times when ~ and/or ~; sometimes ~ and sometimes ~; sometimes do things like ~ and ~; some (people/etc.) ~ and some (people/etc.) ~
explanation: A structure used to present typical examples of actions, events, situations, people, or things among a number of possibilities.
japanese: この学会では英語で発表する人もいれば日本語で発表する人もいる。
reading: この学会では英語で発表する人もいれば日本語で発表する人もいる。
english: At this conference some people give presentations in English and some give them in Japanese.

translation: There are times when ~ and/or ~; sometimes ~ and sometimes ~; sometimes do things like ~ and ~; some (people/etc.) ~ and some (people/etc.) ~
explanation: A structure used to present typical examples of actions, events, situations, people, or things among a number of possibilities.
japanese: 人生は晴れの日もあれば雨の日もある。
reading: 人生は晴れの日もあれば雨の日もある。
english: In life, there are sunny days as well as rainy days.

translation: There are times when ~ and/or ~; sometimes ~ and sometimes ~; sometimes do things like ~ and ~; some (people/etc.) ~ and some (people/etc.) ~
explanation: A structure used to present typical examples of actions, events, situations, people, or things among a number of possibilities.
japanese: うちの会社は服装の規則がないので、スーツを着て行く時もあればセーターで行く時もある。
reading: うちの会社は服装の規則がないので、スーツを着て行く時もあればセーターで行く時もある。
english: Because my company has no dress code, sometimes I go in a suit and sometimes in a sweater.

translation: There are times when ~ and/or ~; sometimes ~ and sometimes ~; sometimes do things like ~ and ~; some (people/etc.) ~ and some (people/etc.) ~
explanation: A structure used to present typical examples of actions, events, situations, people, or things among a number of possibilities.
japanese: 担当の先生が来られない時は、代わりの先生を頼むこともあれば、やむを得ず休講にすることもある。
reading: 担当の先生が来られない時は、代わりの先生を頼むこともあれば、やむを得ず休講にすることもある。
english: When the teacher in charge of the class cannot come, we sometimes ask a substitute to teach, and sometimes have no choice but to cancel class.

translation: There are times when ~ and/or ~; sometimes ~ and sometimes ~; sometimes do things like ~ and ~; some (people/etc.) ~ and some (people/etc.) ~
explanation: A structure used to present typical examples of actions, events, situations, people, or things among a number of possibilities.
japanese: アイディアが突然湧き上がってくる時もあれば、全く出てこない時もある。
reading: アイディアが突然湧き上がってくる時もあれば、全く出てこない時もある。
english: Sometimes ideas well up all of the sudden, and sometimes nothing comes to mind (literally: comes out).

translation: There are times when ~ and/or ~; sometimes ~ and sometimes ~; sometimes do things like ~ and ~; some (people/etc.) ~ and some (people/etc.) ~
explanation: A structure used to present typical examples of actions, events, situations, people, or things among a number of possibilities.
japanese: 外国語は勉強の仕方次第で、面白くもなればつまらなくもなる。
reading: 外国語は勉強の仕方次第で、面白くもなればつまらなくもなる。
english: Depending on the way you study it, a foreign language can be interesting or boring.

translation: Shouldn’t; not possibly; naturally cannot; cannot bear
explanation: A sentence-ﬁnal phrase indicating that one shouldn’t do something, one could not possibly do something, or one naturally cannot do something.
japanese: 夜遅く人に電話をかけるものではない。
reading: 夜遅く人に電話をかけるものではない。
english: You shouldn't call people late at night.

translation: Shouldn’t; not possibly; naturally cannot; cannot bear
explanation: A sentence-ﬁnal phrase indicating that one shouldn’t do something, one could not possibly do something, or one naturally cannot do something.
japanese: 彼の演奏は聴けたものではない。
reading: 彼の演奏は聴けたものではない。
english: We cannot bear listening to his performance (literally: His performance isn't something we could possibly listen to).

translation: Shouldn’t; not possibly; naturally cannot; cannot bear
explanation: A sentence-ﬁnal phrase indicating that one shouldn’t do something, one could not possibly do something, or one naturally cannot do something.
japanese: そんな時間のかかる仕事は引き受けられるものではない。
reading: そんな時間のかかる仕事は引き受けられるものではない。
english: That kind of time-consuming work isn't something I can accept.

translation: Shouldn’t; not possibly; naturally cannot; cannot bear
explanation: A sentence-ﬁnal phrase indicating that one shouldn’t do something, one could not possibly do something, or one naturally cannot do something.
japanese: 日本では先生と話す時に帽子をかぶったまま話すものではない。
reading: 日本では先生と話す時に帽子をかぶったまま話すものではない。
english: In Japan, one shouldn't wear a hat while speaking to one's teacher.

translation: Shouldn’t; not possibly; naturally cannot; cannot bear
explanation: A sentence-ﬁnal phrase indicating that one shouldn’t do something, one could not possibly do something, or one naturally cannot do something.
japanese: 日本では人のうちに訪ねて行く時には手ぶらで行くものではありません。
reading: 日本では人のうちに訪ねて行く時には手ぶらで行くものではありません。
english: In Japan, you shouldn't visit someone's house without bringing something with you.

translation: Shouldn’t; not possibly; naturally cannot; cannot bear
explanation: A sentence-ﬁnal phrase indicating that one shouldn’t do something, one could not possibly do something, or one naturally cannot do something.
japanese: 成年者は酒を飲むもんじゃない。
reading: 未成年者は酒を飲むもんじゃない。
english: Minors shouldn't drink.

translation: Shouldn’t; not possibly; naturally cannot; cannot bear
explanation: A sentence-ﬁnal phrase indicating that one shouldn’t do something, one could not possibly do something, or one naturally cannot do something.
japanese: 女性に年齢を聞くものではない。
reading: 女性に年齢を聞くものではない。
english: You shouldn't ask a woman her age.

translation: Shouldn’t; not possibly; naturally cannot; cannot bear
explanation: A sentence-ﬁnal phrase indicating that one shouldn’t do something, one could not possibly do something, or one naturally cannot do something.
japanese: こんなつまらない小説、読めたもんじゃない。
reading: こんなつまらない小説、読めたもんじゃない。
english: I could not possibly read such a boring novel!

translation: Shouldn’t; not possibly; naturally cannot; cannot bear
explanation: A sentence-ﬁnal phrase indicating that one shouldn’t do something, one could not possibly do something, or one naturally cannot do something.
japanese: 私のかいた絵なんか、あなたに見せられたものではありません。
reading: 私のかいた絵なんか、あなたに見せられたものではありません。
english: There's no way I could possibly show you the paintings I've done.

translation: Shouldn’t; not possibly; naturally cannot; cannot bear
explanation: A sentence-ﬁnal phrase indicating that one shouldn’t do something, one could not possibly do something, or one naturally cannot do something.
japanese: 辞書などはそう簡単に書けるものではない。
reading: 辞書などはそう簡単に書けるものではない。
english: It is natural that dictionaries can't be written so easily.

translation: Shouldn’t; not possibly; naturally cannot; cannot bear
explanation: A sentence-ﬁnal phrase indicating that one shouldn’t do something, one could not possibly do something, or one naturally cannot do something.
japanese: 現在の補助金の額で十分な研究ができるものではない。
reading: 現在の補助金の<ruby title="額(がく)"><rb>額</rb><rt>がく</rt></ruby>で十分な研究ができるものではない。
english: We cannot possibly do thorough research with the current amount of research funds.

explanation: A rhetorical question marker that expresses a strong negative intention or disagreement.
japanese: あんなやつとは二度と会うものか。
reading: あんなやつとは二度と会うものか。
english: I will never see that sort of guy again.

explanation: A rhetorical question marker that expresses a strong negative intention or disagreement.
japanese: A:彼は5年後には自分でコンピュータの会社をつくるって言っているよ。 B:そんなこと彼にできるもんか。
reading:
A:彼は5年後には自分でコンピュータの会社をつくるって言っているよ。 
B:そんなこと彼にできるもんか。
english:
A: He says he will establish a computer company by himself in five years. 
B: I bet he can't. (literally: Can he do it?)

explanation: A rhetorical question marker that expresses a strong negative intention or disagreement.
japanese: あんなケチな男とはもうつき合うものか。
reading: あんなケチな男とはもうつき合うものか。
english: Who really wants to spend more time with such a stingy fellow?

explanation: A rhetorical question marker that expresses a strong negative intention or disagreement.
japanese: A:鈴木、TOEFLが650点だったってよ。B:まさか！そんなことがあるもんか。
reading:
A:鈴木、TOEFLが650点だったってよ。
B:まさか！そんなことがあるもんか。
english:
A: I heard that Suzuki got 650 points on the TOEFL. 
B: Unbelievable! That can't be true.

explanation: A rhetorical question marker that expresses a strong negative intention or disagreement.
japanese: 世話をしてもお礼の一言も言わないの。あんな人、もう世話をするもんですか。
reading: 世話をしてもお礼の一言も言わないの。あんな人、もう世話をするもんですか。
english: She didn't even thank me when I helped her out. Who really wants to help someone like that again?

explanation: A rhetorical question marker that expresses a strong negative intention or disagreement.
japanese: A:池田先生、親切な先生？B:親切なもんか。
reading:
A:池田先生、親切な先生？
B:親切なもんか。
english:
A: Is Professor Ikeda a kind teacher? 
B: Definitely not kind.

explanation: A rhetorical question marker that expresses a strong negative intention or disagreement.
japanese: A:そのパズル、やさしいんだろう。B:やさしいもんか。
reading:
A:そのパズル、やさしいんだろう。
B:やさしいもんか。
english:
A: Isn't that puzzle easy? 
B: Absolutely not.

explanation: A rhetorical question marker that expresses a strong negative intention or disagreement.
japanese: A:あいつは自分のことをいっぱしの政治家だと思っているようだな。B:あいつは政治家なもんか。政治屋しゃないか。
reading:
A:あいつは自分のことを一端の政治家だと思っているようだな。
B:あいつは政治家なもんか。政治屋じゃないか。
english:
A: He seems to think that he is a full-ﬂedged politician. 
B: He is absolutely not a politician. He's just being political.

explanation: A rhetorical question marker that expresses a strong negative intention or disagreement.
japanese: A:黙って帰ったら彼に悪いだろう。B:かまうもんか。
reading:
A:黙って帰ったら彼に悪いだろう。
B:かまうもんか。
english:
A: It's not right if we go home without saying a word to him, right? 
B: Who cares?
extra_notes: ~に悪い = bad, harmful (to)

explanation: A rhetorical question marker that expresses a strong negative intention or disagreement.
japanese: A:みんな、あの政治家は信頼できるって言っているよ。B:分かるもんか。
reading:
A:みんな、あの政治家は信頼できるって言っているよ。
B:分かるもんか。
english:
A: Everybody is saying that politician is reliable. 
B: How do they know?

explanation: A phrase indicating that the speaker wants to do something or is wondering what one he/she should choose.
japanese: もう少し広い家に住めないもの（だろう）か。
reading: もう少し広い家に<ruby title="住(す)"><rb>住</rb><rt>す</rt></ruby>めないもの（だろう）か。
english:
(i) I wish to live in a house that is a bit more spacious.
(ii) I wonder if I can live in a slightly more spacious house.

explanation: A phrase indicating that the speaker wants to do something or is wondering what one he/she should choose.
japanese: 修士論文の題目をどのように決めたものか（と）迷っています。
reading: 修士論文の題目をどのように決めたものか（と）迷っています。
english: I am at a loss as to how I should choose my MA thesis topic.

explanation: A phrase indicating that the speaker wants to do something or is wondering what one he/she should choose.
japanese: もう少し真面目にこの問題に取り組んでくれないもの（だろう）か。
reading: もう少し真面目にこの問題に取り組んでくれないもの（だろう）か。
english: I'm wondering if they can handle this problem a little more seriously.

explanation: A phrase indicating that the speaker wants to do something or is wondering what one he/she should choose.
japanese: 何とかしてこの原稿を月曜日までに書き終われないものか。
reading: 何とかしてこの原稿を月曜日までに書き終われないものか。
english: I wonder if I can somehow ﬁnish writing this manuscript by Monday.

explanation: A phrase indicating that the speaker wants to do something or is wondering what one he/she should choose.
japanese: もう少し自由に休暇が取れないものだろうか。
reading: もう少し自由に<ruby title="休暇(きゅうか)"><rb>休暇</rb><rt>きゅうか</rt></ruby>が取れないものだろうか。
english: I'm wondering if I can take time off a bit more freely.

explanation: A phrase indicating that the speaker wants to do something or is wondering what one he/she should choose.
japanese: 東京の夏はやたらと暑い。もう少し涼しくならないものだろうか。
reading: 東京の夏はやたらと暑い。もう少し涼しくならないものだろうか。
english: Tokyo's summer is terribly hot. I wish it were a bit cooler.

explanation: A phrase indicating that the speaker wants to do something or is wondering what one he/she should choose.
japanese: 日本語を勉強したいんですが、どの大学を選んだものかと考えているところです。
reading: 日本語を勉強したいんですが、どの大学を選んだものかと考えているところです。
english: I want to study Japanese, and I'm wondering which university I should choose.

explanation: A phrase indicating that the speaker wants to do something or is wondering what one he/she should choose.
japanese: 今年の夏は海外旅行をしおうと思っていますが、どの国に行ったものかと思案中です。
reading: 今年の夏は海外旅行をしおうと思っていますが、どの国に行ったものかと思案中です。
english: We're thinking of making a trip abroad this coming summer, and we are trying to ﬁgure out which country to visit.

explanation: A phrase indicating that the speaker wants to do something or is wondering what one he/she should choose.
japanese: 子供が反抗期に入っている。その期間を問題なく乗り越えるにはどうしたものかと思っている。
reading: 子供が反抗期に入っている。その期間を問題なく乗り越えるにはどうしたものかと思っている。
english: Our child has entered the rebellious stage of life. I'm wondering what we should do to get through this period without problems.

explanation: A phrase indicating that the speaker wants to do something or is wondering what one he/she should choose.
japanese: このところ体の調子が悪いので、医者に診てもらったものかと考えているところです。
reading: このところ体の調子が悪いので、医者に診てもらったものかと考えているところです。
english: I'm now wondering if I should go see a doctor because I don't feel well these days.

explanation: A phrase indicating that the speaker wants to do something or is wondering what one he/she should choose.
japanese: 日本の狭い社会から飛び出して海外移住でもしたものかと思っています。
reading: 日本の狭い社会から飛び出して海外移住でもしたものかと思っています。
english: I'm wondering if I should escape from Japan's conﬁning society and live abroad.

explanation: A phrase indicating that the speaker wants to do something or is wondering what one he/she should choose.
japanese: 人の性格は変わらないものだろうか。
reading: 人の性格は変わらないものだろうか。
english: I wonder if a person's character ever changes?

explanation: A phrase indicating that the speaker wants to do something or is wondering what one he/she should choose.
japanese: 私も食事に注意しているのだから、少しはやせないものだろうか。
reading: 私も食事に注意しているのだから、少しはやせないものだろうか。
english: I'm paying attention to my diet, so I wonder if I will lose some weight.

explanation: A phrase indicating that the speaker wants to do something or is wondering what one he/she should choose.
japanese: もうちょっと雨が降らないものだろうか。
reading: もうちょっと雨が降らないものだろうか。
english: I wonder if there will be more rain.

translation: If; if ~ at all
explanation: A conjunction indicating that the preceding clause presents a hypothetical situation that is unlikely to become a reality.
japanese: （もし）一戸建ての家が買えるものなら買いたい。
reading: （もし）一戸建ての家が買えるものなら買いたい。
english: If I could buy a single family house, I would like to.

translation: If; if ~ at all
explanation: A conjunction indicating that the preceding clause presents a hypothetical situation that is unlikely to become a reality.
japanese: 一人でやれるものならやってみろ！
reading: 一人でやれるものならやってみろ！
english: If (you think) you can do it by yourself, go ahead and do it!

translation: If; if ~ at all
explanation: A conjunction indicating that the preceding clause presents a hypothetical situation that is unlikely to become a reality.
japanese: 近い将来における日本語の存在意義など、書けるものなら書いてみたい。
reading: 近い将来における日本語の存在意義など、書けるものなら書いてみたい。
english: If I could, I would like to write about the raison d'etre of Japanese language in the near future.

translation: If; if ~ at all
explanation: A conjunction indicating that the preceding clause presents a hypothetical situation that is unlikely to become a reality.
japanese: 喫煙所の中でタバコを吸っている人たちを外から見ればまるで動物園…。もしやめられるものならやめてみようかなあと思い始めたこの頃です。
reading: 喫煙所の中でタバコを吸っている人たちを外から見ればまるで動物園…。もしやめられるものならやめてみようかなあと思い始めたこの頃です。
english: When I look at people smoking in smoking areas, I feel like I am at the zoo. Lately, I have begun to think that, if I could, I would try quitting.

translation: If; if ~ at all
explanation: A conjunction indicating that the preceding clause presents a hypothetical situation that is unlikely to become a reality.
japanese: この新刊、もし町の図書館で借りられるものなら買わずに済むのに、まだ入っていないようだ。
reading: この新刊、もし町の図書館で借りられるものなら買わずに済むのに、まだ入っていないようだ。
english: I wouldn't need to buy this new book if I could borrow it at the public library in my town, but it looks like it isn't available there yet.

translation: If; if ~ at all
explanation: A conjunction indicating that the preceding clause presents a hypothetical situation that is unlikely to become a reality.
japanese: 南極旅行は、気持ち的には、借金してでも行けるものなら行きたいんだが。
reading: 南極旅行は、気持ち的には、借金してでも行けるものなら行きたいんだが。
english: I feel like I'd like to travel to the South Pole, even if I had to borrow money to do it.

translation: If; if ~ at all
explanation: A conjunction indicating that the preceding clause presents a hypothetical situation that is unlikely to become a reality.
japanese: 西行じゃないけれど、願いがかなうものなら、満開の桜の下で春に死にたい。
reading: 西行[さいぎょう]じゃないけれど、願いがかなうものなら、満開の桜の下で春に死にたい。
english: I am no Saigyo, but if wishes came true, I would wish to die in spring, under cherry trees in full bloom.
extra_notes: Saigyo (1118-1190) is a famous waka poet and Buddhist priest who expressed in his poetry his desire to die under blooming cherry trees.

translation: If; if ~ at all
explanation: A conjunction indicating that the preceding clause presents a hypothetical situation that is unlikely to become a reality.
japanese: この曲がやさしいって言うんですか？何も分かっていないからそんなことを言うんですよ。弾けるものなら弾いてみなさい。
reading: この曲がやさしいって言うんですか？何も分かっていないからそんなことを言うんですよ。弾けるものなら弾いてみなさい。
english: Are you saying this piece is easy? You're saying that because you don't know anything about it. Go ahead and play it if you think you can!

translation: If; if ~ at all
explanation: A conjunction indicating that the preceding clause presents a hypothetical situation that is unlikely to become a reality.
japanese: 訴えるなんて言ってもちっとも怖くなんかありませんよ。訴えられるものなら訴えてごらんなさい。
reading: 訴えるなんて言ってもちっとも怖くなんかありませんよ。訴えられるものなら訴えてごらんなさい。
english: Even if you tell me that you're going to sue me, I'm not afraid at all. Sue me if you can!

translation: If; if ~ at all
explanation: A conjunction indicating that the preceding clause presents a hypothetical situation that is unlikely to become a reality.
japanese: カリスマのある哲学者が大学に来て講演をしようものなら、1万人を越える<ruby title="聴衆(ちょうしゅう)"><rb>聴衆</rb><rt>ちょうしゅう</rt></ruby>が集まる。
reading: カリスマのある哲学者が大学に来て講演をしようものなら、1万人を越える<ruby title="聴衆(ちょうしゅう)"><rb>聴衆</rb><rt>ちょうしゅう</rt></ruby>が集まる。
english: If a charismatic philosopher did come to the university to give a lecture, more than 10,000 people would gather to listen to him.

translation: Although; though; even though; but
explanation: A conjunction that means “although”.
japanese: 訳の仕事を引き受けたものの、うまくやれる自信がない。
reading: 訳の仕事を引き受けたものの、うまくやれる自信がない。
english: Although I accepted the interpreting job, I'm not conﬁdent that I can do it well.

translation: Although; though; even though; but
explanation: A conjunction that means “although”.
japanese: 一人でいる方が気楽だとは言うものの、やはり話し相手が欲しいと思うこともある。
reading: 一人でいる方が気楽だとは言うものの、やはり話し相手が欲しいと思うこともある。
english: Although I say being alone is easier, sometimes I want someone to talk with.

translation: Although; though; even though; but
explanation: A conjunction that means “although”.
japanese: 大学を卒業はしたものの、不況でなかなかいい仕事が見つからない。
reading: 大学を卒業はしたものの、不況でなかなかいい仕事が見つからない。
english: Even though I graduated from college, because of the recession I cannot ﬁnd a good job (despite my efforts).

translation: Although; though; even though; but
explanation: A conjunction that means “although”.
japanese: マネージャーになって給料は上がったものの、急にいろんな仕事が増えてとても忙しくなった。
reading: マネージャーになって給料は上がったものの、急にいろんな仕事が増えてとても忙しくなった。
english: Although I became a manager and got a raise, my work (of various kinds) quickly increased and I became very busy.

translation: Although; though; even though; but
explanation: A conjunction that means “although”.
japanese: 市内を抜け出すまでは時間がかかったものの、高速に入ってからは渋滞もなく、4時前にホテルにチェックインすることができた。
reading: 市内を抜け出すまでは時間がかかったものの、高速に入ってからは渋滞もなく、4時前にホテルにチェックインすることができた。
english: Although it took time to get out of the city, there were no trafﬁc tie-ups after we got on the highway, and we were able to check in at the hotel before four o'clock.

translation: Although; though; even though; but
explanation: A conjunction that means “although”.
japanese: 韓国産のハマグリは形はふくらみが少なく身がややかたいものの、うま味が強く、寿司ネタにも使われている。
reading: 韓国産の蛤は形はふくらみが少なく身がややかたいものの、うま味が強く、寿司ネタにも使われている。
english: Clams from Korea are a little lean and tough, but they taste very good and are sometimes used for sushi.

translation: Although; though; even though; but
explanation: A conjunction that means “although”.
japanese: 現地の子供たちは最初こそよそよそしかったものの、時間がたつにつれて慣れてきてとても親切にしてくれました。
reading: 現地の子供たちは最初こそよそよそしかったものの、時間がたつにつれて慣れてきてとても親切にしてくれました。
english: Although the local children were cold and unfriendly at the start, as time passed they got used to me and were very kind to me.

translation: Although; though; even though; but
explanation: A conjunction that means “although”.
japanese: 小林氏は身のこなしが軽快で、髪こそ真っ白なものの、「若い」という印象を与える。
reading: 小林氏は身のこなしが軽快で、髪こそ真っ白なものの、「若い」という印象を与える。
english: Mr. Kobayashi's movements are light and spry, and even though his hair is totally white, he gives the impression of being young.

translation: Although; though; even though; but
explanation: A conjunction that means “although”.
japanese: 我がチームは出だしは好調だったものの、夏場で失速し、シーズンが終わってみれば、勝率5割を切るという不本意な成績に終わった。
reading: 我がチームは出だしは好調だったものの、夏場で失速し、シーズンが終わってみれば、勝率5割を切るという不本意な成績に終わった。
english: Even though our team started off well, we lost momentum over the summer, and when the season was over, to our regret we had won less than 50 percent of our games.

translation: Although; though; even though; but
explanation: A conjunction that means “although”.
japanese: 彼は敬虔なイスラム教徒だったものの、ドイツ国内のイスラム主義団体との交流はなかった。
reading: 彼は敬虔なイスラム教徒だったものの、ドイツ国内のイスラム主義団体との交流はなかった。
english: Although he was a devout Muslim, he had no connection with Islamic groups in Germany.

translation: Although; though; even though; but
explanation: A conjunction that means “although”.
japanese: 暦の上では秋とは言うものの、まだ真夏のような暑さが続いている。
reading: 暦の上では秋とは言うものの、まだ真夏のような暑さが続いている。
english: Although the calendar says that it is autumn, it's still hot like midsummer.

translation: Although; though; even though; but
explanation: A conjunction that means “although”.
japanese: 同居していた息子の家族が県外に引っ越したので、やっと静かな生活に戻った。とは言うものの、孫の顔がいつも見られないのはちょっと寂しい。
reading: 同居していた息子の家族が県外に引っ越したので、やっと静かな生活に戻った。とは言うものの、孫の顔がいつも見られないのはちょっと寂しい。
english: Our son and his family, who had been living with us, moved out of the prefecture, and we have finally returned to a quiet life. However, we feel a little lonely, not being able to see our grandchild all the time.

translation: Although; but
explanation: A disjunctive coordinate conjunction expressing the meaning of “although” with the speaker’s strong feeling of discontent
japanese: 彼は日本語を続けて勉強すればいいものを、1年間やっただけでやめてしまった。
reading: 彼は日本語を続けて勉強すればいいものを、1年間やっただけでやめてしまった。
english: Although he should have continued studying Japanese, he quit after only one year.

translation: Although; but
explanation: A disjunctive coordinate conjunction expressing the meaning of “although” with the speaker’s strong feeling of discontent
japanese: すぐ医者に診てもらったら簡単に治っていたものを、手遅れになってしまった。
reading: すぐ医者に診てもらったら簡単に治っていたものを、手遅れになってしまった。
english: Had I gone to the doctor right away, I would have gotten better easily, but I acted too late.

translation: Although; but
explanation: A disjunctive coordinate conjunction expressing the meaning of “although” with the speaker’s strong feeling of discontent
japanese: ゴルフかなんかして少しリラックスすればいいものを、父は週末でも会社の仕事を家でやっている。
reading: ゴルフかなんかして少しリラックスすればいいものを、父は週末でも会社の仕事を家でやっている。
english: My father should play golf or something and relax a little bit, but he brings work home from the ofﬁce even on weekends.

translation: Although; but
explanation: A disjunctive coordinate conjunction expressing the meaning of “although” with the speaker’s strong feeling of discontent
japanese: あのくだらない小説はちょっと読んだだけでやめればよかったものを、なんと最後まで読んでしまった。全くの時間の浪費だった。
reading: あのくだらない小説はちょっと読んだだけでやめればよかったものを、なんと最後まで読んでしまった。全くの時間の浪費だった。
english: I should have stopped reading that cheap novel after a few pages, but believe it or not, I read it to the very end. It was an utter waste of time.

translation: Although; but
explanation: A disjunctive coordinate conjunction expressing the meaning of “although” with the speaker’s strong feeling of discontent
japanese: 居留守を使えばいいものを、彼女は気が弱いのでそうもできず、いやいや人に会うことになってしまうのだ。
reading: 居留守を使えばいいものを、彼女は気が弱いのでそうもできず、いやいや人に会うことになってしまうのだ。
english: She doesn't have to answer the door, but she doesn't have the nerve to resist and ends up talking to people even though she doesn't want to.

translation: Although; but
explanation: A disjunctive coordinate conjunction expressing the meaning of “although” with the speaker’s strong feeling of discontent
japanese: 私のことが嫌いなら嫌いだともっと早くはっきり言ってくれたらよかったものを。
reading: 私のことが嫌いなら嫌いだともっと早くはっきり言ってくれたらよかったものを。
english: He should have told me much earlier that he didn't like me (literally: if in fact he didn't like me).

translation: Although; but
explanation: A disjunctive coordinate conjunction expressing the meaning of “although” with the speaker’s strong feeling of discontent
japanese: 時間があったらいろいろな外国旅行ができたものを、いつも忙しく働いてきたので、外国はどこにも行っていない。
reading: 時間があったらいろいろな外国旅行ができたものを、いつも忙しく働いてきたので、外国はどこにも行っていない。
english: Had I the time, I could have made trips to various foreign countries, but because I've been so busy working I have never been overseas.

translation: Although; but
explanation: A disjunctive coordinate conjunction expressing the meaning of “although” with the speaker’s strong feeling of discontent
japanese: 父があと1年生きていてくれたら私の結婚式に出てもらえたものを、私がぐずぐずしていたばかりに、父に私の晴れ姿を見てもらえず、とても残念です。
reading: 父があと1年生きていてくれたら私の結婚式に出てもらえたものを、私がぐずぐずしていたばかりに、父に私の晴れ姿を見てもらえず、とても残念です。
english: Had my father lived one year longer, he could have attended my wedding ceremony, but just because I was indecisive for so long, I couldn't give him the chance to see me in my wedding dress. I feel so sorry!

translation: ~ is one thing, but; it is true that ~, but; it is the case that ~, but; but more importantly
explanation: A phrase used to mention something important and then introduce something more signiﬁcant.
japanese: この図書館は蔵書の多さもさることながらサービスが実にすばらしい。
reading: この図書館は蔵書の多さもさることながらサービスが実にすばらしい。
english: This library's large collection of books is one thing (literally: is so, too), but the services they provide are really something else (literally: really wonderful).

translation: ~ is one thing, but; it is true that ~, but; it is the case that ~, but; but more importantly
explanation: A phrase used to mention something important and then introduce something more signiﬁcant.
japanese: 指圧やマッサージといった「タッチセラピー」が注目されている。身体への直接的な効果もさることながら、安らぎ感や癒しといった心理的な効果も大きいようだ。
reading: 指圧やマッサージといった「タッチセラピー」が注目されている。身体への直接的な効果もさることながら、安らぎ感や癒しといった心理的な効果も大きいようだ。
english: “Touch therapies,” such as shiatsu and massage, are being paid attention to. While they have a direct effect on the body (literally: Their direct effect is so, too), apparently their psychological effect, including feelings of relaxation and healing, is also great.

translation: ~ is one thing, but; it is true that ~, but; it is the case that ~, but; but more importantly
explanation: A phrase used to mention something important and then introduce something more signiﬁcant.
japanese: 高齢化が進むにつれ、認知症老人の介護が問題になっているが、これからは、介護のこともさることながらぼけをいかに予防するかがさらに重要だ。
reading: 高齢化が進むにつれ、認知症老人の介護が問題になっているが、これからは、介護のこともさることながらぼけをいかに予防するかがさらに重要だ。
english: As the population has aged, the care of senile seniors has become a problem. It is true that from now on care will be an important issue (literally: care is so, too), but the question of how to prevent people from becoming senile is more important.

translation: ~ is one thing, but; it is true that ~, but; it is the case that ~, but; but more importantly
explanation: A phrase used to mention something important and then introduce something more signiﬁcant.
japanese: 障害者向け製品の価格が高いのは、技術的な困難もさることながら市場の小ささが大きな原因になっている。
reading: 障害者向け製品の価格が高いのは、技術的な困難もさることながら市場の小ささが大きな原因になっている。
english: It is true that the high price of products for the handicapped is (partially) due to technical issues (literally: technical difficulties are so, too), but the major cause is a lack of demand (literally: the small market).

translation: ~ is one thing, but; it is true that ~, but; it is the case that ~, but; but more importantly
explanation: A phrase used to mention something important and then introduce something more signiﬁcant.
japanese: 下から眺めるテレビ塔やイルミネーションの美しさもさることながら、展望台に登って眺める市の夜景もまた格別です。
reading: 下から眺めるテレビ塔やイルミネーションの美しさもさることながら、展望台に登って眺める市の夜景もまた格別です。
english: The TV antenna tower and the lights on it viewed from below are a beautiful sight, but seeing the city at night from the observatory tower is really something special.

translation: ~ is one thing, but; it is true that ~, but; it is the case that ~, but; but more importantly
explanation: A phrase used to mention something important and then introduce something more signiﬁcant.
japanese: この合作映画は、作品の完成度の高さもさることながら、文化の異なる二国が協力して一つの映画を完成させたという事実が非常に意義深い。
reading: この合作映画は、作品の完成度の高さもさることながら、文化の異なる二国が協力して一つの映画を完成させたという事実が非常に意義深い。
english: This jointly-produced movie is highly polished, but more importantly, the fact that two countries with different cultures worked together and completed a ﬁlm (in and of itself) is quite signiﬁcant.

translation: or
explanation: A conjunction to disjunctively connect two items or ideas.
japanese: この申込書は本人（か）、もしくは保証人が記入しなければならない。
reading: この申込書は本人（か）、もしくは保証人が記入しなければならない。
english: This application has to be filled in by the applicant or by his/her guarantor.

translation: or
explanation: A conjunction to disjunctively connect two items or ideas.
japanese: ワークショップに出席なさりたい方はオンラインで登録するか、もしくは、メールでお申し込みください。
reading: ワークショップに出席なさりたい方はオンラインで登録するか、もしくは、メールでお申し込みください。
english: If you want to participate in the workshop, please register online or apply by e-mail.

translation: or
explanation: A conjunction to disjunctively connect two items or ideas.
japanese: 基調講演者は日本研究もしくは関連領域の研究について話すことになっている。
reading: 基調講演者は日本研究もしくは関連領域の研究について話すことになっている。
english: The keynote speaker is expected to talk about Japan studies or related areas.

translation: or
explanation: A conjunction to disjunctively connect two items or ideas.
japanese: この予算は研究費、もしくは研究補助費にのみ使用できる。
reading: この予算は研究費、もしくは研究補助費にのみ使用できる。
english: This budget is to be used exclusively for research or research-related expenses.

translation: or
explanation: A conjunction to disjunctively connect two items or ideas.
japanese: 大学のプールは学生か、もしくは使用料を支払った大学関係者のみ利用できる。
reading: 大学のプールは学生か、もしくは使用料を支払った大学関係者のみ利用できる。
english: The college pool is open only to students or those afﬁliated with the college who have paid the fee.

translation: or
explanation: A conjunction to disjunctively connect two items or ideas.
japanese: 夏季のドライブシーズンを迎える頃には、ガソリンの在庫が昨年とほぼ同水準まで下がるか、もしくはそれ以下に減少する見通しである。
reading: 夏季のドライブシーズンを迎える頃には、ガソリンの在庫が昨年とほぼ同水準まで下がるか、もしくはそれ以下に減少する見通しである。
english: It is predicted that by the time of the summer driving season, the reserves of gasoline will fall approximately to the same level as last year or will go below it.

translation: or
explanation: A conjunction to disjunctively connect two items or ideas.
japanese: 日本の経済力が弱まってきている現在、日本が世界で生き残る道はテクノロジーで時代の先取りをするか、もしくは、モノとしての日本の文化をより積極的に海外に輸出することであろう。
reading: 日本の経済力が弱まってきている現在、日本が世界で生き残る道はテクノロジーで時代の先取りをするか、もしくは、モノとしての日本の文化をより積極的に海外に輸出することであろう。
english: These days Japan's economic strength has decreased. For Japan to survive in the world, it must either take leadership in the ﬁeld of technology in the future, or export Japanese culture as a product more aggressively.

translation: Although; though; but; yet; however
explanation: A conjunction used to add a comment indicating that what the speaker/writer has just expressed is not sufﬁcient.
japanese: 運動は体にいいと言われている。もっとも、やりすぎると逆効果だ（が）。
reading: 運動は体にいいと言われている。もっとも、やりすぎると逆効果だ（が）。
english: They say that exercise is good for you (literally: your body), but doing too much will bring about the opposite effect.

translation: Although; though; but; yet; however
explanation: A conjunction used to add a comment indicating that what the speaker/writer has just expressed is not sufﬁcient.
japanese: あの政治家は保守的だと言われている。もっとも、時々革新的なことを言うこともあるが。
reading: あの政治家は保守的だと言われている。もっとも、時々革新的なことを言うこともあるが。
english: That politician is said to be conservative, although he sometimes makes progressive statements.

translation: Although; though; but; yet; however
explanation: A conjunction used to add a comment indicating that what the speaker/writer has just expressed is not sufﬁcient.
japanese: 彼は女性にとても親切だ。もっとも、それには下心がある場合が多いようだ。
reading: 彼は女性にとても親切だ。もっとも、それには下心がある場合が多いようだ。
english: He is very kind to ladies. But, apparently, he often has an ulterior motive.

translation: Although; though; but; yet; however
explanation: A conjunction used to add a comment indicating that what the speaker/writer has just expressed is not sufﬁcient.
japanese: 今日は魚がよく釣れた。もっとも、いつもこのように幸運だとは限らない。
reading: 今日は魚がよく釣れた。もっとも、いつもこのように幸運だとは限らない。
english: I caught (literally: was able to catch) a lot of ﬁsh today, although I'm not always this lucky.

translation: Although; though; but; yet; however
explanation: A conjunction used to add a comment indicating that what the speaker/writer has just expressed is not sufﬁcient.
japanese: このドイツの車の方があの日本の車よりいいんじゃない。もっとも、僕はドイツの車を運転したことはないけどさ。
reading: このドイツの車の方があの日本の車よりいいんじゃない。もっとも、僕はドイツの車を運転したことはないけどさ。
