english: Don't you think that this German car is better than that Japanese one? I've never driven a German car, though.

translation: Although; though; but; yet; however
explanation: A conjunction used to add a comment indicating that what the speaker/writer has just expressed is not sufﬁcient.
japanese: 顔写真の入った名刺というのも、強い印象を与えるからいいかもしれない。もっとも私はそこまでやりたいとは思わないけれども。
reading: 顔写真の入った名刺というのも、強い印象を与えるからいいかもしれない。もっとも私はそこまでやりたいとは思わないけれども。
english: It may be a good idea to make business cards with your picture on them because they would create a stronger impression. But I am kind of reluctant to go that far.

translation: Although; though; but; yet; however
explanation: A conjunction used to add a comment indicating that what the speaker/writer has just expressed is not sufﬁcient.
japanese: 若い頃は漠然としていたものが歳を重ねるごとにハッキリと見えるようになり、目標を見据えてよりポジティブに生きるようにしています。もっとも私はまだ、その途上にありますが。
reading: 若い頃は漠然としていたものが歳を重ねるごとにハッキリと見えるようになり、目標を見据えてよりポジティブに生きるようにしています。もっとも私はまだ、その途上にありますが。
english: As I grow older, I begin to see more clearly things that were not clear when I was younger. I'm trying to keep the goal in focus and live more positively. But I haven't gotten there yet.

translation: For; made for; for the use of; aimed at; directed towards; (directed/shipped/etc.) to
explanation: A suffix that adds the meaning of “aimed at”
japanese: このギター曲集は初心者向けだ。
reading: このギター曲集は初心者向けだ。
english: This collection of guitar pieces is for beginners.

translation: For; made for; for the use of; aimed at; directed towards; (directed/shipped/etc.) to
explanation: A suffix that adds the meaning of “aimed at”
japanese: この秋はアジア向け（の）産業用ロボットの販売が好調だ。
reading: この秋はアジア向け（の）産業用ロボットの販売が好調だ。
english: This autumn, sales of industrial robots for Asia have been good.

translation: For; made for; for the use of; aimed at; directed towards; (directed/shipped/etc.) to
explanation: A suffix that adds the meaning of “aimed at”
japanese: D社は携帯機器向けに小型燃料電池を開発している。
reading: D社は携帯機器向けに小型燃料電池を開発している。
english: D Company is developing small fuel-cell batteries for portable devices.

translation: For; made for; for the use of; aimed at; directed towards; (directed/shipped/etc.) to
explanation: A suffix that adds the meaning of “aimed at”
japanese: このセミナーはこれから株を始める人向けだ。
reading: このセミナーはこれから株を始める人向けだ。
english: This seminar is for those who are going to begin (investing in) stocks.

translation: For; made for; for the use of; aimed at; directed towards; (directed/shipped/etc.) to
explanation: A suffix that adds the meaning of “aimed at”
japanese: 輸出はここ数年、中国向けが急速に伸びている。
reading: 輸出はここ数年、中国向けが急速に伸びている。
english: Regarding exports, for the last few years those to China have been increasing rapidly.

translation: For; made for; for the use of; aimed at; directed towards; (directed/shipped/etc.) to
explanation: A suffix that adds the meaning of “aimed at”
japanese: このセービスは、基本的にはコンシューマー向けだが、法人向けも用意する。
reading: このサービスは、基本的にはコンシューマー向けだが、法人向けも用意する。
english: This service is basically for consumers, but we will offer a version for companies, too.

translation: For; made for; for the use of; aimed at; directed towards; (directed/shipped/etc.) to
explanation: A suffix that adds the meaning of “aimed at”
japanese: 助成金をもらって先生向けの情報教育サイトを作ることにした。
reading: 助成金をもらって先生向けの情報教育サイトを作ることにした。
english: We've decided to get a grant and develop a website to educate teachers about information technology.

translation: For; made for; for the use of; aimed at; directed towards; (directed/shipped/etc.) to
explanation: A suffix that adds the meaning of “aimed at”
japanese: アメリカ進出を考える場合は、アメリカ向けの読みやすい商品説明書と価格表を用意することが必須です。
reading: アメリカ進出を考える場合は、アメリカ向けの読みやすい商品説明書と価格表を用意することが必須です。
english: When you consider expanding to America, it is essential to prepare an easy-to-read product manual and a price list geared toward the U.S.

translation: For; made for; for the use of; aimed at; directed towards; (directed/shipped/etc.) to
explanation: A suffix that adds the meaning of “aimed at”
japanese: K社は近々地図サービスと地域情報検索を国内向けに開始すると発表した。
reading: K社は近々地図サービスと地域情報検索を国内向けに開始すると発表した。
english: K Company announced that it would begin a map service and (release) a search (engine) for local information for domestic users soon.

translation: For; made for; for the use of; aimed at; directed towards; (directed/shipped/etc.) to
explanation: A suffix that adds the meaning of “aimed at”
japanese: 代表的な曲を小さなお子様向けにアレンジしました。
reading: 代表的な曲を小さなお子様向けにアレンジしました。
english: We arranged well-known (music) pieces for young children.

translation: For; made for; for the use of; aimed at; directed towards; (directed/shipped/etc.) to
explanation: A suffix that adds the meaning of “aimed at”
japanese: このオペレーティングシステムは、巨大なアプリケーション向けに設計されている。
reading: このオペレーティングシステムは、巨大なアプリケーション向けに<ruby title="設計(せっけい)"><rb>設計</rb><rt>せっけい</rt></ruby>されている。
english: This operating system is designed for mega-scale applications.

translation: Rather; instead
explanation: An adverb that indicates one of two things/people/characteristics has been chosen rather than the other to express speaker’s/writer’s desire, preference or judgment.
japanese: 夏休みはアルバイトをするよりもむしろ海外旅行がしたい。
reading: 夏休みはアルバイトをするよりもむしろ海外旅行がしたい。
english: During summer vacation I would rather travel abroad than work part-time.

translation: Rather; instead
explanation: An adverb that indicates one of two things/people/characteristics has been chosen rather than the other to express speaker’s/writer’s desire, preference or judgment.
japanese: 僕は寿司よりむしろ刺身(の方）が好きだ。
reading: 僕は寿司よりむしろ刺身が好きだ。
english: I prefer sashimi rather than sushi.

translation: Rather; instead
explanation: An adverb that indicates one of two things/people/characteristics has been chosen rather than the other to express speaker’s/writer’s desire, preference or judgment.
japanese: 彼は秀才というよりはむしろ努力家だ。
reading: 彼は秀才というよりはむしろ努力家だ。
english: He is a man of effort rather than a man of great talent.

translation: Rather; instead
explanation: An adverb that indicates one of two things/people/characteristics has been chosen rather than the other to express speaker’s/writer’s desire, preference or judgment.
japanese: 無為の生活をするぐらいなら、むしろ死んだ方がいい。
reading: 無為の生活をするぐらいなら、むしろ死んだ方がいい。
english: I would rather die than lead a good-for-nothing life.

translation: Rather; instead
explanation: An adverb that indicates one of two things/people/characteristics has been chosen rather than the other to express speaker’s/writer’s desire, preference or judgment.
japanese: 英語は話すよりむしろ読むのが好きだ。
reading: 英語は話すよりむしろ読むのが好きだ。
english: I like reading English rather than speaking it.

translation: Rather; instead
explanation: An adverb that indicates one of two things/people/characteristics has been chosen rather than the other to express speaker’s/writer’s desire, preference or judgment.
japanese: 時間がある時は、観光バスに来るよりはむしろ歩いた方がずっとよく観光できる。
reading: 時間がある時は、観光バスに来るよりはむしろ歩いた方がずっとよく観光できる。
english: When you have the time, you can sightsee much better if you walk rather than ride a sightseeing bus.

translation: Rather; instead
explanation: An adverb that indicates one of two things/people/characteristics has been chosen rather than the other to express speaker’s/writer’s desire, preference or judgment.
japanese: 休みの日は、人の多い行楽地に行くよりは、むしろ、家でテレビでも見ている方がましだ。
reading: 休みの日は、人の多い行楽地に行くよりは、むしろ、家でテレビでも見ている方がましだ。
english: On a holiday it is better to watch TV or something at home rather than go to a crowded tourist spot.

translation: Rather; instead
explanation: An adverb that indicates one of two things/people/characteristics has been chosen rather than the other to express speaker’s/writer’s desire, preference or judgment.
japanese: 静脈を見つけ、正確に注射するという作業は、人間の手よりもむしろコンピュータを使ってロボットが行った方が、ミスが少ないと思う。
reading: 静脈を見つけ、正確に注射するという作業は、人間の手よりもむしろコンピュータを使ってロボットが行った方が、ミスが少ないと思う。
english: I think that the work of ﬁnding a vein and injecting it accurately can be done with less failures if we use a computer and a robot rather than human hands.

translation: Rather; instead
explanation: An adverb that indicates one of two things/people/characteristics has been chosen rather than the other to express speaker’s/writer’s desire, preference or judgment.
japanese: 私は、健康上、肉よりむしろ魚の方を選ぶ。
reading: 私は、健康上、肉よりむしろ魚の方を選ぶ。
english: I choose ﬁsh instead of meat for health reasons.

translation: Rather; instead
explanation: An adverb that indicates one of two things/people/characteristics has been chosen rather than the other to express speaker’s/writer’s desire, preference or judgment.
japanese: 今年は2月よりもむしろ3月の方が寒かった。
reading: 今年は2月よりもむしろ3月の方が寒かった。
english: This year it was colder in March instead of February.

translation: Rather; instead
explanation: An adverb that indicates one of two things/people/characteristics has been chosen rather than the other to express speaker’s/writer’s desire, preference or judgment.
japanese: 彼らが突如大金持ちの仲間入りを果たすことができたのは、彼らの才能というよりもむしろ幸運が味方したからではないだろうか。
reading: 彼らが突如<ruby title="大金持(おおがねも)"><rb>大金持</rb><rt>おおがねも</rt></ruby>ちの仲間入りを果たすことができたのは、彼らの才能というよりもむしろ<ruby title="幸運(こううん)"><rb>幸運</rb><rt>こううん</rt></ruby>が味方したからではないだろうか。
english: The reason why they were suddenly able to join the group of very rich people may be that good fortune was on their side rather than talent (literally: their talents).

translation: Rather; instead
explanation: An adverb that indicates one of two things/people/characteristics has been chosen rather than the other to express speaker’s/writer’s desire, preference or judgment.
japanese: シアトルはアメリカなのですが、他の大都市とは違って、アメリカというよりはむしろカナダのような雰囲気の小ぢんまりとした街でした。
reading: シアトルはアメリカなのですが、他の大都市とは違って、アメリカというよりはむしろカナダのような雰囲気の小ぢんまりとした街でした。
english: Seattle is in the U.S. but, unlike other big cities, it is a small city with an atmosphere more like Canada than the U.S.

translation: Rather; instead
explanation: An adverb that indicates one of two things/people/characteristics has been chosen rather than the other to express speaker’s/writer’s desire, preference or judgment.
japanese: 今年の北海道の夏は涼しかったというよりはむしろ寒かった。
reading: 今年の北海道の夏は涼しかったというよりはむしろ寒かった。
english: This summer Hokkaido was cold instead of just comfortably cool.

translation: Rather; instead
explanation: An adverb that indicates one of two things/people/characteristics has been chosen rather than the other to express speaker’s/writer’s desire, preference or judgment.
japanese: 前の週の豪雨のため、ドナウ川の水は青いというよりはむしろ茶色に近い色だった。
reading: 前の週の豪雨のため、ドナウ川の水は青いというよりはむしろ茶色に近い色だった。
english: Due to the heavy rain the previous week, the Danube River was brownish rather than blue.

translation: Rather; instead
explanation: An adverb that indicates one of two things/people/characteristics has been chosen rather than the other to express speaker’s/writer’s desire, preference or judgment.
japanese: こんなつまらない講義に出るぐらいならむしろ寮で本でも読んでいた方がましだ。
reading: こんなつまらない講義に出るぐらいならむしろ寮で本でも読んでいた方がましだ。
english: Instead of attending such a boring lecture, I would rather be reading books in my dorm.

translation: Rather; instead
explanation: An adverb that indicates one of two things/people/characteristics has been chosen rather than the other to express speaker’s/writer’s desire, preference or judgment.
japanese: 優しくしてから突き放すくらいなら、むしろはじめから優しくするなと思う。
reading: 優しくしてから突き放すくらいなら、むしろはじめから優しくするなと思う。
english: If someone is going to be nice and then dump me, I would rather he just not be nice from the very start.

translation: Seem to ~; somewhat; rather; may
explanation: A phrase that indicates the speaker/writer hesitantly feels or expresses that something is the case.
japanese: 今が私の人生で一番幸せな時期だという気がしないでもない。
reading: 今が私の人生で一番幸せな時期だという気がしないでもない。
english: I seem to feel that right now is the happiest time of my life.

translation: Seem to ~; somewhat; rather; may
explanation: A phrase that indicates the speaker/writer hesitantly feels or expresses that something is the case.
japanese: あの時大学を辞めたことを、今では少し早まったなと思わないでもない。
reading: あの時大学を辞めたことを、今では少し早まったなと思わないでもない。
english: Now I rather feel that leaving the university at that time was a bit too hasty.

translation: Seem to ~; somewhat; rather; may
explanation: A phrase that indicates the speaker/writer hesitantly feels or expresses that something is the case.
japanese: そういえば、そういう話、どこかで聞いたことがあるような気がしないでもないです。
reading: そういえば、そういう話、どこかで聞いたことがあるような気がしないでもないです。
english: Come to think of it, I seem to feel that I've heard something like that somewhere.

translation: Seem to ~; somewhat; rather; may
explanation: A phrase that indicates the speaker/writer hesitantly feels or expresses that something is the case.
japanese: 私は「結婚しない主義」でもないし、一度結婚してみたいという気もないでもないんですが、なかなかいい相手が見つかりません。
reading: 私は「結婚しない主義」でもないし、一度結婚してみたいという気もないでもないんですが、なかなかいい相手が見つかりません。
english: I am unmarried not because of principle, and I wouldn't mind getting married, but it is really hard to ﬁnd a good partner.

translation: Seem to ~; somewhat; rather; may
explanation: A phrase that indicates the speaker/writer hesitantly feels or expresses that something is the case.
japanese: 日本人として、アメリカ企業におけるリストラを見ると非情さを感じないでもない。
reading: 日本人として、アメリカ企業におけるリストラを見ると非情さを感じないでもない。
english: For me, as a Japanese, the way American companies lay off workers strikes me as rather inhumane.
extra_notes: における in; at; on; as for; regarding; with regards to

translation: Seem to ~; somewhat; rather; may
explanation: A phrase that indicates the speaker/writer hesitantly feels or expresses that something is the case.
japanese: あなたの苦しい気持ちが分からないでもない。
reading: あなたの苦しい気持ちが分からないでもない。
english: I do somewhat understand the pain you are feeling.

translation: Seem to ~; somewhat; rather; may
explanation: A phrase that indicates the speaker/writer hesitantly feels or expresses that something is the case.
japanese: 白衣に眼鏡なら、一見普通の医者に見えないでもない。
reading: 白衣に眼鏡なら、一見普通の医者に見えないでもない。
english: Wearing a white gown and eyeglasses, he could be taken for a doctor at first sight.

translation: Seem to ~; somewhat; rather; may
explanation: A phrase that indicates the speaker/writer hesitantly feels or expresses that something is the case.
japanese: 心底謝れば許してやらないでもないけど。
reading: 心底謝れば許してやらないでもないけど。
english: If he really apologizes to me from the bottom of his heart, then I may ﬁnd it in me to forgive him (, but . . .).

translation: If ~ not ~ then; unless
explanation: A phrase that means “if something has not taken place, something else won’t/can’t take place”.
japanese: この仕事が終わらないことには、家族と旅行に行くこともできない。
reading: この仕事が終わらないことには、家族と旅行に行くこともできない。
english: If I don't ﬁnish this work, I can't go on a trip with my family.

translation: If ~ not ~ then; unless
explanation: A phrase that means “if something has not taken place, something else won’t/can’t take place”.
japanese: 追加予算が下りないことには、このプロジェクトの遂行は無理だ。
reading: 追加予算が下りないことには、このプロジェクトの遂行は無理だ。
english: Without (money from) an additional budget, it will be impossible to accomplish this project.
extra_notes: 下りる= to be granted, issued, given

translation: If ~ not ~ then; unless
explanation: A phrase that means “if something has not taken place, something else won’t/can’t take place”.
japanese: 書き始めないことには論文ができるはずはない。
reading: 書き始めないことには論文ができるはずはない。
english: Unless you begin writing your thesis, there's no way you'll be able to ﬁnish it.

translation: If ~ not ~ then; unless
explanation: A phrase that means “if something has not taken place, something else won’t/can’t take place”.
japanese: コンピュータが作動しないことには仕事は始まらない。
reading: コンピュータが作動しないことには仕事は始まらない。
english: Unless the computer works, we can't get started on the job.

translation: If ~ not ~ then; unless
explanation: A phrase that means “if something has not taken place, something else won’t/can’t take place”.
japanese: 面接を受けないことには就職はできない。
reading: 面接を受けないことには就職はできない。
english: You can't get a job unless you (ﬁrst) have an interview.

translation: If ~ not ~ then; unless
explanation: A phrase that means “if something has not taken place, something else won’t/can’t take place”.
japanese: 為替相場が安定しないことには、経済の回復もおぼつかない。
reading: 為替相場が安定しないことには、経済の回復も覚束ない。
english: Unless the exchange rate stabilizes, economic recovery will be almost impossible.

translation: If ~ not ~ then; unless
explanation: A phrase that means “if something has not taken place, something else won’t/can’t take place”.
japanese: 日本語学習者は、日本に行かないことには日本語を自然に話せるようになるのは難しいだろう。
reading: 日本語学習者は、日本に行かないことには日本語を自然に話せるようになるのは難しいだろう。
english: If a Japanese language learner doesn't go to Japan, it will be difficult for him or her to learn to speak Japanese naturally.

translation: If ~ not ~ then; unless
explanation: A phrase that means “if something has not taken place, something else won’t/can’t take place”.
japanese: 際立った才能がないことには、一流の音楽大学を出てもソリストになることは夢物語だ。
reading: 際立った才能がないことには、一流の音楽大学を出てもソリストになることは夢物語だ。
english: Without outstanding talent, becoming a soloist, even as a graduate of a top-rated music college, is just a dream.

translation: May not ~ but; even though ~ not; although ~ not
explanation: An adverbial phrase expressing the speaker’s feeling that although an ideal action or state isn’t possible, at least the next best action or state is or should be available.
japanese: この公演は大成功とは言えないまでも、それなりの成果をもたらした。
reading: この公演は大成功とは言えないまでも、それなりの成果をもたらした。
english: Although you may not be able to call this public performance a great success, it produced results of a sort.

translation: May not ~ but; even though ~ not; although ~ not
explanation: An adverbial phrase expressing the speaker’s feeling that although an ideal action or state isn’t possible, at least the next best action or state is or should be available.
japanese: 彼の論文は決して多くないまでも、その質は非常に高い。
reading: 彼の論文は決して多くないまでも、その質は非常に高い。
english: Although he hasn't published many papers at all, the quality (of those he has published) is extremely high.

translation: May not ~ but; even though ~ not; although ~ not
explanation: An adverbial phrase expressing the speaker’s feeling that although an ideal action or state isn’t possible, at least the next best action or state is or should be available.
japanese: 「生命とはこういうものです」とは言えないまでも、「少なくともこうではありません」とは言えるようになってくるはずだ。
reading: 「生命とはこういうものです」とは言えないまでも、「少なくともこうではありません」とは言えるようになってくるはずだ。
english: We may not be able to say, “This is what life is,” but we should come to a point where we can say, “At least this is what it isn't.”

translation: May not ~ but; even though ~ not; although ~ not
explanation: An adverbial phrase expressing the speaker’s feeling that although an ideal action or state isn’t possible, at least the next best action or state is or should be available.
japanese: その彫刻は完璧とは言えないまでも、非常に可能性を感じさせる作品だった。
reading: その彫刻は完璧とは言えないまでも、非常に可能性を感じさせる作品だった。
english: The sculpture may not be called a perfect work, but it is (literally: was) a work that makes you feel unusual potential.

translation: May not ~ but; even though ~ not; although ~ not
explanation: An adverbial phrase expressing the speaker’s feeling that although an ideal action or state isn’t possible, at least the next best action or state is or should be available.
japanese: 虚偽だとは言わないまでも、かなり紛らわしい表現だ。
reading: 虚偽だとは言わないまでも、かなり紛らわしい表現だ。
english: I can't go so far as to call this wording deceptive, but it sure is misleading.

translation: May not ~ but; even though ~ not; although ~ not
explanation: An adverbial phrase expressing the speaker’s feeling that although an ideal action or state isn’t possible, at least the next best action or state is or should be available.
japanese: 中国語は漢字だから、読めないまでも意味はなんとなく分かるのだが、韓国語はまったく見当がつかない。
reading: 中国語は漢字だから、読めないまでも意味はなんとなく分かるのだが、韓国語はまったく見当がつかない。
english: If it were written in Chinese I could get a sense of what it's saying because of the characters, even though I cannot read it, but I cannot make heads or tails of Korean.

translation: May not ~ but; even though ~ not; although ~ not
explanation: An adverbial phrase expressing the speaker’s feeling that although an ideal action or state isn’t possible, at least the next best action or state is or should be available.
japanese: インターネットは完璧ではないまでも、生涯学習もしくは生涯教育のメディアとして、いろいろな可能性をもっています。
reading: インターネットは完璧ではないまでも、生涯学習もしくは生涯教育のメディアとして、いろいろな可能性をもっています。
english: The Internet is not perfect, but it does have various possibilities as a medium for lifelong learning and/or teaching.

translation: May not ~ but; even though ~ not; although ~ not
explanation: An adverbial phrase expressing the speaker’s feeling that although an ideal action or state isn’t possible, at least the next best action or state is or should be available.
japanese: 運命には逆らえないまでも、それを味方にすることはできる。
reading: 運命には逆らえないまでも、それを味方にすることはできる。
english: We may not be able to go against fate, but we can make it our ally.

translation: May not ~ but; even though ~ not; although ~ not
explanation: An adverbial phrase expressing the speaker’s feeling that although an ideal action or state isn’t possible, at least the next best action or state is or should be available.
japanese: 明日は天気がよくないまでも、気温はあまり低くなりません。
reading: 明日は天気がよくないまでも、気温はあまり低くなりません。
english: Although the weather may not be good, the temperature will not drop much.

translation: May not ~ but; even though ~ not; although ~ not
explanation: An adverbial phrase expressing the speaker’s feeling that although an ideal action or state isn’t possible, at least the next best action or state is or should be available.
japanese: 彼は正直者じゃないまでも、嘘つきじゃない。
reading: 彼は正直者じゃないまでも、嘘つきじゃない。
english: He may not be an honest person, but he isn't a liar.

translation: From ~ to ~; between ~ and ~; or
explanation: A particle that presents two possible choices or the minimum and maximum possible numbers/lengths/weights/etc. of something; or a conjunction that links two possible actions or events.
japanese: このクラスの学生のほとんどは3年ないし（は）4年の日本語学習歴を持っている。
reading: このクラスの学生のほとんどは3年ないし（は）4年の日本語学習歴を持っている。
english: Most students in this class have three to four years of experience studying Japanese.

translation: From ~ to ~; between ~ and ~; or
explanation: A particle that presents two possible choices or the minimum and maximum possible numbers/lengths/weights/etc. of something; or a conjunction that links two possible actions or events.
japanese: この論文集の論文はすべて日本語（か）ないしは英語で書かれている。
reading: この論文集の論文はすべて日本語（か）ないしは英語で書かれている。
english: The papers in this collection are written in Japanese or English.

translation: From ~ to ~; between ~ and ~; or
explanation: A particle that presents two possible choices or the minimum and maximum possible numbers/lengths/weights/etc. of something; or a conjunction that links two possible actions or events.
japanese: 生産量を20%減らす（か）、ないしは新しい市場を急遽開拓するしかない。
reading: 生産量を20%減らす（か）、ないしは新しい<ruby title="市場(しじょう)"><rb>市場</rb><rt>しじょう</rt></ruby>を急遽開拓するしかない。
english: We have no choice but to either reduce production by 20 percent or quickly develop a new market.

translation: From ~ to ~; between ~ and ~; or
explanation: A particle that presents two possible choices or the minimum and maximum possible numbers/lengths/weights/etc. of something; or a conjunction that links two possible actions or events.
japanese: 細菌の大きさは1ミクロンないし数ミクロンだ。
reading: 細菌の大きさは1ミクロンないし数ミクロンだ。
english: Bacteria are between one and several microns large.

translation: From ~ to ~; between ~ and ~; or
explanation: A particle that presents two possible choices or the minimum and maximum possible numbers/lengths/weights/etc. of something; or a conjunction that links two possible actions or events.
japanese: 電子メールは、忙しい人でも、1日に1回ないしは数回チェックしているはずだ。
reading: 電子メールは、忙しい人でも、1日に1回ないしは数回チェックしているはずだ。
english: I expect that even busy people check their e-mail once or even several times a day.

translation: From ~ to ~; between ~ and ~; or
explanation: A particle that presents two possible choices or the minimum and maximum possible numbers/lengths/weights/etc. of something; or a conjunction that links two possible actions or events.
japanese: サン・モリッツでは５つ星ないしは３つ星クラスのホテルに滞在し、4日間、スイスの冬を満喫していただきます。
reading: サン・モリッツでは５つ星ないしは３つ星クラスのホテルに滞在し、4日間、スイスの冬を<ruby title="満喫(まんきつ)"><rb>満喫</rb><rt>まんきつ</rt></ruby>していただきます。
english: In St. Moritz, you will stay at a three to ﬁve star hotel (literally: a ﬁve to three star hotel), and fully enjoy a Swiss winter for four days.

translation: From ~ to ~; between ~ and ~; or
explanation: A particle that presents two possible choices or the minimum and maximum possible numbers/lengths/weights/etc. of something; or a conjunction that links two possible actions or events.
japanese: 本冊子の購入希望者は、氏名、住所、購入希望冊数を明記の上、ファックス、ないしは電子メールで協会事務局までお申し込み下さい。
reading: 本冊子の購入希望者は、氏名、住所、購入希望冊数を明記の上、ファックス、ないしは電子メールで協会事務局までお申し込み下さい。
english: If you would like a copy of this booklet, please send a request to the association's ofﬁce via fax or e-mail with your name, address and the number of copies you want.
extra_notes: 本 is being used here as a prefix to mean "this"

translation: From ~ to ~; between ~ and ~; or
explanation: A particle that presents two possible choices or the minimum and maximum possible numbers/lengths/weights/etc. of something; or a conjunction that links two possible actions or events.
japanese: 本アンケートでは、2004年鉛全廃について、「必要」ないしは「やむを得ない」とするものが74%を占めた。
reading: 本アンケートでは、2004年鉛<ruby title="全廃(ぜんぱい)"><rb>全廃</rb><rt>ぜんぱい</rt></ruby>について、「必要」ないしは「やむを得ない」とするものが74%を占めた。
english: In this survey, regarding the total ban on (the use of) lead in 2004, 74 percent (of respondents) indicated it would be either “necessary” or “inevitable.”

translation: From ~ to ~; between ~ and ~; or
explanation: A particle that presents two possible choices or the minimum and maximum possible numbers/lengths/weights/etc. of something; or a conjunction that links two possible actions or events.
japanese: 本品は1回50mg（2錠）を1日1回就寝前、ないしは1日2回、朝及び就寝前に経口服用して下さい。
reading: 本品は1回50mg（2錠）を1日1回就寝前、ないしは1日2回、朝及び就寝前に経口服用して下さい。
english: Take 50 mg (two tablets) of this product orally either once a day before going to bed, or twice daily, once in the morning and once before going to bed.

translation: From ~ to ~; between ~ and ~; or
explanation: A particle that presents two possible choices or the minimum and maximum possible numbers/lengths/weights/etc. of something; or a conjunction that links two possible actions or events.
japanese: 当社は、本ウェブサイトの利用者からの問い合わせにお答えするため、ないしは、あらかじめ利用者に明示させていただいた目的の範囲で、利用者の個人情報を収集します。
reading: 当社は、本ウェブサイトの利用者からの問い合わせにお答えするため、ないしは、あらかじめ利用者に明示させていただいた目的の範囲で、利用者の個人情報を収集します。
english: We (literally: Our company) gather our personal information from people who use our website in order to respond to their inquiries or for (literally: within the scope of) purposes made clear to the users in advance.

translation: From ~ to ~; between ~ and ~; or
explanation: A particle that presents two possible choices or the minimum and maximum possible numbers/lengths/weights/etc. of something; or a conjunction that links two possible actions or events.
japanese: 当社は、犯罪活動の証拠となる、ないしはその一部となる顧客情報を公開することを、法律によって義務づけられることがあります。
reading: 当社は、犯罪活動の証拠となる、ないしはその一部となる顧客情報を公開することを、法律によって義務づけられることがあります。
english: We (literally: Our company) may be required by law to make public such information on our clients that constitutes evidence, or partial evidence, of criminal activity.

translation: In the midst of; when; while; through; among
explanation: A phrase that specifies space or time in/through which someone/something does something.
japanese: 冷たい風が｛吹く/吹いている｝中を１０キロも歩いた。
reading: 冷たい風が｛吹く/吹いている｝中を１０キロも歩いた。
english: When a cold wind was blowing I walked as much as 10 kilometres.

translation: In the midst of; when; while; through; among
explanation: A phrase that specifies space or time in/through which someone/something does something.
japanese: お忙しい中をいらしていただき、申し訳ございません。
reading: お忙しい中をいらしていただき、申し訳ございません。
english: Thank you very much for coming when you are busy.

translation: In the midst of; when; while; through; among
explanation: A phrase that specifies space or time in/through which someone/something does something.
japanese: 赤十字の人たちがハリケーン被災者たちの中を歩き回って食料を配った。
reading: 赤十字の人たちがハリケーン被災者たちの中を歩き回って食料を配った。
english: People from the Red Cross walked among the victims of the hurricane and distributed food.

translation: In the midst of; when; while; through; among
explanation: A phrase that specifies space or time in/through which someone/something does something.
japanese: 子供たちが遊んでいる中を子犬がちょろちょろ走り回っていた。
reading: 子供たちが遊んでいる中を子犬がちょろちょろ走り回っていた。
english: A puppy was darting around among the kids who were playing.

translation: In the midst of; when; while; through; among
explanation: A phrase that specifies space or time in/through which someone/something does something.
japanese: 公園では、人が集まっている中を、アイスクリーム屋が歩いていた。
reading: 公園では、人が集まっている中を、アイスクリーム屋が歩いていた。
english: In the park, an ice cream seller was walking through the crowd of people.

translation: In the midst of; when; while; through; among
explanation: A phrase that specifies space or time in/through which someone/something does something.
japanese: 雪の降る中を頑張って走っている人を見ていたら、自分が軟弱に思えてきました。
reading: 雪の降る中を頑張って走っている人を見ていたら、自分が軟弱に思えてきました。
english: When I watched people out running in the snow, I began to think of myself as fragile and weak.

translation: In the midst of; when; while; through; among
explanation: A phrase that specifies space or time in/through which someone/something does something.
japanese: 私たちが呆然として見ている中を、二人は一つの傘の下に入って行ってしまいました。
reading: 私たちが呆然として見ている中を、二人は一つの傘の下に入って行ってしまいました。
english: As we were watching with astonishment, the two walked away under the same umbrella.

translation: In the midst of; when; while; through; among
explanation: A phrase that specifies space or time in/through which someone/something does something.
japanese: 本日は、雨で足元が大変悪い中を、このようにたくさんの方にご参加いただきまして、誠にありがとうございました。
reading: 本日は、雨で足元が大変悪い中を、このようにたくさんの方にご参加いただきまして、誠にありがとうございました。
english: Thank you very much for coming to this meeting today; it's nice to see so many of you when it is so treacherous to walk due to the rain.

translation: In the midst of; when; while; through; among
explanation: A phrase that specifies space or time in/through which someone/something does something.
japanese: 私だけ門限があるのでパーティーから先に帰ってきたが、楽しい中を抜けて帰るのはとてもつらかった。
reading: 私だけ門限があるのでパーティーから先に帰ってきたが、楽しい中を抜けて帰るのはとてもつらかった。
english: I'm the only one with a curfew, so I came home from the party earlier than everyone else. It was hard for me to leave and come home when I was having a good time.

translation: In the midst of; when; while; through; among
explanation: A phrase that specifies space or time in/through which someone/something does something.
japanese: 大人たちは戦後のあの苦しい中を、気力をとり戻して復興に精を出したのだ。
reading: 大人たちは戦後のあの苦しい中を、気力をとり戻して復興に精を出したのだ。
english: Amidst the post war hardship, the adults retained their spirit and worked diligently to reconstruct the country.

translation: In the midst of; when; while; through; among
explanation: A phrase that specifies space or time in/through which someone/something does something.
japanese: 我々は地震で道路が崩壊する危険な中を車で１０時間ぐらい走った。
reading: 我々は地震で道路が崩壊する危険な中を車で１０時間ぐらい走った。
english: We drove our car for about 10 hours through hazardous roads which were collapsing around us during the earthquake and aftershocks.

translation: In the midst of; when; while; through; among
explanation: A phrase that specifies space or time in/through which someone/something does something.
japanese: 飛行機は嵐の中を随分と長い間飛んでいるらしく、雲に突っ込むたびに大きく揺れている。
reading: 飛行機は嵐の中を随分と長い間飛んでいるらしく、雲に突っ込むたびに大きく揺れている。
english: We seem to have been ﬂying through this storm for a very long time, and each time the plane goes into the clouds it shakes quite a bit.
extra_notes: 突っ込む = to plunge into

translation: Without; if it were not for ~
explanation: A compound particle meaning “without something”.
japanese: 努力なくして（は）この事業はできない。
reading: 努力なくして（は）この事業はできない。
english: Without effort we won't be able to ﬁnish this undertaking.

translation: Without; if it were not for ~
explanation: A compound particle meaning “without something”.
japanese: 山川教授なくしては今の私は存在しなかったであろう。
reading: 山川教授なくしては今の私は存在しなかったであろう。
english: Without Professor Yamakawa, I wouldn't be what I am now.

translation: Without; if it were not for ~
explanation: A compound particle meaning “without something”.
japanese: コンピュータなくして現在の生活は不可能だ。
reading: コンピュータなくして現在の生活は不可能だ。
english: Without computers, our current lifestyle would be impossible.

translation: Without; if it were not for ~
explanation: A compound particle meaning “without something”.
japanese: ITの活用なくして企業の成長は望めません。
reading: ITの活用なくして企業の成長は望めません。
english: If we don't make good use of IT, we can't expect our business to grow.

translation: Without; if it were not for ~
explanation: A compound particle meaning “without something”.
japanese: 日本の平和と繁栄は、世界の平和と安定なくしてはあり得ない。
reading: 日本の平和と繁栄は、世界の平和と安定なくしてはあり得ない。
english: Peace and prosperity in Japan is not possible without peace and stability throughout the world.

translation: Without; if it were not for ~
explanation: A compound particle meaning “without something”.
japanese: あらゆる生物は水なくして生きていけない。
reading: あらゆる生物は水なくして生きていけない。
english: No creature can live without water.

translation: Without; if it were not for ~
explanation: A compound particle meaning “without something”.
japanese: コミュニケーションなくしては、人間が関与する一切の活動は成立し得ない。
reading: コミュニケーションなくしては、人間が関与する一切の活動は成立し得ない。
english: Without communication, no human activity could occur.

translation: Without; if it were not for ~
explanation: A compound particle meaning “without something”.
japanese: 関係者の密接な共同作業なくしてはこの計画の実現は不可能であったろう。
reading: 関係者の密接な共同作業なくしてはこの計画の実現は不可能であったろう。
english: If it had not been for the close cooperation of the people involved in this project, it would have been impossible to make it a reality.

translation: Without; if it were not for ~
explanation: A compound particle meaning “without something”.
japanese: 沿道の人たちの声援なくしては、このマラソンは完走できなかったでしょう。
reading: 沿道の人たちの声援なくしては、このマラソンは完走できなかったでしょう。
english: Without encouragement from the roadside people, I couldn't have ﬁnished running this marathon.

translation: Halfheartedly; slightly; thoughtlessly; unwisely; inadequately; imperfectly; sort of; a little; somewhat; a bit of
explanation: An adverb indicating that something (including an action/state) has a positive value which hasn’t been reached, causing something negative.
japanese: 僕はなまじ（っか）英語ができるばかりに、会社で重宝がられて困っています。
reading: 僕はなまじ（っか）英語ができるばかりに、会社で重宝がられて困っています。
english: Because I know a little English, the office treasures me, which is causing me problems.

translation: Halfheartedly; slightly; thoughtlessly; unwisely; inadequately; imperfectly; sort of; a little; somewhat; a bit of
explanation: An adverb indicating that something (including an action/state) has a positive value which hasn’t been reached, causing something negative.
japanese: なまじ（っか）｛の/な｝学問は、ひけらかすと人に軽蔑される。
reading: なまじ（っか）｛の/な｝学問は、ひけらかすと人に軽蔑される。
english: People disdain those who show off (their scant knowledge) but are uneducated (literally: have inadequate scholarship).

translation: Halfheartedly; slightly; thoughtlessly; unwisely; inadequately; imperfectly; sort of; a little; somewhat; a bit of
explanation: An adverb indicating that something (including an action/state) has a positive value which hasn’t been reached, causing something negative.
japanese: なまじ（っか）政治に手を出すのはやめた方がよい。
reading: なまじ（っか）政治に手を出すのはやめた方がよい。
english: You'd better not get involved in politics half-heartedly.

translation: Halfheartedly; slightly; thoughtlessly; unwisely; inadequately; imperfectly; sort of; a little; somewhat; a bit of
explanation: An adverb indicating that something (including an action/state) has a positive value which hasn’t been reached, causing something negative.
japanese: なまじっか手伝ってもらうより、一人でやった方が早くできそうです。
reading: なまじっか手伝ってもらうより、一人でやった方が早くできそうです。
english: I think it'll be quicker to do it by myself than for someone to help me in a half-hearted way.

translation: Halfheartedly; slightly; thoughtlessly; unwisely; inadequately; imperfectly; sort of; a little; somewhat; a bit of
explanation: An adverb indicating that something (including an action/state) has a positive value which hasn’t been reached, causing something negative.
japanese: 彼はなまじっか自信があるために、失敗した時にひどい挫折感を味わう。
reading: 彼はなまじっか自信があるために、失敗した時にひどい挫折感を味わう。
english: Because he has only a little self-conﬁdence, he experiences a horrible sense of failure when something doesn't work out.

translation: Halfheartedly; slightly; thoughtlessly; unwisely; inadequately; imperfectly; sort of; a little; somewhat; a bit of
explanation: An adverb indicating that something (including an action/state) has a positive value which hasn’t been reached, causing something negative.
japanese: なまじっか財産など持っていたら、最低の人間になってしまうのではないかと思う。
reading: なまじっか財産など持っていたら、最低の人間になってしまうのではないかと思う。
english: I think that we turn into the worst people with just a bit of wealth.

translation: Halfheartedly; slightly; thoughtlessly; unwisely; inadequately; imperfectly; sort of; a little; somewhat; a bit of
explanation: An adverb indicating that something (including an action/state) has a positive value which hasn’t been reached, causing something negative.
japanese: なまじ見る目が肥えてくると、アニメだったら何でもいいってわけにはいかなくなる。
reading: なまじ見る目が肥えてくると、アニメだったら何でもいいってわけにはいかなくなる。
english: When you acquire a bit of an eye for anime, you discover that not every work lives up to what it's supposed to be.
extra_notes: 何でも = anything; everything; all

translation: Halfheartedly; slightly; thoughtlessly; unwisely; inadequately; imperfectly; sort of; a little; somewhat; a bit of
explanation: An adverb indicating that something (including an action/state) has a positive value which hasn’t been reached, causing something negative.
japanese: なまじっか物を知ってる人よりは全然知らない人の方が、「知らないことを知る楽しみ」を感じられると思う。
reading: なまじっか物を知ってる人よりは全然知らない人の方が、「知らないことを知る楽しみ」を感じられると思う。
english: I think that a person who knows nothing can feel “the joy of discovery (literally: of knowing what he doesn't know)” more than someone who knows a little bit.

translation: Halfheartedly; slightly; thoughtlessly; unwisely; inadequately; imperfectly; sort of; a little; somewhat; a bit of
explanation: An adverb indicating that something (including an action/state) has a positive value which hasn’t been reached, causing something negative.
japanese: なまじ頭がいいと組織の中で協力して働くということが難しくなる
reading: なまじ頭がいいと組織の中で協力して働くということが難しくなる。
english: If a person is somewhat bright, it is more difficult for him to work cooperatively in an organization.

translation: Halfheartedly; slightly; thoughtlessly; unwisely; inadequately; imperfectly; sort of; a little; somewhat; a bit of
explanation: An adverb indicating that something (including an action/state) has a positive value which hasn’t been reached, causing something negative.
japanese: なまじっか元気だと、無理をしやすい。
reading: なまじっか元気だと、無理をしやすい。
english: If you are on the healthy side, you are apt to overexert yourself.

translation: Halfheartedly; slightly; thoughtlessly; unwisely; inadequately; imperfectly; sort of; a little; somewhat; a bit of
explanation: An adverb indicating that something (including an action/state) has a positive value which hasn’t been reached, causing something negative.
japanese: 身体が健全に発達していなければ、なまじの美貌はかえって空しい。
reading: 身体が健全に発達していなければ、なまじの美貌はかえって空しい。
english: If the body hasn't developed healthily, then superﬁcial beauty is but a hollow thing.

translation: Halfheartedly; slightly; thoughtlessly; unwisely; inadequately; imperfectly; sort of; a little; somewhat; a bit of
explanation: An adverb indicating that something (including an action/state) has a positive value which hasn’t been reached, causing something negative.
japanese: 電池式ブザーはなまじの武器よりも襲われた時に効果が高い上に、コストパフォーマンスに優れています。
reading: 電池式ブザーはなまじの武器よりも襲われた時に効果が高い上に、コストパフォーマンスに優れています。
english: A battery-operated buzzer is more effective when you are attacked than an ordinary weapon and, in addition, it is more cost effective.

translation: Halfheartedly; slightly; thoughtlessly; unwisely; inadequately; imperfectly; sort of; a little; somewhat; a bit of
explanation: An adverb indicating that something (including an action/state) has a positive value which hasn’t been reached, causing something negative.
japanese: 体験者が語る真実は、なまじな小説よりも深く人の心を打つ。
reading: 体験者が語る真実は、なまじな小説よりも深く人の心を打つ。
english: The truth as told by someone who experienced it moves us more deeply than a mediocre novel.

translation: Halfheartedly; slightly; thoughtlessly; unwisely; inadequately; imperfectly; sort of; a little; somewhat; a bit of
explanation: An adverb indicating that something (including an action/state) has a positive value which hasn’t been reached, causing something negative.
japanese: なまじ運動しているのがよくなかったんです。それを言い訳にして、以前よりもたくさん食べるようになってしまいました。
reading: なまじ運動しているのがよくなかったんです。それを言い訳にして、以前よりもたくさん食べるようになってしまいました。
english: Doing a little exercise wasn't good, because I used it as my excuse for eating more than I used to.

translation: About the same level as; like; as (much ~) as; to match; to rival; on a par with; equivalent to
explanation: A noun sufﬁx that adds the meaning “to match”.
japanese: マイクさんのゴルフはプロ並みだ。
reading: マイクさんのゴルフはプロ並みだ。
english: Mike's golf skills are about the same level as a pro's.

translation: About the same level as; like; as (much ~) as; to match; to rival; on a par with; equivalent to
explanation: A noun sufﬁx that adds the meaning “to match”.
japanese: 吉田さんは植物については専門家並みの知識を持っている。
reading: 吉田さんは植物については専門家並みの知識を持っている。
english: Regarding plants, Ms. Yoshida has as much knowledge as a specialist.

translation: About the same level as; like; as (much ~) as; to match; to rival; on a par with; equivalent to
explanation: A noun sufﬁx that adds the meaning “to match”.
japanese: 日本人も欧米人並みに肉や乳製品を食べるようになった。
reading: 日本人も欧米人並みに肉や乳製品を食べるようになった。
english: Japanese people now eat (literally: have come to eat) as much meat and dairy products as Westerners (literally: Europeans and Americans) do.

translation: About the same level as; like; as (much ~) as; to match; to rival; on a par with; equivalent to
explanation: A noun sufﬁx that adds the meaning “to match”.
japanese: 今月の降水量は平年並みだそうだ。
reading: 今月の降水量は平年並みだそうだ。
english: It is said that this month's precipitation is about the same as (that of the same month) in an average year.

translation: About the same level as; like; as (much ~) as; to match; to rival; on a par with; equivalent to
explanation: A noun sufﬁx that adds the meaning “to match”.
japanese: 当社に登録されている通訳の英語力はネイティブ並みです。
reading: 当社に登録されている通訳の英語力はネイティブ並みです。
english: The interpreters registered with our company have a native level of English proﬁciency.

translation: About the same level as; like; as (much ~) as; to match; to rival; on a par with; equivalent to
explanation: A noun sufﬁx that adds the meaning “to match”.
japanese: 今日はまだ5月だというのに8月並みの暑さだ。
reading: 今日はまだ5月だというのに8月並みの暑さだ。
english: Although it is still May today, it is as hot as August.

translation: About the same level as; like; as (much ~) as; to match; to rival; on a par with; equivalent to
explanation: A noun sufﬁx that adds the meaning “to match”.
japanese: ダイエット用品、スポーツ器具、美容雑貨など、アメリカのヒット商品を現地並みの価格でお届けします。
reading: ダイエット用品、スポーツ器具、美容雑貨など、アメリカのヒット商品を現地並みの価格でお届けします。
english: We deliver top-selling (literally: hit) products from America, including diet products, athletic equipment and beauty goods, at U.S. prices.

translation: About the same level as; like; as (much ~) as; to match; to rival; on a par with; equivalent to
explanation: A noun sufﬁx that adds the meaning “to match”.
japanese: 今日はリハーサルだったが本番並みの緊張感を味わった。
reading: 今日はリハーサルだったが本番並みの緊張感を味わった。
english: Although today's (performance) was a rehearsal, I felt the same level of tension as if it were the real performance.

translation: About the same level as; like; as (much ~) as; to match; to rival; on a par with; equivalent to
explanation: A noun sufﬁx that adds the meaning “to match”.
japanese: やっと仕事も見つかって何とか人並みに暮らしています。
reading: やっと仕事も見つかって何とか人並みに暮らしています。
english: I ﬁnally found a job, and somehow am making a go of it, living like other people do.

translation: About the same level as; like; as (much ~) as; to match; to rival; on a par with; equivalent to
explanation: A noun sufﬁx that adds the meaning “to match”.
japanese: 私はパートなのに、正社員並みに仕事をさせられている。
reading: 私はパートなのに、正社員並みに仕事をさせられている。
english: Despite the fact that I'm only a part-timer, they make me work as much as the regular employees.

translation: About the same level as; like; as (much ~) as; to match; to rival; on a par with; equivalent to
explanation: A noun sufﬁx that adds the meaning “to match”.
japanese: 電気自動車の価格をガソリン自動車並みに下げるのは極めて難しい。
reading: 電気自動車の価格をガソリン自動車並みに下げるのは極めて難しい。
english: It is extremely difﬁcult to reduce the price of an electric car so it is on a par with a gasoline car.

translation: About the same level as; like; as (much ~) as; to match; to rival; on a par with; equivalent to
explanation: A noun sufﬁx that adds the meaning “to match”.
japanese: ここの寿司屋は回転寿司並みに安い。
reading: ここの寿司屋は回転寿司並みに安い。
english: This sushi bar is cheap like a conveyer belt sushi bar.

translation: Many; tens/thousands/etc. of ~
explanation: A phrase that indicates there is a large number of things, people, etc.
japanese: 私は日本へは何回も行ったことがあるが、韓国と中国はまだだ。
reading: 私は日本へは何回も行ったことがあるが、韓国と中国はまだだ。
english: I have been to Japan many times, but I've never been to Korea or China.

translation: Many; tens/thousands/etc. of ~
explanation: A phrase that indicates there is a large number of things, people, etc.
japanese: 私は日本語の辞書を何十冊も持っている。
reading: 私は日本語の辞書を何十冊も持っている。
english: I have dozens of Japanese dictionaries.

translation: Many; tens/thousands/etc. of ~
explanation: A phrase that indicates there is a large number of things, people, etc.
japanese: 私は今までに何百人もの認知症患者を診察した。
reading: 私は今までに何百人もの認知症患者を診察した。
english: To date I have (medically) examined hundreds of Alzheimer's patients.

translation: Many; tens/thousands/etc. of ~
explanation: A phrase that indicates there is a large number of things, people, etc.
japanese: マンガ図書館に何万冊も在庫があっても、人気が高いマンガだと、誰かに借り出されている可能性が高い。
reading: マンガ図書館に何万冊も在庫があっても、人気が高いマンガだと、誰かに借り出されている可能性が高い。
english: Even though manga libraries have tens of thousands of books in their collections, it is highly probable that the popular titles have been checked out.

translation: Many; tens/thousands/etc. of ~
explanation: A phrase that indicates there is a large number of things, people, etc.
japanese: 毎日のように我が家の上空をコウモリが何十匹も乱舞する。
reading: 毎日のように我が家の上空をコウモリが何十匹も乱舞する。
english: Dozens of bats swarm over (the roof of) our house almost every day.

translation: Many; tens/thousands/etc. of ~
explanation: A phrase that indicates there is a large number of things, people, etc.
japanese: ヨーロッパには「農家民宿」が何万軒もあり、都会人や観光客を受け入れている。
reading: ヨーロッパには「農家民宿」が何万軒もあり、都会人や観光客を受け入れている。
english: In Europe, there are tens of thousands of farm houses that offer lodging to city people and tourists.

translation: Many; tens/thousands/etc. of ~
explanation: A phrase that indicates there is a large number of things, people, etc.
japanese: 人類は、何億年も積み重ねてきた生物としての経験を完全に捨てることなく、動物から人間へと進化した。
reading: 人類は、何億年も積み重ねてきた生物としての経験を完全に捨てることなく、動物から人間へと進化した。
english: Humans evolved from animals without completely discarding all the experience accumulated during hundreds of millions of years as various living organisms.

translation: Many; tens/thousands/etc. of ~
explanation: A phrase that indicates there is a large number of things, people, etc.
japanese: 我が社のパイロット陣はFAAの承認を得ており、何千時間もの飛行経験を持っています。
reading: 我が社のパイロット陣はFAAの承認を得ており、何千時間もの飛行経験を持っています。
english: The (group of) pilots in our company are FAA accredited and have thousands of hours of ﬂying experience.

translation: Many; tens/thousands/etc. of ~
explanation: A phrase that indicates there is a large number of things, people, etc.
japanese: 阪神・淡路大震災では、住宅倒壊により何千人もの命が一瞬のうちに奪われた。
reading: 阪神・淡路大震災では、住宅倒壊により何千人もの命が一瞬のうちに奪われた。
english: In the Hanshin-Awaji Great Earthquake, the lives of thousands of people were taken in an instant when their houses collapsed.

translation: Doesn’t exist at all; without
explanation: A structure indicating that something doesn't exist at all.
japanese: 彼女は何不自由ない裕福な家庭で育った。
reading: 彼女は何不自由ない裕福な家庭で育った。
english: She grew up in a comfortable and rich family without inconveniences.

translation: Doesn’t exist at all; without
explanation: A structure indicating that something doesn't exist at all.
japanese: マイケルは何問題なく日本での留学生活を続けている。
reading: マイケルは何問題なく日本での留学生活を続けている。
english: Michael is continuing his study abroad in Japan without any problems.

translation: Doesn’t exist at all; without
explanation: A structure indicating that something doesn't exist at all.
japanese: あの人は欠点が何一つない。
reading: あの人は欠点が何一つない。
english: She doesn't have any weakness.

translation: Doesn’t exist at all; without
explanation: A structure indicating that something doesn't exist at all.
japanese: 二人は結婚して、二人だけの蜜月を楽しみ、何不足ない甘い生活を送った。
reading: 二人は結婚して、二人だけの蜜月を楽しみ、何不足ない甘い生活を送った。
english: The couple got married, enjoyed their honeymoon by themselves, and led a charmed life without want.

translation: Doesn’t exist at all; without
explanation: A structure indicating that something doesn't exist at all.
japanese: この会社は、課長をはじめ若い社員が多く、何気兼ねなく話ができる雰囲気だ。
reading: この会社は、課長をはじめ若い社員が多く、何気兼ねなく話ができる雰囲気だ。
english: In this company, there are many young employees, including the section chiefs, so it is easy to talk to one another without reserve.

translation: Doesn’t exist at all; without
explanation: A structure indicating that something doesn't exist at all.
japanese: あれだけの財産を手に入れたからには、一生何不都合なく暮らせると彼は思ったのであろうが、それは間違っていたのだ。
reading: あれだけの財産を手に入れたからには、一生何不都合なく暮らせると彼は思ったのであろうが、それは間違っていたのだ。
english: He must have thought that once he obtained that much wealth he wouldn't want for anything the rest of his life, but he was wrong.

translation: Doesn’t exist at all; without
explanation: A structure indicating that something doesn't exist at all.
japanese: 日本人のホストファミリーと私は日本語で何不便なく意思疎通ができた。
reading: 日本人のホストファミリーと私は日本語で何不便なく意思疎通ができた。
english: My Japanese host family and I were able to communicate in Japanese without any inconvenience.

translation: Doesn’t exist at all; without
explanation: A structure indicating that something doesn't exist at all.
japanese: 自然界はすばらしいエコシステムになっていて、そこには無駄な物が何一つないようだ。
reading: 自然界はすばらしいエコシステムになっていて、そこには無駄な物が何一つないようだ。
english: The natural world is a wonderful ecological system, and nothing in it seems to be without purpose.

translation: Doesn’t exist at all; without
explanation: A structure indicating that something doesn't exist at all.
japanese: 今は銀行でさえ破綻する時代だ。１００%安全なものは実は何一つない。
reading: 今は銀行でさえ破綻する時代だ。１００%安全なものは実は何一つない。
english: We are now in an age when even banks fail. In reality, nothing is 100% secure.

translation: Why ~ have to ~?; it is unnecessary to ~; have no good reason to ~; not need to ~
explanation: A structure indicating that an action is taken for no good reason.
japanese: 何もそんなに怒ることはないよ。
reading: 何もそんなに怒ることはないよ。
english: You have no good reason to get so angry.

translation: Why ~ have to ~?; it is unnecessary to ~; have no good reason to ~; not need to ~
explanation: A structure indicating that an action is taken for no good reason.
japanese: 良性の腫瘍だから、何もそんなに心配する必要はない。
reading: 良性の腫瘍だから、何もそんなに心配する必要はない。
english: It's a benign tumour, so you don't need to worry about it too much.

translation: Why ~ have to ~?; it is unnecessary to ~; have no good reason to ~; not need to ~
explanation: A structure indicating that an action is taken for no good reason.
japanese: 何もいまさらみんながやっている研究をやる必要なんかないと思うだろう？それが間違いなんだ。
reading: 何もいまさらみんながやっている研究をやる必要なんかないと思うだろう？それが間違いなんだ。
english: You must be thinking there's no need to start on the research everybody is already doing. But you are wrong.

translation: Why ~ have to ~?; it is unnecessary to ~; have no good reason to ~; not need to ~
explanation: A structure indicating that an action is taken for no good reason.
japanese: 突然携帯電話が鳴ったのでびっくりした。友人にはすでに番号を知らせてあったから、何もそんなに驚くこともないのだが、悪いことに会議中だったのだ。
reading: 突然携帯電話が鳴ったのでびっくりした。友人にはすでに<ruby title="番号(ばんごう)"><rb>番号</rb><rt>ばんごう</rt></ruby>を知らせてあったから、何もそんなに驚くこともないのだが、悪いことに会議中だったのだ。
english: I was surprised when my cell phone rang suddenly. I had given the phone number to my friends, so it shouldn't have been a surprise, but unfortunately it happened right in the middle of a meeting.

translation: Why ~ have to ~?; it is unnecessary to ~; have no good reason to ~; not need to ~
explanation: A structure indicating that an action is taken for no good reason.
japanese: まあ落ち着いて下さい。私たちは何もあなたが犯人だと決めてかかっているわけじゃありませんから。
reading: まあ落ち着いて下さい。私たちは何もあなたが犯人だと決めてかかっているわけじゃありませんから。
english: Please calm down. We certainly aren't accusing you of being the culprit.

translation: Why ~ have to ~?; it is unnecessary to ~; have no good reason to ~; not need to ~
explanation: A structure indicating that an action is taken for no good reason.
japanese: 甘えるのは何も日本人に限ったことではない。
reading: 甘えるのは何も日本人に限ったことではない。
english: It isn't just the Japanese who are psychologically dependent on others.

translation: Why ~ have to ~?; it is unnecessary to ~; have no good reason to ~; not need to ~
explanation: A structure indicating that an action is taken for no good reason.
japanese: 彼女の性格を変えようとしているようだけど、何もそこまでしなくたっていいんじゃないか。
reading: 彼女の性格を変えようとしているようだけど、何もそこまでしなくたっていいんじゃないか。
english: You seem to be trying to change her personality, but why do you need to go that far?

translation: Why ~ have to ~?; it is unnecessary to ~; have no good reason to ~; not need to ~
explanation: A structure indicating that an action is taken for no good reason.
japanese: 元々十分に安いのだから、何もそんなに値切らなくてもと思うんですが、それがゲームになってしまうんです。
reading: 元々十分に安いのだから、何もそんなに値切らなくてもと思うんですが、それがゲームになってしまうんです。
english: The prices are cheap enough to begin with, so there really isn't any need to haggle with the store clerk, but it gets to be sort of a game to do so.

translation: Some; some kind of
explanation: A phrase used to indicate that the exact nature of something represented by the noun cannot be speciﬁed.
japanese: 何らかの原因で走行中で電車が急停車した。
reading: 何らかの原因で走行中で電車が急停車した。
english: Due to some (unknown) cause the train stopped suddenly.

translation: Some; some kind of
explanation: A phrase used to indicate that the exact nature of something represented by the noun cannot be speciﬁed.
japanese: 私たちが患う病気は、たいてい、何らかの意味でゲノム関係があります。
reading: 私たちが患う病気は、たいてい、何らかの意味でゲノム関係があります。
english: Most of the illnesses that we get are linked in some way with genomes.

translation: Some; some kind of
explanation: A phrase used to indicate that the exact nature of something represented by the noun cannot be speciﬁed.
japanese: 世界の総人口のおよそ半数の人々が、何らかの形で米を食べている。
reading: 世界の総人口のおよそ半数の人々が、何らかの形で米を食べている。
english: Approximately half the total population of the world eats rice in some form.

translation: Some; some kind of
explanation: A phrase used to indicate that the exact nature of something represented by the noun cannot be speciﬁed.
japanese: 何らかの理由で会議に参加できなくなった場合は、学会事務局へご連絡下さるようお願い申し上げます。
reading: 何らかの理由で会議に参加できなくなった場合は、学会事務局へご連絡下さるようお願い申し上げます。
english: If it turns out that you are unable to attend the conference for some reason, we would appreciate it if you would kindly contact the conference ofﬁce.

translation: Some; some kind of
explanation: A phrase used to indicate that the exact nature of something represented by the noun cannot be speciﬁed.
japanese: 食品添加物が我々の身体に何らかの悪影響を与えると考える人は多い。
reading: 食品添加物が我々の身体に何らかの悪影響を与えると考える人は多い。
english: Many people think that food additives have some bad effect on our bodies.

translation: Some; some kind of
explanation: A phrase used to indicate that the exact nature of something represented by the noun cannot be speciﬁed.
japanese: 火星表面の「運河」と呼ばれる溝は、何らかの液体によって作られたと考えられていた。
reading: 火星表面の「運河」と呼ばれる溝は、何らかの液体によって作られたと考えられていた。
english: The grooves on Mars' surface that are referred to as "canals" were (originally) presumed to have been caused by some liquid.

translation: Some; some kind of
explanation: A phrase used to indicate that the exact nature of something represented by the noun cannot be speciﬁed.
japanese: 我々はそれぞれ何らかの人生観、社会観を持って生きています。各人の生涯の生活設計に関しても、漠然とした形ではあっても、何らかのデザインをしていると思います。
reading: 我々はそれぞれ何らかの人生観、社会観を持って生きています。各人の生涯の生活設計に関しても、漠然とした形ではあっても、何らかのデザインをしていると思います。
english: Each of us is living with a certain outlook on life and society. And no matter how vague it may be, I believe each person is designing a life plan in his/her own way.

translation: Not ~ at all; not any ~; nothing; no ~ whatsoever
explanation: A structure that is used to express a strong negative statement.
japanese: 本の大学教育の現状は何ら改善されていない。
reading: 日本の大学教育の現状は何ら改善されていない。
english: The state of Japanese college education has not improved at all.

translation: Not ~ at all; not any ~; nothing; no ~ whatsoever
explanation: A structure that is used to express a strong negative statement.
japanese: 会社側は労働組合に対して何らの誠意ある回答もしなかった。
reading: 会社側は労働組合に対して何らの誠意ある回答もしなかった。
english: The company (literally: company side) has failed to give any sincere reply to the labour union (whatsoever).

translation: Not ~ at all; not any ~; nothing; no ~ whatsoever
explanation: A structure that is used to express a strong negative statement.
japanese: 私は彼女とは何ら面識もないので、彼女の能力を知る由もありません。
reading: 私は彼女とは何ら面識もないので、彼女の能力を知る由もありません。
english: I am not acquainted with her at all, so I don't have any reason to know her ability.

translation: Not ~ at all; not any ~; nothing; no ~ whatsoever
explanation: A structure that is used to express a strong negative statement.
japanese: ソウルの町は、人の話さえ聞かなければ東京にいるのと何ら変わりがありません。
reading: ソウルの町は、人の話さえ聞かなければ東京にいるのと何ら変わりがありません。
english: The city of Seoul seems no different than Tokyo, as long as you don't hear someone talk.

translation: Not ~ at all; not any ~; nothing; no ~ whatsoever
explanation: A structure that is used to express a strong negative statement.
japanese: このドラマに登場する人物は実在する個人とは何ら関わりがありません。
reading: このドラマに登場する人物は実在する個人とは何ら関わりがありません。
english: The characters appearing in this drama have no connection to any real individuals.

translation: Not ~ at all; not any ~; nothing; no ~ whatsoever
explanation: A structure that is used to express a strong negative statement.
japanese: １９９０年の入管法の改正で日系人はその在留が合法化され、日本での就労についても何ら制限を受けないことになった。
reading: １９９０年の入管法の改正で日系人はその在留が合法化され、日本での就労についても何ら制限を受けないことになった。
english: The 1990 amendment of the immigration law legalized the residence of Japanese descendants from abroad in Japan, and they are now no longer restricted in any way from working in Japan.

translation: Not ~ at all; not any ~; nothing; no ~ whatsoever
explanation: A structure that is used to express a strong negative statement.
japanese: 当ホテルはホテル内での紛失に関しては何らの責任も負いません。
reading: 当ホテルはホテル内での紛失に関しては何らの責任も負いません。
english: This hotel takes no responsibility for items lost within the hotel.

translation: Not ~ at all; not any ~; nothing; no ~ whatsoever
explanation: A structure that is used to express a strong negative statement.
japanese: 彼女は生まれつき楽観的で、自分の将来についても何らの不安も感じていなかった。
reading: 彼女は生まれつき楽観的で、自分の将来についても何らの不安も感じていなかった。
english: She was a born optimist and felt no anxiety whatsoever about her future.

translation: Not ~ at all; not any ~; nothing; no ~ whatsoever
explanation: A structure that is used to express a strong negative statement.
japanese: この町は災害に対して何らの備えもない。
reading: この町は災害に対して何らの備えもない。
english: This town has made no provision against disaster.

translation: Not ~ at all; not any ~; nothing; no ~ whatsoever
explanation: A structure that is used to express a strong negative statement.
japanese: うちの社長は厳しくて、何らの失敗も許してくれない。
reading: うちの社長は厳しくて、何らの失敗も許してくれない。
english: Our company president is strict and won't accept any errors.

explanation: A phrase used as the colloquial version of なんと.
japanese: レポートのこと、社長はなんて言っていましたか。
reading: レポートのこと、社長はなんて言っていましたか。
english: What did the president say about the report?

explanation: A phrase used as the colloquial version of なんと.
japanese: きのう見た映画、なんていう映画だったっけ？
reading: きのう見た映画、なんていう映画だったっけ？
english: What was the title of the movie we saw yesterday?

explanation: A phrase used as the colloquial version of なんと.
japanese: これぐらいの宿題、なんて（いう）ことはないよ。
reading: これぐらいの宿題、なんて（いう）ことはないよ。
english: This much homework is nothing / not a big deal!

explanation: A phrase used as the colloquial version of なんと.
japanese: 日本のアニメはなんて面白いんだろう。
reading: 日本のアニメはなんて面白いんだろう。
english: How interesting Japanese anime is!

explanation: A phrase used as the colloquial version of なんと.
japanese: うちにホームステイしている留学生がテレビを観ていると「今なんて言った？」「英語だとなんて言うの？」と質問の連続だ。
reading: うちにホームステイしている留学生がテレビを観ていると「今なんて言った？」「英語だとなんて言うの？」と質問の連続だ。
english: When the foreign student staying with us watches TV, he keeps asking questions like "What did he say?" or "What is that in English?

explanation: A phrase used as the colloquial version of なんと.
japanese: 推薦状を書くのを頼まれると、時々なんて書いたらいいのか分からないことがある。
reading: 推薦状を書くのを頼まれると、時々なんて書いたらいいのか分からないことがある。
english: Sometimes I don't know what to write when I get asked to write a letter of recommendation.

explanation: A phrase used as the colloquial version of なんと.
japanese: なんていう人か名前を忘れたけれど、なかなか魅力的な女性に出会った。
reading: なんていう人か名前を忘れたけれど、なかなか魅力的な女性に出会った。
english: I met a very charming lady, although I've forgotten her name.

explanation: A phrase used as the colloquial version of なんと.
japanese: 彼はつらい目にたくさん遭っているのに、「なんていうことはない」という感じでひょうひょうと生きている。
reading: 彼はつらい目にたくさん遭っているのに、「なんていうことはない」という感じでひょうひょうと生きている。
english: He's had a rough time, but he lets it all roll off his back as if it were nothing to him.

explanation: A phrase used as the colloquial version of なんと.
japanese: うさぎをじーと見てると、なんてかわいいんだろう、なんてかわいい仕草をするんだろうって思った。
reading: うさぎをじーと見てると、なんてかわいいんだろう、なんてかわいい仕草をするんだろうって思った。
english: While staring at a rabbit I admired what a cute creature he was, and how he could make such cute gestures.

explanation: A phrase used as the colloquial version of なんと.
japanese: 自分のことを書くのって、なんて難しいんだろう。
reading: 自分のことを書くのって、なんて難しいんだろう。
english: It is so hard to write about myself!

explanation: A colloquial particle used to express a strong feeling such as astonishment, incredulousness, envy, disdain, dislike, happiness, etc.
japanese: 小学校からのいじめが中学まで続くなんてひどい。
reading: 小学校からのいじめが中学まで続くなんてひどい。
english: It's terrible that bullying continues after grade school into junior high.

explanation: A colloquial particle used to express a strong feeling such as astonishment, incredulousness, envy, disdain, dislike, happiness, etc.
japanese: 最近は電子メールばかり使っていて、手紙なんて滅多に書かない。
reading: 最近は電子メールばかり使っていて、手紙なんて滅多に書かない。
english: Lately I've been using only e-mail, and seldom write (a thing like) a letter.

explanation: A colloquial particle used to express a strong feeling such as astonishment, incredulousness, envy, disdain, dislike, happiness, etc.
japanese: 生演奏で踊れるなんて、うらやましい。
reading: 生演奏で踊れるなんて、うらやましい。
english: I'm envious that they can dance to live music (literally: a live performance).

explanation: A colloquial particle used to express a strong feeling such as astonishment, incredulousness, envy, disdain, dislike, happiness, etc.
japanese: 大勢の皆さんに家まで来ていただけるなんて、とても嬉しいです。
reading: 大勢の皆さんに家まで来ていただけるなんて、とても嬉しいです。
english: I'm very happy that so many of you have come to my home.

explanation: A colloquial particle used to express a strong feeling such as astonishment, incredulousness, envy, disdain, dislike, happiness, etc.
japanese: 夏にエアコンをつけすぎて寒いなんて、電力浪費も甚だしい。
reading: 夏にエアコンをつけすぎて寒いなんて、電力浪費も甚だしい。
english: It's horrible that they feel cold in summer while overusing their air conditioner and wasting electricity.

explanation: A colloquial particle used to express a strong feeling such as astonishment, incredulousness, envy, disdain, dislike, happiness, etc.
japanese: あの人がそんなに有名だなんてちっとも知らなかった。
reading: あの人がそんなに有名だなんてちっとも知らなかった。
english: I had no idea he was that famous!

explanation: A colloquial particle used to express a strong feeling such as astonishment, incredulousness, envy, disdain, dislike, happiness, etc.
japanese: あなたなんて最低よ。
reading: あなたなんて最低よ。
english: You are contemptible!

explanation: A colloquial particle used to express a strong feeling such as astonishment, incredulousness, envy, disdain, dislike, happiness, etc.
japanese: 納豆なんて嫌いだ。
reading: 納豆なんて嫌いだ。
english: I hate nattou (fermented soybeans).

translation: Somehow; in some way; in one way or another; manage to
explanation: An adverb expressing that someone somehow does something, or something somehow occurs.
japanese: 々は今の日本の政治状況を何とか変えようと努力しています。
reading: 我々は今の日本の政治状況を何とか変えようと努力しています。
english: We are making an effort to change the current Japanese political situation somehow.

translation: Somehow; in some way; in one way or another; manage to
explanation: An adverb expressing that someone somehow does something, or something somehow occurs.
japanese: 一見無理なことも、やってみれば何とか形になる。
reading: 一見無理なことも、やってみれば何とか形になる。
english: Something which appears to be impossible to do can take shape in one way or another, if you try.

translation: Somehow; in some way; in one way or another; manage to
explanation: An adverb expressing that someone somehow does something, or something somehow occurs.
japanese: この夏は友達と一緒に何とか富士山に登ってきました。
reading: この夏は友達と一緒に何とか富士山に登ってきました。
english: This past summer I managed to climb Mt. Fuji with my friend.

translation: Somehow; in some way; in one way or another; manage to
explanation: An adverb expressing that someone somehow does something, or something somehow occurs.
japanese: 夜型の生活を何とかしたいと思いながら、今でもそれを続けている。
reading: 夜型の生活を何とかしたいと思いながら、今でもそれを続けている。
english: Although I keep thinking I want to do something about my night owl lifestyle, (literally: even now) I still stay up late.

translation: Somehow; in some way; in one way or another; manage to
explanation: An adverb expressing that someone somehow does something, or something somehow occurs.
japanese: ボスにせかされているから、この書類を何とか明日までに仕上げなければならないんだ。
reading: ボスにせかされているから、この書類を何とか明日までに仕上げなければならないんだ。
english: My boss keeps pressing me, so somehow I have to complete this document by tomorrow.

translation: Somehow; in some way; in one way or another; manage to
explanation: An adverb expressing that someone somehow does something, or something somehow occurs.
japanese: 患者：おでこから血が出ることがあるんです。医者：おでこから血が？うーん。そんな症例は聞いたことがないなあ…。患者：ほんとなんです。お願いします、先生。何とかして下さい。
reading:
患者：おでこから血が出ることがあるんです。
医者：おでこから血が？うーん。そんな症例は聞いたことがないなあ…。
患者：ほんとなんです。お願いします、先生。何とかして下さい。
english:
Patient: Sometimes my forehead bleeds. 
Doctor: Your forehead bleeds? I haven't heard of a case like that before. 
Patient: It's true. Doctor, please do something about it.

translation: Somehow; in some way; in one way or another; manage to
explanation: An adverb expressing that someone somehow does something, or something somehow occurs.
japanese: 母親：あら、有香、もう勉強は終わったの。娘：勉強なんかやってらんないわよ。母親：まったくしょうがない子ねえ。お父さん、何とか言って下さいよ。
reading:
母親：あら、有香、もう勉強は終わったの。
娘：勉強なんかやってらんないわよ。
母親：まったくしょうがない子ねえ。お父さん、何とか言って下さいよ。
english:
Mother: Oh, Yuka, you've already ﬁnished studying? 
Daughter: I hate studying! 
Mother: You're impossible! Dear, say something to her.

translation: Somehow; in some way; in one way or another; manage to
explanation: An adverb expressing that someone somehow does something, or something somehow occurs.
japanese: 何とかホームページができたのでみんなに見せたい。
reading: 何とかホームページができたのでみんなに見せたい。
english: Somehow I managed to make my home page, so now I want to show it to everybody.

translation: Somehow; in some way; in one way or another; manage to
explanation: An adverb expressing that someone somehow does something, or something somehow occurs.
japanese: アメリカへ行けば何とかなるなんていう考えでアメリカに来たって、自分で何とかしなきゃ何ともならないんだ！
reading: アメリカへ行けば何とかなるなんていう考えでアメリカに来たって、自分で何とかしなきゃ何ともならないんだ！
english: If you come to the U.S. thinking that you'll get by somehow, you will amount to nothing unless you make an effort on your own.

translation: Somehow; in some way; in one way or another; manage to
explanation: An adverb expressing that someone somehow does something, or something somehow occurs.
japanese: いろんな形で支援して下さった皆様のおかげで、このプロジェクトは何とか無事に終了しました。
reading: いろんな形で支援して下さった皆様のおかげで、このプロジェクトは何とか無事に終了しました。
english: Thanks to your assistance, which took all kinds of forms, this project has somehow come successfully to completion.

translation: Still; even more; all the more for ~; additional; and; additionally; furthermore
explanation: An adverb that indicates that an action or state is still going on or the degree of something increases; a conjunction indicating that an additional comment follows what has just been said in the preceding sentence.
japanese: 宮崎[みやざき]駿[はやお]のアニメは、20年、30年たっても、なお古典アニメとして残っているだろう。
reading: 宮崎[みやざき]駿[はやお]のアニメは、20年、30年たっても、なお古典アニメとして残っているだろう。
english: Anime by Hayao Miyazaki will still remain even in 20 or 30 years as anime classics.

translation: Still; even more; all the more for ~; additional; and; additionally; furthermore
explanation: An adverb that indicates that an action or state is still going on or the degree of something increases; a conjunction indicating that an additional comment follows what has just been said in the preceding sentence.
japanese: この小説はパリを知っている人が読めばなお面白いだろう。
reading: この小説はパリを知っている人が読めばなお面白いだろう。
english: This novel must be all the more interesting if you know Paris.

translation: Still; even more; all the more for ~; additional; and; additionally; furthermore
explanation: An adverb that indicates that an action or state is still going on or the degree of something increases; a conjunction indicating that an additional comment follows what has just been said in the preceding sentence.
japanese: 日本へ行く前から日本が好きだったが、日本へ行ったらなお好きになった。
reading: 日本へ行く前から日本が好きだったが、日本へ行ったらなお好きになった。
english: I liked Japan before I went there, but after going there I became even more fond of it.

translation: Still; even more; all the more for ~; additional; and; additionally; furthermore
explanation: An adverb that indicates that an action or state is still going on or the degree of something increases; a conjunction indicating that an additional comment follows what has just been said in the preceding sentence.
japanese: 来週の金曜日午後6時から拙宅で夕食会をしますので、お知らせいたします。なお、ご都合のつかない方はお電話下さい。
reading: 来週の金曜日午後6時から拙宅で夕食会をしますので、お知らせいたします。なお、ご都合のつかない方はお電話下さい。
english: Let me inform you that there will be a dinner at my residence starting at 6:00 p.m. next Friday. Please call us if you can't come.

translation: Still; even more; all the more for ~; additional; and; additionally; furthermore
explanation: An adverb that indicates that an action or state is still going on or the degree of something increases; a conjunction indicating that an additional comment follows what has just been said in the preceding sentence.
japanese: 欧米やアジアでは景気は拡大し、総じて良好な状態がなお続いている。
reading: 欧米やアジアでは景気は拡大し、総じて良好な状態がなお続いている。
english: In Europe, the United States and Asia the economy has expanded and, generally speaking, favourable conditions continue to prevail.

translation: Still; even more; all the more for ~; additional; and; additionally; furthermore
explanation: An adverb that indicates that an action or state is still going on or the degree of something increases; a conjunction indicating that an additional comment follows what has just been said in the preceding sentence.
japanese: テレビで「3億円強奪事件」というドラマを見たが、面白かった。実話をもとにしているから、なお面白い。
reading: テレビで「3億円強奪事件」というドラマを見たが、面白かった。実話をもとにしているから、なお面白い。
english: I saw a drama called "The ¥300,000,000 Robbery" and found it interesting. It was even more so because it is based on a true story.

translation: Still; even more; all the more for ~; additional; and; additionally; furthermore
explanation: An adverb that indicates that an action or state is still going on or the degree of something increases; a conjunction indicating that an additional comment follows what has just been said in the preceding sentence.
japanese: 考えていることを書くのは勉強になる。その文章を先生が読んで感想を書いてくれるから、なお勉強になる。
reading: 考えていることを書くのは勉強になる。その文章を先生が読んで感想を書いてくれるから、なお勉強になる。
english: It is instructive to write down what we think, and still more instructive when our teacher reads our essays and gives comments on them.

translation: Still; even more; all the more for ~; additional; and; additionally; furthermore
explanation: An adverb that indicates that an action or state is still going on or the degree of something increases; a conjunction indicating that an additional comment follows what has just been said in the preceding sentence.
japanese: 日本語で話すことは難しいが、書くことはなお難しい。
reading: 日本語で話すことは難しいが、書くことはなお難しい。
english: It is difﬁcult to speak in Japanese, but it is even harder to write it.

translation: Still; even more; all the more for ~; additional; and; additionally; furthermore
explanation: An adverb that indicates that an action or state is still going on or the degree of something increases; a conjunction indicating that an additional comment follows what has just been said in the preceding sentence.
japanese: この論文を完成するまでには、なお2か月は必要だろう。
reading: この論文を完成するまでには、なお2か月は必要だろう。
english: It will take an additional two months to ﬁnish this paper.

translation: Still; even more; all the more for ~; additional; and; additionally; furthermore
explanation: An adverb that indicates that an action or state is still going on or the degree of something increases; a conjunction indicating that an additional comment follows what has just been said in the preceding sentence.
japanese: 金沢での夏期日本語講座参加希望者は、今月末までに願書を提出して下さい。なお、奨学金応募希望者は、至急用紙を取りに学部事務所に来て下さい。
reading: 金沢での夏期日本語講座参加希望者は、今月末までに願書を提出して下さい。なお、奨学金応募希望者は、至急用紙を取りに学部事務所に来て下さい。
english: Those of you who want to participate in the summer Japanese language program in Kanazawa, please submit your applications by the end of this month. Additionally, those who want to apply for a scholarship, please come to the department ofﬁce immediately to get the form.

translation: Still; even more; all the more for ~; additional; and; additionally; furthermore
explanation: An adverb that indicates that an action or state is still going on or the degree of something increases; a conjunction indicating that an additional comment follows what has just been said in the preceding sentence.
japanese: 私は月曜日と水曜日の午後2時から5時までは研究室にいますから、質問のある学生は自由に来て下さい。なお、それ以外の日に研究室に来たい学生は、あらかじめアポを取って下さい。
reading: 私は月曜日と水曜日の午後2時から5時までは研究室にいますから、質問のある学生は自由に来て下さい。なお、それ以外の日に研究室に来たい学生は、あらかじめアポを取って下さい。
english: I will be in my ofﬁce from 2:00 to 5:00 p.m. on Mondays and Wednesdays, so if you have a question feel free to visit me (during those times). However, if you want to see me at another time, please make an appointment in advance.

translation: Still more; much more; all the more; even more
explanation: An adverb indicating that the degree of something increases due to an additional circumstance.
japanese: 悪人さえも往生するのなら、まして善人はなおさらだ。
reading: <ruby title="悪人(あくにん)"><rb>悪人</rb><rt>あくにん</rt></ruby>さえも往生するのなら、まして<ruby title="善人(ぜんにん)"><rb>善人</rb><rt>ぜんにん</rt></ruby>はなおさらだ。
english: If even a bad person can go to heaven, then a good person has an even better chance.

translation: Still more; much more; all the more; even more
explanation: An adverb indicating that the degree of something increases due to an additional circumstance.
japanese: 貧乏を弁解すると、なおさら貧乏くさく聞こえる。
reading: 貧乏を弁解すると、なおさら貧乏くさく聞こえる。
english: If you make excuses for being poor you will seem (literally: sound) still poorer.

translation: Still more; much more; all the more; even more
explanation: An adverb indicating that the degree of something increases due to an additional circumstance.
japanese: このチーズは搾りたての新鮮な牛乳で作るから、なおさらおいしい。
reading: このチーズは搾りたての新鮮な牛乳で作るから、なおさらおいしい。
english: This cheese is made from milk fresh from the cow so it tastes even more delicious.

translation: Still more; much more; all the more; even more
explanation: An adverb indicating that the degree of something increases due to an additional circumstance.
japanese: 旅で足を踏み入れるだけで、沖縄はいまだに戦争を引きずっていることを感じる。まして、現地の人ではなおさらであろう
reading: 旅で足を踏み入れるだけで、沖縄はいまだに戦争を引きずっていることを感じる。まして、現地の人ではなおさらであろう
english: When you just go there as a traveller, you get a sense that Okinawa still hasn't gotten over the war. The local people must feel that way even more so.

translation: Still more; much more; all the more; even more
explanation: An adverb indicating that the degree of something increases due to an additional circumstance.
japanese: 英語を書くのは難しいが、正確さが要求される科学論文を書くのはなおさらだ。
reading: 英語を書くのは難しいが、正確さが要求される科学論文を書くのはなおさらだ。
english: It is hard to write in English, but it is still harder to write a scientiﬁc paper that requires accuracy.

translation: Still more; much more; all the more; even more
explanation: An adverb indicating that the degree of something increases due to an additional circumstance.
japanese: アジア諸国の学者や政府が、この教科書を詳細かつ適確に批判し、発行しないよう強く求めたにもに関わらず検定を通ったということは、なおさら重大です。
reading: アジア諸国の学者や政府が、この教科書を詳細かつ適確に批判し、発行しないよう強く求めたにもに関わらず検定を通ったということは、なおさら重大です。
english: It is all the more serious that this textbook has passed the inspection even though scholars and governments of Asian countries aptly criticized it in detail and urged it to not be published.

translation: Impossible if it’s not ~; only possible with/by/at/etc.; not possible with/by/at/etc. other ~; very difficult with/by/at/etc. any other ~ but; you can expect only/at/from/etc.; unless
explanation: A phrase indicating something is “impossible if it’s not X”.
japanese: 丸山博士の講演は、一流の科学者ならではの示唆に富む内容だった。
reading: <ruby title="丸山(まるやま)"><rb>丸山</rb><rt>まるやま</rt></ruby>博士の講演は、一流の科学者ならではの示唆に富む内容だった。
english: Dr. Maruyama's lecture was rich with suggestion, the likes of which could only be heard from a ﬁrst-class scientist (like himself).

translation: Impossible if it’s not ~; only possible with/by/at/etc.; not possible with/by/at/etc. other ~; very difficult with/by/at/etc. any other ~ but; you can expect only/at/from/etc.; unless
explanation: A phrase indicating something is “impossible if it’s not X”.
japanese: 四季を通じて美しい景色が楽しめるのはこの地ならではだ。
reading: <ruby title="四季(しき)"><rb>四季</rb><rt>しき</rt></ruby>を 通[つう]じて美しい景色が楽しめるのはこの地ならではだ。
english: Only here can we enjoy beautiful scenery through all four seasons.

translation: Impossible if it’s not ~; only possible with/by/at/etc.; not possible with/by/at/etc. other ~; very difficult with/by/at/etc. any other ~ but; you can expect only/at/from/etc.; unless
explanation: A phrase indicating something is “impossible if it’s not X”.
japanese: 女性ならではできない仕事や役割もあるはずだ。
reading: 女性ならではできない仕事や役割もあるはずだ。
english: There also must be jobs and roles that only women can perform (literally: that cannot be done unless you are a woman).

translation: Impossible if it’s not ~; only possible with/by/at/etc.; not possible with/by/at/etc. other ~; very difficult with/by/at/etc. any other ~ but; you can expect only/at/from/etc.; unless
explanation: A phrase indicating something is “impossible if it’s not X”.
japanese: この大学の法律図書館には、この大学ならではの充実した資料が揃っている。
reading: この大学の法律図書館には、この大学ならではの充実した資料が揃っている。
english: The law library of this university houses a rich collection of documents, the likes of which do not exist at other institutions.

translation: Impossible if it’s not ~; only possible with/by/at/etc.; not possible with/by/at/etc. other ~; very difficult with/by/at/etc. any other ~ but; you can expect only/at/from/etc.; unless
explanation: A phrase indicating something is “impossible if it’s not X”.
japanese: プロショップならではの品揃え。人気商品を特別価格でお求めいただけます。
reading: プロショップならではの品揃え。人気商品を特別価格でお求めいただけます。
english: We have a range of products that would only be available at a shop for pros. Popular items are available at special prices.

translation: Impossible if it’s not ~; only possible with/by/at/etc.; not possible with/by/at/etc. other ~; very difficult with/by/at/etc. any other ~ but; you can expect only/at/from/etc.; unless
explanation: A phrase indicating something is “impossible if it’s not X”.
japanese: このマンションは都心の住居ならではの便利さと快適さをお約束します。
reading: このマンションは都心の住居ならではの便利さと快適さをお約束します。
english: These condominiums promise the kind of convenience and comfort you can enjoy only in dwellings at the heart of the city.

translation: Impossible if it’s not ~; only possible with/by/at/etc.; not possible with/by/at/etc. other ~; very difficult with/by/at/etc. any other ~ but; you can expect only/at/from/etc.; unless
explanation: A phrase indicating something is “impossible if it’s not X”.
japanese: 興味がわいたら、その分野を徹底して勉強してみる時間があるというのは学生ならではだ。
reading: 興味がわいたら、その分野を徹底して勉強してみる時間があるというのは学生ならではだ。
english: It is only because they are students (literally: It is not possible unless they are students) that they have the time to thoroughly pursue ﬁelds they ﬁnd they have an interest in.
