english: Although his strength has faded, he still maintains (levels of) concentration and stamina comparable to younger players.

translation: Even; any; although; though; even though
explanation: A conjunction that expresses the idea of “even (though)”.
japanese: いかに日本での生活が長いといえども、言葉の問題には常には遭遇する。
reading: いかに日本での生活が長いといえども、言葉の問題には常には遭遇する。
english: Although I've lived in Japan for a long time, I constantly encounter language problems.

translation: Even; any; although; though; even though
explanation: A conjunction that expresses the idea of “even (though)”.
japanese: 天性の才能を持ち合わせているといえども、絶え間ない努力と訓練なくして今日の彼女はなかった。
reading: 天性の才能を持ち合わせているといえども、絶え間ない努力と訓練なくして今日の彼女はなかった。
english: Although she has natural talents, she couldn't be what she is now without her unceasing effort and training.

translation: In terms of both ~ and ~; in terms of ~ as well as ~; from the perspective of both ~ and ~
explanation: A structure that introduces multiple perspectives when describing a person or a thing.
japanese: このコーヒーは味といい香りといい、申し分ありません。
reading: このコーヒーは味といい香りといい、申し分ありません。
english: This coffee is perfect in terms of both ﬂavour and aroma.

translation: In terms of both ~ and ~; in terms of ~ as well as ~; from the perspective of both ~ and ~
explanation: A structure that introduces multiple perspectives when describing a person or a thing.
japanese: 内容といい話し方といい、見事なスピーチでした。
reading: 内容といい話し方といい、見事なスピーチでした。
english: It was a splendid speech in terms of content as well as delivery.

translation: In terms of both ~ and ~; in terms of ~ as well as ~; from the perspective of both ~ and ~
explanation: A structure that introduces multiple perspectives when describing a person or a thing.
japanese: 声といい演技力といい、彼女は最高だ。
reading: 声といい演技力といい、彼女は最高だ。
english: She is the best from the perspective of both voice and acting ability.

translation: In terms of both ~ and ~; in terms of ~ as well as ~; from the perspective of both ~ and ~
explanation: A structure that introduces multiple perspectives when describing a person or a thing.
japanese: 人柄といい才能といい、米倉さんに勝る人はいない。
reading: 人柄といい才能といい、米倉さんに勝る人はいない。
english: No one surpasses Ms. Yonekura in terms of both personality and ability.

translation: In terms of both ~ and ~; in terms of ~ as well as ~; from the perspective of both ~ and ~
explanation: A structure that introduces multiple perspectives when describing a person or a thing.
japanese: 音楽の情感といい音の豊かさといい、こんな感動的な演奏を聴いたことがない。
reading: 音楽の情感といい音の豊かさといい、こんな感動的な演奏を聴いたことがない。
english: I've never heard such a moving performance, both in terms of the artist's emotion and the richness of the sound.

translation: In terms of both ~ and ~; in terms of ~ as well as ~; from the perspective of both ~ and ~
explanation: A structure that introduces multiple perspectives when describing a person or a thing.
japanese: 家柄といい学歴といい、彼は非の打ちどころがない。
reading: 家柄といい学歴といい、彼は非の打ちどころがない。
english: He is just perfect, both in terms of his family and educational backgrounds.

translation: In terms of both ~ and ~; in terms of ~ as well as ~; from the perspective of both ~ and ~
explanation: A structure that introduces multiple perspectives when describing a person or a thing.
japanese: スピードといいパワーといい、今の彼に勝てる選手はいない。
reading: スピードといいパワーといい、今の彼に勝てる選手はいない。
english: No player can beat him now in terms of either speed or power.

translation: Like; such as; among others
explanation: A compound particle that introduces examples.
japanese: ドイツ、フランス、ロシアといった国々が戦争に反対した。
reading: ドイツ、フランス、ロシアといった国々が戦争に反対した。
english: Countries such as Germany, France and Russia opposed the war.

translation: Like; such as; among others
explanation: A compound particle that introduces examples.
japanese: このエンジンで一番困るのはパワーが弱い、製造コストが高いといった問題だ。
reading: このエンジンで一番困るのはパワーが弱い、製造コストが高いといった問題だ。
english: The problems that are giving me the most trouble with this engine are things like weak power and high production costs.

translation: Like; such as; among others
explanation: A compound particle that introduces examples.
japanese: 終身雇用、年功序列といった日本の伝統的雇用形態が崩れつつある。
reading: <ruby title="終身(しゅうしん)"><rb>終身</rb><rt>しゅうしん</rt></ruby><ruby title="雇用(こよう)"><rb>雇用</rb><rt>こよう</rt></ruby>、<ruby title="年功序列(ねんこうじょれつ)"><rb>年功序列</rb><rt>ねんこうじょれつ</rt></ruby>といった日本の伝統的<ruby title="雇用(こよう)"><rb>雇用</rb><rt>こよう</rt></ruby> <ruby title="形態(けいたい)"><rb>形態</rb><rt>けいたい</rt></ruby>が<ruby title="崩(くず)"><rb>崩</rb><rt>くず</rt></ruby>れつつある。
english: Japan's traditional employment practices, such as permanent employment and seniority systems, are (in the process of) falling apart.

translation: Like; such as; among others
explanation: A compound particle that introduces examples.
japanese: ここではBMWやベンツといったドイツの高級車が人気があるようだ。
reading: ここではBMWやベンツといったドイツの高級車が人気があるようだ。
english: It looks like expensive German cars such as BMWs and Mercedes Benzes are popular here.

translation: Like; such as; among others
explanation: A compound particle that introduces examples.
japanese: 学校選択制、そして基礎学力の向上といったテーマが今、全国で議論されている。
reading: 学校選択制、そして基礎学力の向上といったテーマが今、全国で議論されている。
english: Themes like school-choice systems and the improvement of basic academic skills are being discussed all over the country now.

translation: Like; such as; among others
explanation: A compound particle that introduces examples.
japanese: こんな機能があるといい、こんな情報が欲しいといったご意見・ご要望がありましたら、下記のアドレスに電子メールでお知らせ下さい。
reading: こんな機能があるといい、こんな情報が欲しいといったご意見・ご要望がありましたら、下記のアドレスに電子メールでお知らせ下さい。
english: If you have opinions/requests such as "This kind of function would be helpful" or "I want this kind of information," please let us know via e-mail at the address below.

translation: Like; such as; among others
explanation: A compound particle that introduces examples.
japanese: 一流大学から一流企業に就職すれば一生安泰の人生が送れるといった考え方はもう通用しない。
reading: 一流大学から一流企業に就職すれば一生安泰の人生が送れるといった考え方はもう通用しない。
english: It's no longer realistic to think that if you graduate from a ﬁrst-class university and get a job at a ﬁrst-class company you are set for life.

translation: Like; such as; among others
explanation: A compound particle that introduces examples.
japanese: ゴミを燃やせばダイオキシン二酸化炭素といった有害物質が排出される。またゴミの埋立地もあとわずかで満杯になる、しかも新たな埋立地がない、といった問題がある。
reading: ゴミを燃やせばダイオキシン二酸化炭素といった有害物質が排出される。またゴミの埋立地もあとわずかで満杯になる、しかも新たな埋立地がない、といった問題がある。
english: If you burn trash, toxic materials such as dioxin and carbon dioxide are emitted. There is also the problem that landﬁlls will soon be full and, to make the matter worse, no new land for landﬁlls is available.

translation: I would say ~; ~ is how I’d put it
explanation: A phrase the speaker/writer uses to explain something in a brief/rough manner.
japanese: 9月になって猛暑も一段落といったところです。
reading: 9月になって猛暑も一段落といったところです。
english: I'd say the searing heat levelled off in September.

translation: I would say ~; ~ is how I’d put it
explanation: A phrase the speaker/writer uses to explain something in a brief/rough manner.
japanese: ここは山というよりは、小高い丘といったところだ。
reading: ここは山というよりは、小高い丘といったところだ。
english: I'd say that this is more of a (small) hill than a mountain.

translation: I would say ~; ~ is how I’d put it
explanation: A phrase the speaker/writer uses to explain something in a brief/rough manner.
japanese: ホテルの部屋の広さはまあまあといったところでした。
reading: ホテルの部屋の広さはまあまあといったところでした。
english: I'd say that the space in the hotel room was so-so.

translation: I would say ~; ~ is how I’d put it
explanation: A phrase the speaker/writer uses to explain something in a brief/rough manner.
japanese: この大学の学部生と院生は合わせて6、000人といったところだ。
reading: この大学の学部生と院生は合わせて6,000人といったところだ。
english: Together, the number of undergraduates and graduates at this college is about 6,000.

translation: I would say ~; ~ is how I’d put it
explanation: A phrase the speaker/writer uses to explain something in a brief/rough manner.
japanese: ヤンキースとレッドソックスはほぼ互角といったところだ。
reading: ヤンキースとレッドソックスはほぼ互角といったところだ。
english: I'd say that the Yankees and the Red Sox are even.

translation: I would say ~; ~ is how I’d put it
explanation: A phrase the speaker/writer uses to explain something in a brief/rough manner.
japanese: たった1年間の経験だけでは、図書館「達人」と呼ばれるには、まだまだといったところです。
reading: たった1年間の経験だけでは、図書館「達人」と呼ばれるには、まだまだといったところです。
english: With only one year of experience, I'd say I have a long way to go before people call me a library expert.

translation: I would say ~; ~ is how I’d put it
explanation: A phrase the speaker/writer uses to explain something in a brief/rough manner.
japanese: 英語の"Sorry"は日本語の「すみません」よりも「謝罪」の意味合いが強い。いわゆる「ごめんなさい」「申し訳ありません」といったところだ。
reading: 英語の"Sorry"は日本語の「すみません」よりも「謝罪」の意味合いが強い。いわゆる「ごめんなさい」「申し訳ありません」といったところだ。
english: “Sorry” in English is more of an apology than the Japanese “sumimasen.” I would say that it corresponds to “gomennasai” or “moushiwake arimasen.”

translation: I would say ~; ~ is how I’d put it
explanation: A phrase the speaker/writer uses to explain something in a brief/rough manner.
japanese: この小説の主人公の男の性格を一言で表すとすれば、「自分には厳しいけれど、人にはとても優しい」といったところです。
reading: この小説の主人公の男の性格を一言で表すとすれば、「自分には厳しいけれど、人にはとても優しい」といったところです。
english: If I were to describe the personality of this novel's main character in short (literally: in a word), I would say he is very hard on himself but very kind to others.

translation: However; but; having said that
explanation: A conjunction used at the beginning of a sentence to convey the idea of “however”.
japanese: あと１０００万円あればなんとか欲しい家が買える。と言って、そんな大金を借りられるあてはない。
reading: あと１０００万円あればなんとか欲しい家が買える。と言って、そんな大金を借りられるあてはない。
english: If we had another ten million yen, we could manage to buy the house we want. Having said that, we don't know how we could borrow that much money.

translation: However; but; having said that
explanation: A conjunction used at the beginning of a sentence to convey the idea of “however”.
japanese: 外食は飽きたし自分で料理するのも億劫だ。と言って、何も食べずにいるというわけにもいかない。
reading: 外食は飽きたし自分で料理するのも億劫だ。と言って、何も食べずにいるというわけにもいかない。
english: I've gotten tired of eating out, and cooking for myself is tiresome, too. But, I have to eat something (literally: I can't just not eat).

translation: However; but; having said that
explanation: A conjunction used at the beginning of a sentence to convey the idea of “however”.
japanese: いくら考えても名案は浮かばない。と言って、何もしなければ事態は悪化する一方だ。
reading: いくら考えても名案は浮かばない。と言って、何もしなければ事態は悪化する一方だ。
english: No matter how hard I think, I cannot come up with a good idea. However, the situation will get only worse if I don't do anything about it.

translation: However; but; having said that
explanation: A conjunction used at the beginning of a sentence to convey the idea of “however”.
japanese: 彼女と別れるのは絶対いやだ。と言って、妻と離婚する勇気もない。
reading: 彼女と別れるのは絶対いやだ。と言って、妻と離婚する勇気もない。
english: I deﬁnitely don't want to leave my girlfriend. Having said that, I don't have the courage to divorce my wife, either.

translation: However; but; having said that
explanation: A conjunction used at the beginning of a sentence to convey the idea of “however”.
japanese: 最近は少し運動するとすぐ疲れてしまう。と言って、何もしないと体が衰えるばかりなので何かしなければならない。
reading: 最近は少し運動するとすぐ疲れてしまう。と言って、何もしないと体が衰えるばかりなので何かしなければならない。
english: These days I get tired quickly after doing a little exercise. However, I have to do something because if I don't do anything, l'll only get weaker.

translation: However; but; having said that
explanation: A conjunction used at the beginning of a sentence to convey the idea of “however”.
japanese: アメリカで自分の能力をためすのも面白いかもしれない。と言って、英語ができなければどうしようもないが。
reading: アメリカで自分の能力をためすのも面白いかもしれない。と言って、英語ができなければどうしようもないが。
english: It might be interesting for you to try out your skills in America. But, it won't do any good if you cannot speak English.

translation: Or; or rather; or I’d (rather) call it; or I may call it; or I’d (rather) say; or I may say
explanation: A phrase used to restate what was just said in order to be more accurate or appropriate.
japanese: 自分の勘違いと言うか、不注意でした。
reading: 自分の勘違いと言うか、不注意でした。
english: It was my misunderstanding . . . or carelessness, rather.

translation: Or; or rather; or I’d (rather) call it; or I may call it; or I’d (rather) say; or I may say
explanation: A phrase used to restate what was just said in order to be more accurate or appropriate.
japanese: 彼のことは諦めたと言うか、もうどうでもよくなった。
reading: 彼のことは諦めたと言うか、もうどうでもよくなった。
english: I'm through with him. Or rather, I don't care anymore.

translation: Or; or rather; or I’d (rather) call it; or I may call it; or I’d (rather) say; or I may say
explanation: A phrase used to restate what was just said in order to be more accurate or appropriate.
japanese: 我が社の話は何もできません。と言うか、何も話すことはありません。
reading: 我が社の話は何もできません。と言うか、何も話すことはありません。
english: I cannot talk about our company. Or, I should say, I have nothing to say about it.

translation: Or; or rather; or I’d (rather) call it; or I may call it; or I’d (rather) say; or I may say
explanation: A phrase used to restate what was just said in order to be more accurate or appropriate.
japanese: 彼は議論好きと言うか、いつも人の意見に反対したがります。
reading: 彼は議論好きと言うか、いつも人の意見に反対したがります。
english: He is argumentative, or should I say, he always wants to disagree with others.

translation: Or; or rather; or I’d (rather) call it; or I may call it; or I’d (rather) say; or I may say
explanation: A phrase used to restate what was just said in order to be more accurate or appropriate.
japanese: この事件については、私たちも驚いていると言うか、困惑しています。
reading: この事件については、私たちも驚いていると言うか、困惑しています。
english: We are also surprised by this incident, or perplexed, rather.

translation: Or; or rather; or I’d (rather) call it; or I may call it; or I’d (rather) say; or I may say
explanation: A phrase used to restate what was just said in order to be more accurate or appropriate.
japanese: 今日来た人は、商魂たくましいと言うか、本当に厚かましい人でした。
reading: 今日来た人は、商魂たくましいと言うか、本当に厚かましい人でした。
english: The person who visited us today was an aggressive salesman, or maybe I should just say he was a really shameless person.

translation: Or; or rather; or I’d (rather) call it; or I may call it; or I’d (rather) say; or I may say
explanation: A phrase used to restate what was just said in order to be more accurate or appropriate.
japanese: 何度裏切られても涙を見ると許してしまう自分に腹が立つと言うか、愛想が尽きる。
reading: 何度裏切られても涙を見ると許してしまう自分に腹が立つと言うか、愛想が尽きる。
english: No matter how many times I get betrayed, I end up forgiving him when I see his tears. I'm angry at myself, or I should say, I'm sick of myself. (literally: I'm angry at myself, who ends up...)

translation: Or; or rather; or I’d (rather) call it; or I may call it; or I’d (rather) say; or I may say
explanation: A phrase used to restate what was just said in order to be more accurate or appropriate.
japanese: これは何と言うか、まあ、一種の妥協でしょうね。
reading: これは何と言うか、まあ、一種の妥協でしょうね。
english: What should I call it? Hmm, it's a kind of compromise, I guess.

translation: Or; or rather; or I’d (rather) call it; or I may call it; or I’d (rather) say; or I may say
explanation: A phrase used to restate what was just said in order to be more accurate or appropriate.
japanese: これは日記と言うか覚え書きと言うか…。
reading: これは日記と言うか覚え書きと言うか…。
english: Should I call this a diary, or a memo?

translation: Or; or rather; or I’d (rather) call it; or I may call it; or I’d (rather) say; or I may say
explanation: A phrase used to restate what was just said in order to be more accurate or appropriate.
japanese: A:あの人は奥さんですか。 B:うーん、と言うか、恋人みたいなもんです。
reading:
A:あの人は奥さんですか。 
B:うーん、と言うか、恋人みたいなもんです。
english:
A: Is she your wife? 
B: Well, actually, (I'd say) she's something like a lover.

translation: (I’m saying this) because; the reason (why I’m saying this) is that; by ~ I mean that; what I mean is that
explanation: A phrase that introduces the reason for what has just been said.
japanese: 来月の旅行は取りやめます。と言うのは、同じ頃に大事なお客が来ることになったんです。
reading: 来月の旅行は取りやめます。と言うのは、同じ頃に大事なお客が来ることになったんです。
english: We are cancelling next month's trip. I'm saying this because it turns out that we're going to have an important guest around the same time.

translation: (I’m saying this) because; the reason (why I’m saying this) is that; by ~ I mean that; what I mean is that
explanation: A phrase that introduces the reason for what has just been said.
japanese: 今まで読めていた画像ファイルがほとんど読めなくなってしまいました。ほとんどと言うのは、少しですが読めるファイルもあるのです。
reading: 今まで読めていた画像ファイルがほとんど読めなくなってしまいました。ほとんどと言うのは、少しですが読めるファイルもあるのです。
english: Almost all the image ﬁles that I have been able to read until now have become unreadable. I say "almost" because, even though there are only a few, there are ﬁles that are still readable.

translation: (I’m saying this) because; the reason (why I’m saying this) is that; by ~ I mean that; what I mean is that
explanation: A phrase that introduces the reason for what has just been said.
japanese: 社長に直接話してみたらどうですか。と言うのは、実は社長も以前そういうアイディアについて話していたことがあるんです。
reading: 社長に直接話してみたらどうですか。と言うのは、実は社長も以前そういうアイディアについて話していたことがあるんです。
english: Why don't you talk to the (company) president (about it)? I'm saying this because he was talking about a similar idea before.

translation: (I’m saying this) because; the reason (why I’m saying this) is that; by ~ I mean that; what I mean is that
explanation: A phrase that introduces the reason for what has just been said.
japanese: もう少し詳しく話してもらえませんか。と言うのは、私も少し前、同じような男から同じような被害に遭ったんです。
reading: もう少し詳しく話してもらえませんか。と言うのは、私も少し前、同じような男から同じような被害に遭ったんです。
english: Could you talk about it a little more in detail? (Because) I also ran into similar trouble with the same kind of man a little while ago.

translation: (I’m saying this) because; the reason (why I’m saying this) is that; by ~ I mean that; what I mean is that
explanation: A phrase that introduces the reason for what has just been said.
japanese: それは一度専門家に調べてもらった方がいいでしょう。と言うのは、素人が勝手に直すと、知らないうちに部品を傷めてしまう可能性があるからです。
reading: それは一度専門家に調べてもらった方がいいでしょう。と言うのは、素人が勝手に直すと、知らないうちに部品を傷めてしまう可能性があるからです。
english: I think it's better to have it checked out by an expert, because if an amateur tries to fix it himself, he could damage a part without knowing it.

translation: (I’m saying this) because; the reason (why I’m saying this) is that; by ~ I mean that; what I mean is that
explanation: A phrase that introduces the reason for what has just been said.
japanese: 最近のパソコン用OSの普及で視覚障害者が困っている。と言うのは、これらのOSは画像中心で文字情報が少なく、文字を音声で読ませる方法があまり使えないからだ。
reading: 最近のパソコン用OSの普及で視覚障害者が困っている。と言うのは、これらのOSは画像中心で文字情報が少なく、文字を音声で読ませる方法があまり使えないからだ。
english: People with vision problems are having trouble with the spread of the latest operating systems for personal computers because these operating systems are image-oriented with little word-based information, so there's not much of a chance to use software that reads words aloud.

translation: (I’m saying this) because; the reason (why I’m saying this) is that; by ~ I mean that; what I mean is that
explanation: A phrase that introduces the reason for what has just been said.
japanese: これらのゲームは、より正確に言えば、「一人用ゲーム」というより「一人でもできるゲーム」と言うべきでしょう。と言いますのは、これらのゲームはやり方によっては二人以上でもできるからです。
reading: これらのゲームは、より正確に言えば、「一人用ゲーム」というより「一人でもできるゲーム」と言うべきでしょう。と言いますのは、これらのゲームはやり方によっては二人以上でもできるからです。
english: To be more accurate, these games should be called "games that can also be played alone" rather than "games for one person." What I mean is, depending on how you play them, these games can be played by two or more people.

translation: (I’m saying this) because; the reason (why I’m saying this) is that; by ~ I mean that; what I mean is that
explanation: A phrase that introduces the reason for what has just been said.
japanese: あの提案書はたぶん通ると思う。たぶんと言うのは、審査委員の中に一人だけ反対するかもしれないのがいるんだ。
reading: あの提案書はたぶん通ると思う。たぶんと言うのは、審査委員の中に一人だけ反対するかもしれないのがいるんだ。
english: I think that proposal will probably be approved. I say "probably" because there is one person on the review committee who might oppose it.

translation: A, B and many other ~; A, B and every ~ else; including: whether X or Y
explanation: A structure indicating that something is the case not only for A and B but also for many other places, things, etc., of X, to which A and B belong
japanese: 友達の引っ越しを手伝ったら、翌日肩と言わず腰と言わず体のあちこちが痛んだ。
reading: 友達の引っ越しを手伝ったら、翌日肩と言わず腰と言わず体のあちこちが痛んだ。
english: I helped my friend move. Then, the next day my shoulders, my back and every other part of my body ached.

translation: A, B and many other ~; A, B and every ~ else; including: whether X or Y
explanation: A structure indicating that something is the case not only for A and B but also for many other places, things, etc., of X, to which A and B belong
japanese: 武史の部屋は、壁と言わず天井と言わず、いたるところにサッカーの写真が貼ってあった。
reading: 武史[たけし]の部屋は、壁と言わず天井と言わず、いたるところにサッカーの写真が貼ってあった。
english: In Takeshi's room, pictures of soccer were posted on the walls, the ceiling and everywhere else.

translation: A, B and many other ~; A, B and every ~ else; including: whether X or Y
explanation: A structure indicating that something is the case not only for A and B but also for many other places, things, etc., of X, to which A and B belong
japanese: しばらくすると、発疹が首と言わず手足と言わず、全身に広がった。
reading: しばらくすると、発疹が首と言わず手足と言わず、全身に広がった。
english: Sometime later, a rash spread over my neck, hands, feet and all over the rest of my body.

translation: A, B and many other ~; A, B and every ~ else; including: whether X or Y
explanation: A structure indicating that something is the case not only for A and B but also for many other places, things, etc., of X, to which A and B belong
japanese: イベント会場は廊下と言わず階段と言わず、参加者で溢れていた。
reading: イベント会場は廊下と言わず階段と言わず、参加者で溢れていた。
english: The participants were everywhere at the event site, even in the halls and on the stairs.

translation: A, B and many other ~; A, B and every ~ else; including: whether X or Y
explanation: A structure indicating that something is the case not only for A and B but also for many other places, things, etc., of X, to which A and B belong
japanese: 彼女が身につけているものは、靴と言わず、時計と言わず、スカーフと言わず、すべてブランドものだ。
reading: 彼女が身につけているものは、靴と言わず、時計と言わず、スカーフと言わず、すべてブランドものだ。
english: Everything she wears, including her shoes, her watch and her scarf, is a famous brand.

translation: A, B and many other ~; A, B and every ~ else; including: whether X or Y
explanation: A structure indicating that something is the case not only for A and B but also for many other places, things, etc., of X, to which A and B belong
japanese: 彼は仕事中と言わず休み時間と言わず、一時もコンピュータから離れることがない。
reading: 彼は仕事中と言わず休み時間と言わず、一時もコンピュータから離れることがない。
english: He doesn't leave his computer even for a moment, whether it's work time or break time.

translation: A, B and many other ~; A, B and every ~ else; including: whether X or Y
explanation: A structure indicating that something is the case not only for A and B but also for many other places, things, etc., of X, to which A and B belong
japanese: 姉のうちは昼と言わず夜と言わず、一日中テレビをつけっぱなしにしている。
reading: 姉のうちは昼と言わず夜と言わず、一日中テレビをつけっぱなしにしている。
english: At my (elder) sister's house, the TV set is on all the time, day or night.

translation: A, B and many other ~; A, B and every ~ else; including: whether X or Y
explanation: A structure indicating that something is the case not only for A and B but also for many other places, things, etc., of X, to which A and B belong
japanese: 男と言わず女と言わず、誰もがこの物語のヒロインには共感するはずだ。
reading: 男と言わず女と言わず、誰もがこの物語のヒロインには共感するはずだ。
english: Anyone—man or woman—would sympathize with the heroine of this story.

translation: A, B and many other ~; A, B and every ~ else; including: whether X or Y
explanation: A structure indicating that something is the case not only for A and B but also for many other places, things, etc., of X, to which A and B belong
japanese: 保守と言わず革新と言わず、どんな政治家もみな選挙資金集めのために奔走する。
reading: 保守と言わず革新と言わず、どんな政治家もみな選挙資金集めのために奔走する。
english: Every politician, whether conservative or liberal, works hard (literally: runs around) to raise money for his/her political campaign (literally: election).

translation: Because; be caused by the fact that ~; from the fact that ~
explanation: A phrase that introduces the origins of names, theories, ideas and events.
japanese: この宝石は猫の目に似ているところから「猫目石」と名づけられている。
reading: この宝石は猫の目に似ているところから「猫目石」と名づけられている。
english: This gem is called "cat's-eye" because it resembles a cat's eye.

translation: Because; be caused by the fact that ~; from the fact that ~
explanation: A phrase that introduces the origins of names, theories, ideas and events.
japanese: 私が両者にそのことを十分説明しなかったところから誤解が生じた。
reading: 私が両者にそのことを十分説明しなかったところから誤解が生じた。
english: The misunderstanding was caused by the fact that I didn't explain it to both of them fully.

translation: Because; be caused by the fact that ~; from the fact that ~
explanation: A phrase that introduces the origins of names, theories, ideas and events.
japanese: 田中先生はいつも蝶ネクタイをしていたところから「蝶ネクタイ先生」と呼ばれていた。
reading: 田中先生はいつも蝶ネクタイをしていたところから「蝶ネクタイ先生」と呼ばれていた。
english: Dr. Tanaka was called "Professor Bow Tie" because he always wore one.

translation: Because; be caused by the fact that ~; from the fact that ~
explanation: A phrase that introduces the origins of names, theories, ideas and events.
japanese: 日本は憲法が戦力の保持を禁止しているところから、「軍隊」ではなく「自衛隊」を持っている。
reading: 日本は憲法が戦力の保持を禁止しているところから、「軍隊」ではなく「自衛隊」を持っている。
english: Because its constitution bans the possession of military power, Japan has "Self-Defence Forces," but not an "army."

translation: Because; be caused by the fact that ~; from the fact that ~
explanation: A phrase that introduces the origins of names, theories, ideas and events.
japanese: この説は、両者が生物的に多くの共通点を持っているところから来ている。
reading: この説は、両者が生物的に多くの共通点を持っているところから来ている。
english: This theory comes from the fact that, biologically, the two species have many things in common.

translation: Because; be caused by the fact that ~; from the fact that ~
explanation: A phrase that introduces the origins of names, theories, ideas and events.
japanese: 論語に「何もしないでいるよりは碁を打つ方がましだ」という教えがあるところから、碁は孔子以前にかなり普及していたとみられる。
reading: 論語に「何もしないでいるよりは碁を打つ方がましだ」という教えがあるところから、碁は孔子以前にかなり普及していたとみられる。
english: Because the Analects teach us that "It is better to play Go than to not do anything," it appears that Go was already fairly popular before Confucius' time.

translation: Because; be caused by the fact that ~; from the fact that ~
explanation: A phrase that introduces the origins of names, theories, ideas and events.
japanese: そのイギリス人とは家が近くだったところから、よく遊びに行って英語や英語の歌を教えてもらったりした。
reading: そのイギリス人とは家が近くだったところから、よく遊びに行って英語や英語の歌を教えてもらったりした。
english: Because my house was close to the Englishman's, I visited him often and he taught me English and English songs and other things.

translation: Because; be caused by the fact that ~; from the fact that ~
explanation: A phrase that introduces the origins of names, theories, ideas and events.
japanese: この雑誌は最初、ある有名月刊誌の別冊として刊行されたのが好評だったところから、後に単独の雑誌として独立したものだ。
reading: この雑誌は最初、ある有名月刊誌の別冊として刊行されたのが好評だったところから、後に単独の雑誌として独立したものだ。
english: This magazine was ﬁrst published as a separate volume of a famous monthly magazine and later became an independent publication because it was so well received.

translation: Because; be caused by the fact that ~; from the fact that ~
explanation: A phrase that introduces the origins of names, theories, ideas and events.
japanese: 今音楽で広く使われているCDは、実はベートーベンの第九交響曲の演奏時間が７４分間だったところからその容量が決められたということだ。
reading: 今音楽で広く使われているCDは、実はベートーベンの第九交響曲の演奏時間が７４分間だったところからその容量が決められたということだ。
english: I heard that the capacity of the CDs we use so widely now for music was settled on because a (certain) performance of Beethoven's Ninth Symphony was 74 minutes long.

translation: Without intending to; without paying much attention; unconsciously; mindlessly; don’t know (exactly) who/where/etc. (but); cannot tell (exactly) who/where/etc. (but); (to/from) no particular (person, etc.)
explanation: A phrase indicating that the subject does something without paying much attention, or that when, where, to whom, etc., something took place is unclear.
japanese: 散歩をしているうちに、来るともなく駅まで来てしまった。
reading: 散歩をしているうちに、来るともなく駅まで来てしまった。
english: While I was taking a walk, I came as far as the station without intending to.

translation: Without intending to; without paying much attention; unconsciously; mindlessly; don’t know (exactly) who/where/etc. (but); cannot tell (exactly) who/where/etc. (but); (to/from) no particular (person, etc.)
explanation: A phrase indicating that the subject does something without paying much attention, or that when, where, to whom, etc., something took place is unclear.
japanese: 我が家ではいつからともなく正月にスキーに行く習慣が始まった。
reading: 我が家ではいつからともなく正月にスキーに行く習慣が始まった。
english: We do not know when, but my family started a tradition of going skiing on New Year's Day.

translation: Without intending to; without paying much attention; unconsciously; mindlessly; don’t know (exactly) who/where/etc. (but); cannot tell (exactly) who/where/etc. (but); (to/from) no particular (person, etc.)
explanation: A phrase indicating that the subject does something without paying much attention, or that when, where, to whom, etc., something took place is unclear.
japanese: 聴くともなく聴いていたら、だんだんその演奏に引き込まれていった。
reading: 聴くともなく聴いていたら、だんだんその演奏に引き込まれていった。
english: As I was listening to the performance without paying much attention, I was gradually pulled into it.

translation: Without intending to; without paying much attention; unconsciously; mindlessly; don’t know (exactly) who/where/etc. (but); cannot tell (exactly) who/where/etc. (but); (to/from) no particular (person, etc.)
explanation: A phrase indicating that the subject does something without paying much attention, or that when, where, to whom, etc., something took place is unclear.
japanese: 大学時代のことを考えるともなく考えていると、次々にクラスメートの顔が浮かんできた。
reading: 大学時代のことを考えるともなく考えていると、次々にクラスメートの顔が浮かんできた。
english: When I was thinking mindlessly about my university days, the faces of my classmates came to my mind one after another.

translation: Without intending to; without paying much attention; unconsciously; mindlessly; don’t know (exactly) who/where/etc. (but); cannot tell (exactly) who/where/etc. (but); (to/from) no particular (person, etc.)
explanation: A phrase indicating that the subject does something without paying much attention, or that when, where, to whom, etc., something took place is unclear.
japanese: 目撃者の話を聞くともなく後ろで聞いていたが、突然その話の中に事件解決のための重要な情報が含まれていることに気がついた。
reading: 目撃者の話を聞くともなく後ろで聞いていたが、突然その話の中に事件解決のための重要な情報が含まれていることに気がついた。
english: I was listening to the witness's story from behind without paying much attention when, all of sudden, I realised that it contained an important piece of information for solving the case.

translation: Without intending to; without paying much attention; unconsciously; mindlessly; don’t know (exactly) who/where/etc. (but); cannot tell (exactly) who/where/etc. (but); (to/from) no particular (person, etc.)
explanation: A phrase indicating that the subject does something without paying much attention, or that when, where, to whom, etc., something took place is unclear.
japanese: どこからともなくいい匂いが漂ってきた。
reading: どこからともなくいい匂いが漂ってきた。
english: (I couldn't tell from where, but) a good smell wafted from somewhere.

translation: Without intending to; without paying much attention; unconsciously; mindlessly; don’t know (exactly) who/where/etc. (but); cannot tell (exactly) who/where/etc. (but); (to/from) no particular (person, etc.)
explanation: A phrase indicating that the subject does something without paying much attention, or that when, where, to whom, etc., something took place is unclear.
japanese: 「やっと終わった」。彼は誰にともなくつぶやいた。
reading: 「やっと終わった」。彼は誰にともなくつぶやいた。
english: Finally, it's over, he muttered (literally: muttered to no one in particular).

translation: Without intending to; without paying much attention; unconsciously; mindlessly; don’t know (exactly) who/where/etc. (but); cannot tell (exactly) who/where/etc. (but); (to/from) no particular (person, etc.)
explanation: A phrase indicating that the subject does something without paying much attention, or that when, where, to whom, etc., something took place is unclear.
japanese: 二人はどちらからともなく顔を見合わせて微笑んだ。
reading: 二人はどちらからともなく顔を見合わせて微笑んだ。
english: The two smiled at each other almost at the same time. (literally: I cannot tell which one did it ﬁrst, but the two looked at each other and smiled.)

translation: Tend to; apt to; be likely to; easily; be bound to
explanation: A phrase that expresses the idea that something is likely to take place.
japanese: 切れ味のよい議論はともすると言葉の暴力となる。
reading: 切れ味のよい議論はともすると言葉の暴力となる。
english: A sharp debate is apt to lead to a violent argument.

translation: Tend to; apt to; be likely to; easily; be bound to
explanation: A phrase that expresses the idea that something is likely to take place.
japanese: 親は自分の子供にはともすると点数が甘くなりがちだ。
reading: 親は自分の子供にはともすると点数が甘くなりがちだ。
english: Parents tend to be more permissive (literally: lenient in grading) when it comes to their own children.

translation: Tend to; apt to; be likely to; easily; be bound to
explanation: A phrase that expresses the idea that something is likely to take place.
japanese: 大きな組織はともするとセクショナリズムに陥る危険性がある。
reading: 大きな組織はともするとセクショナリズムに陥る危険性がある。
english: Large organizations are likely to be in danger of falling into sectionalism.

translation: Tend to; apt to; be likely to; easily; be bound to
explanation: A phrase that expresses the idea that something is likely to take place.
japanese: 商品づくりにおける標準化活動はともすると社内設計部門から嫌われる。
reading: 商品づくりにおける標準化活動はともすると社内設計部門から嫌われる。
english: Activities to promote standardization in product manufacturing are bound to be disliked by the design division.
extra_notes: における = in, with regard to

translation: Tend to; apt to; be likely to; easily; be bound to
explanation: A phrase that expresses the idea that something is likely to take place.
japanese: 日本ではともすると議論が感情的になってしまい、知的なディベートの場が育ちにくいと言われる。
reading: 日本ではともすると議論が感情的になってしまい、知的なディベートの場が育ちにくいと言われる。
english: People say that in Japan arguments tend to be emotional, and, therefore, that it is hard to develop occasions for intellectual debate.

translation: Tend to; apt to; be likely to; easily; be bound to
explanation: A phrase that expresses the idea that something is likely to take place.
japanese: スポーツ選手がいい記録を出すと、世間の期待が高くなり、ともするとその重圧に押しつぶされるようなケースも出てくる。
reading: スポーツ選手がいい記録を出すと、世間の期待が高くなり、ともするとその重圧に押しつぶされるようなケースも出てくる。
english: When athletes make good records, the public raises its expectations, and this leads to cases where athletes are more likely to be crushed by the heavy pressure.

translation: Tend to; apt to; be likely to; easily; be bound to
explanation: A phrase that expresses the idea that something is likely to take place.
japanese: 日本語が論理的な表現に不適だとは思わないが、日常会話的な表現を安易に使うと、ともすると論理が曖昧になりやすい。
reading: 日本語が論理的な表現に不適だとは思わないが、日常会話的な表現を安易に使うと、ともすると論理が曖昧になりやすい。
english: I don't believe that Japanese is ill-suited for expressing logic, but if you use expressions from daily conversation carelessly, your logic is apt to become ambiguous.

translation: Tend to; apt to; be likely to; easily; be bound to
explanation: A phrase that expresses the idea that something is likely to take place.
japanese: 国際協力と言うと、ともすると富める国が貧しい国に援助を施すというように受け取られやすい。
reading: 国際協力と言うと、ともすると富める国が貧しい国に援助を施すというように受け取られやすい。
english: When we mention international cooperation, the tendency is to interpret it as rich countries giving aid to poor countries.

translation: Tend to; apt to; be likely to; easily; be bound to
explanation: A phrase that expresses the idea that something is likely to take place.
japanese: 従来の音楽教育はともすると学校の中だけの活動に終始しがちであった。
reading: 従来の音楽教育はともすると学校の中だけの活動に終始しがちであった。
english: Conventional music education throughout the school year was apt to provide activities only within the school.

translation: Tend to; apt to; be likely to; easily; be bound to
explanation: A phrase that expresses the idea that something is likely to take place.
japanese: 長期不況のもとでは、ともすると様々な議論が極端な悲観論や危機論に傾きがちである。
reading: 長期不況のもとでは、ともすると様々な議論が極端な悲観論や危機論に傾きがちである。
english: The wide-ranging debate over the long recession has tended either to be overly pessimistic or to focus on the recession as a crisis.

translation: Tend to; apt to; be likely to; easily; be bound to
explanation: A phrase that expresses the idea that something is likely to take place.
japanese: 現在の状況では、ともすると経済的な視点からの開発が先行し、貴重な資源を浪費したり、生活環境を損ないかねない。
reading: 現在の状況では、ともすると経済的な視点からの開発が先行し、貴重な資源を浪費したり、生活環境を損ないかねない。
english: Under the current circumstances, precedence will likely be given to economically-oriented development, and (consequently) problems such as the wasting of precious resources and the destruction of our living environment may take place.

translation: That
explanation: A phrase that presents the content of the referent of the following noun (e.g., a report, notice, news, view).
japanese: 経済情勢は悪化しているとの見方が優勢だ。
reading: 経済情勢は悪化しているとの見方が優勢だ。
english: The view that the economic situation is worsening is dominant.

translation: That
explanation: A phrase that presents the content of the referent of the following noun (e.g., a report, notice, news, view).
japanese: 邦画の入場者数がハリウッド映画を上回って1位になったのは始めて(だ)とのことだ。
reading: 邦画の入場者数がハリウッド映画を上回って1位になったのは始めて(だ)とのことだ。
english: (It is said that) Apparently this is the first time that the size of the audience for a Japanese movie has exceeded that of a Hollywood movie, making it No. 1.

translation: That
explanation: A phrase that presents the content of the referent of the following noun (e.g., a report, notice, news, view).
japanese: 伊豆半島付近で地震があったとの知らせを受けた。
reading: <ruby title="伊豆(いず)"><rb>伊豆</rb><rt>いず</rt></ruby>半島付近で地震があったとの知らせを受けた。
english: I received the news that there was an earthquake near the Izu Peninsula.

translation: That
explanation: A phrase that presents the content of the referent of the following noun (e.g., a report, notice, news, view).
japanese: 探検隊が日本時間の13時30分にベースキャンプに到着したとの報告がもたらされた。
reading: 探検隊が日本時間の13時30分にベースキャンプに到着したとの報告がもたらされた。
english: There was a report that the expedition party arrived at the base camp at 1:30 p.m. Japan time.

translation: That
explanation: A phrase that presents the content of the referent of the following noun (e.g., a report, notice, news, view).
japanese: この研究テーマは社会のニーズに合っていないとの指摘がなされた。
reading: この研究テーマは社会のニーズに合っていないとの指摘がなされた。
english: It was pointed out that this research topic does not meet society's needs.

translation: That
explanation: A phrase that presents the content of the referent of the following noun (e.g., a report, notice, news, view).
japanese: 副大臣の数をあまり多くすると行政を混乱させるとの意見がある。
reading: 副大臣の数をあまり多くすると行政を混乱させるとの意見がある。
english: There is a view that having too many vice-ministers will make governing chaotic.

translation: That
explanation: A phrase that presents the content of the referent of the following noun (e.g., a report, notice, news, view).
japanese: 無断リンクは著作権侵害との見解が発表された。
reading: 無断リンクは著作権侵害との見解が発表された。
english: The view was announced that making a link (to a website) without permission infringes on the site owner's copyright.

translation: That
explanation: A phrase that presents the content of the referent of the following noun (e.g., a report, notice, news, view).
japanese: 当地からは遠隔で不便との理由で患者さん自身が受診を希望しない場合が多い。
reading: 当地からは遠隔で不便との理由で患者さん自身が受診を希望しない場合が多い。
english: Patients often don't want to come in for their examination because they are far away and it is inconvenient (to come here).

translation: That
explanation: A phrase that presents the content of the referent of the following noun (e.g., a report, notice, news, view).
japanese: 新システムの評価はどのように行うのかとの質問に対し、ユーザーへのアンケートを行うとの回答があった。
reading: 新システムの評価はどのように行うのかとの質問に対し、ユーザーへのアンケートを行うとの回答があった。
english: To the question as to how the new system would be evaluated, the response was that they would circulate a questionnaire among users.

translation: Cannot possibly; totally impossible; there is no possibility; there is no way; not ~ at all; not ~ by any means; by no means
explanation: A structure that is used to deny emphatically the ability of someone/something or possibility of an event, state or action
japanese: この仕事はとても私にはできない。
reading: この仕事はとても私にはできない。
english: I cannot possibly do this job.

translation: Cannot possibly; totally impossible; there is no possibility; there is no way; not ~ at all; not ~ by any means; by no means
explanation: A structure that is used to deny emphatically the ability of someone/something or possibility of an event, state or action
japanese: 吉岡さんはとても私の勝てる相手ではない。
reading: 吉岡さんはとても私の勝てる相手ではない。
english: Mr. Yoshioka is someone I couldn't possibly beat. (literally: Mr. Yoshioka is not someone I could possibly beat.)

translation: Cannot possibly; totally impossible; there is no possibility; there is no way; not ~ at all; not ~ by any means; by no means
explanation: A structure that is used to deny emphatically the ability of someone/something or possibility of an event, state or action
japanese: この病気はとても治る見込みはない。
reading: この病気はとても治る見込みはない。
english: There is no possibility that he will recover from this illness.

translation: Cannot possibly; totally impossible; there is no possibility; there is no way; not ~ at all; not ~ by any means; by no means
explanation: A structure that is used to deny emphatically the ability of someone/something or possibility of an event, state or action
japanese: 私は数学ではとても彼にかなわない。
reading: 私は数学ではとても彼にかなわない。
english: I cannot possibly beat him in mathematics.

translation: Cannot possibly; totally impossible; there is no possibility; there is no way; not ~ at all; not ~ by any means; by no means
explanation: A structure that is used to deny emphatically the ability of someone/something or possibility of an event, state or action
japanese: こんな予算ではとてもこの学校を維持していけない。
reading: こんな予算ではとてもこの学校を維持していけない。
english: It is totally impossible to maintain this school with a budget like this.

translation: Cannot possibly; totally impossible; there is no possibility; there is no way; not ~ at all; not ~ by any means; by no means
explanation: A structure that is used to deny emphatically the ability of someone/something or possibility of an event, state or action
japanese: 今の大統領はとてもこの国を統治する能力はない。
reading: 今の大統領はとてもこの国を統治する能力はない。
english: The current president has no ability at all to govern this country.

translation: Cannot possibly; totally impossible; there is no possibility; there is no way; not ~ at all; not ~ by any means; by no means
explanation: A structure that is used to deny emphatically the ability of someone/something or possibility of an event, state or action
japanese: この病人はとても助からない。
reading: この病人はとても助からない。
english: There is no way this patient can possibly be saved.

translation: Cannot possibly; totally impossible; there is no possibility; there is no way; not ~ at all; not ~ by any means; by no means
explanation: A structure that is used to deny emphatically the ability of someone/something or possibility of an event, state or action
japanese: この地方に雪が降ることはとてもあり得ない。
reading: この地方に雪が降ることはとてもあり得ない。
english: There's no way it could snow in this region.

translation: Cannot possibly; totally impossible; there is no possibility; there is no way; not ~ at all; not ~ by any means; by no means
explanation: A structure that is used to deny emphatically the ability of someone/something or possibility of an event, state or action
japanese: とても我々に勝ち目はない。
reading: とても我々に勝ち目はない。
english: We have no chance of winning.

translation: Cannot possibly; totally impossible; there is no possibility; there is no way; not ~ at all; not ~ by any means; by no means
explanation: A structure that is used to deny emphatically the ability of someone/something or possibility of an event, state or action
japanese: 経済はとてもすぐには回復しそうにない。
reading: 経済はとてもすぐには回復しそうにない。
english: It does not look like there is any chance the economy will recover soon.

translation: Cannot possibly; totally impossible; there is no possibility; there is no way; not ~ at all; not ~ by any means; by no means
explanation: A structure that is used to deny emphatically the ability of someone/something or possibility of an event, state or action
japanese: 山岸さんはとても８０歳には見えない。
reading: 山岸さんはとても８０歳には見えない。
english: Mrs. Yamagishi does not look 80 years old at all.

translation: Cannot possibly; totally impossible; there is no possibility; there is no way; not ~ at all; not ~ by any means; by no means
explanation: A structure that is used to deny emphatically the ability of someone/something or possibility of an event, state or action
japanese: そんな危ないところにはとても子供を行かせられない。
reading: そんな危ないところにはとても子供を行かせられない。
english: I cannot possibly send my child to such a dangerous place.

translation: (not think/expect/etc.) that; (be surprised/be glad/regret/etc.) that
explanation: A compound particle marking an event, action or state that the speaker/writer does not expect and that causes him/her to feel some emotion
japanese: 彼が自分のベンチャー会社を立ち上げるとは思いもしなかった。
reading: 彼が自分のベンチャー会社を立ち上げるとは思いもしなかった。
english: I never thought that he would launch his own venture business.

translation: (not think/expect/etc.) that; (be surprised/be glad/regret/etc.) that
explanation: A compound particle marking an event, action or state that the speaker/writer does not expect and that causes him/her to feel some emotion
japanese: あんないい店がなくなったとは残念だ。
reading: あんないい店がなくなったとは残念だ。
english: It is too bad that such a nice shop is gone.

translation: (not think/expect/etc.) that; (be surprised/be glad/regret/etc.) that
explanation: A compound particle marking an event, action or state that the speaker/writer does not expect and that causes him/her to feel some emotion
japanese: こんな便利なサイトがあったとは！
reading: こんな便利なサイトがあったとは！
english: (a) I'm surprised that there is such a convenient website. (b) How great to have such a convenient website! (c) Who would have thought there would be such a convenient website!

translation: (not think/expect/etc.) that; (be surprised/be glad/regret/etc.) that
explanation: A compound particle marking an event, action or state that the speaker/writer does not expect and that causes him/her to feel some emotion
japanese: お父さんがそんなにお悪いとは知りませんでした。
reading: お父さんがそんなにお悪いとは知りませんでした。
english: I didn't know that your father was that ill.

translation: (not think/expect/etc.) that; (be surprised/be glad/regret/etc.) that
explanation: A compound particle marking an event, action or state that the speaker/writer does not expect and that causes him/her to feel some emotion
japanese: こんなに早く自分の家が持てるとは思いもしなかった。
reading: こんなに早く自分の家が持てるとは思いもしなかった。
english: I never thought I could have my own house this soon.

translation: (not think/expect/etc.) that; (be surprised/be glad/regret/etc.) that
explanation: A compound particle marking an event, action or state that the speaker/writer does not expect and that causes him/her to feel some emotion
japanese: ハリケーンのためにガソリンがこんなに上がるとは想像すらしなかった。
reading: ハリケーンのためにガソリンがこんなに上がるとは想像すらしなかった。
english: I would never have imagined that gas prices would go up this much because of a hurricane.

translation: (not think/expect/etc.) that; (be surprised/be glad/regret/etc.) that
explanation: A compound particle marking an event, action or state that the speaker/writer does not expect and that causes him/her to feel some emotion
japanese: 一つのテレビドラマが日韓交流にこれほど影響を与えるとは誰が予測し得たであろう。
reading: 一つのテレビドラマが日韓交流にこれほど影響を与えるとは誰が予測し得たであろう。
english: Who could have predicted that a TV drama would have this much inﬂuence on cultural exchange and travel between Japan and Korea?
extra_notes: 予測し得た = successfully predicted

translation: (not think/expect/etc.) that; (be surprised/be glad/regret/etc.) that
explanation: A compound particle marking an event, action or state that the speaker/writer does not expect and that causes him/her to feel some emotion
japanese: 蒸したてのお芋がこんなにおいしいとは驚きました。
reading: 蒸したてのお芋がこんなにおいしいとは驚きました。
english: I'm surprised that fresh steamed potatoes taste this good.

translation: (not think/expect/etc.) that; (be surprised/be glad/regret/etc.) that
explanation: A compound particle marking an event, action or state that the speaker/writer does not expect and that causes him/her to feel some emotion
japanese: まだ知り合って一週間にもならない私にお金を借りに来るとは驚きだ。
reading: まだ知り合って一週間にもならない私にお金を借りに来るとは驚きだ。
english: I was shocked that he came to borrow money from me less than a week after we ﬁrst got acquainted.

translation: (not think/expect/etc.) that; (be surprised/be glad/regret/etc.) that
explanation: A compound particle marking an event, action or state that the speaker/writer does not expect and that causes him/her to feel some emotion
japanese: こんなにおいしくて、ボリュームがあって、たったの５００円とはありがたい。
reading: こんなにおいしくて、ボリュームがあって、たったの５００円とはありがたい。
english: It's great (literally: I'm thankful) that this (dish) tastes so good, there's a lot of it, and it costs only 500 yen.

translation: (not think/expect/etc.) that; (be surprised/be glad/regret/etc.) that
explanation: A compound particle marking an event, action or state that the speaker/writer does not expect and that causes him/her to feel some emotion
japanese: 大勢の人が家をなくして困っているというのに、それを利用して金をもうけるとはけしからん。
reading: 大勢の人が家をなくして困っているというのに、それを利用して金をもうけるとはけしからん。
english: It is inexcusable that while many people have lost their houses and are suffering, some take advantage of this to make money.

translation: (not think/expect/etc.) that; (be surprised/be glad/regret/etc.) that
explanation: A compound particle marking an event, action or state that the speaker/writer does not expect and that causes him/her to feel some emotion
japanese: バッハの最高傑作の演奏をDVDで見られるとは何という幸せでしょう！
reading: バッハの最高傑作の演奏をDVDで見られるとは何という幸せでしょう！
english: How happy I am to be able to watch a performance of Bach's best work on DVD!

translation: (not think/expect/etc.) that; (be surprised/be glad/regret/etc.) that
explanation: A compound particle marking an event, action or state that the speaker/writer does not expect and that causes him/her to feel some emotion
japanese: 自分たちで嘘を広めておいて、それを既成事実にしようとは何たることだ！
reading: 自分たちで嘘を広めておいて、それを既成事実にしようとは何たることだ！
english: What a (shameful) thing it is to spread lies and try to convince people that they are true (literally: make them an established fact).

translation: Although (it is said that/someone says that); even though (it is said that/someone says that); admitting that; that being said; however; nevertheless
explanation: A conjunctive phrase meaning “although it is said that”
japanese: 夏とは言え、ここはまだちょっと肌寒いくらいの涼しさだ。
reading: 夏とは言え、ここはまだちょっと肌寒いくらいの涼しさだ。
english: Although it is summer, it is still cool here—almost to the extent that it can be called a little chilly.

translation: Although (it is said that/someone says that); even though (it is said that/someone says that); admitting that; that being said; however; nevertheless
explanation: A conjunctive phrase meaning “although it is said that”
japanese: 時間がなかったとは言え、ジェーンにこれくらいのレポートが書けないはずはない。
reading: 時間がなかったとは言え、ジェーンにこれくらいのレポートが書けないはずはない。
english: (i) Even admitting that Jane didn't have much time, I don't believe that she couldn't write a (simple) report like this. (ii) Although Jane says that she didn't have much time (or you say that Jane didn't have much time), I don't believe that she couldn't write a (simple) report like this.

translation: Although (it is said that/someone says that); even though (it is said that/someone says that); admitting that; that being said; however; nevertheless
explanation: A conjunctive phrase meaning “although it is said that”
japanese: 今度の学会が楽しみだ。とは言え、まだ発表準備は全然できていない。
reading: 今度の学会が楽しみだ。とは言え、まだ発表準備は全然できていない。
english: I'm looking forward to the next academic conference. That being said, I haven't prepared for my presentation at all yet.

translation: Although (it is said that/someone says that); even though (it is said that/someone says that); admitting that; that being said; however; nevertheless
explanation: A conjunctive phrase meaning “although it is said that”
japanese: 子供がやったこととは言え、これは立派な犯罪だ。
reading: 子供がやったこととは言え、これは立派な犯罪だ。
english: Although this was done by a child, it practically amounts to a crime.
extra_notes: here, 立派 means "undeniable, indisputable."

translation: Although (it is said that/someone says that); even though (it is said that/someone says that); admitting that; that being said; however; nevertheless
explanation: A conjunctive phrase meaning “although it is said that”
japanese: 予想していた返答だったとは言え、やはりそれを聞いた時はショックだった。
reading: 予想していた返答だったとは言え、やはりそれを聞いた時はショックだった。
english: Although it was the response I'd expected, it really did shock me to hear it.

translation: Although (it is said that/someone says that); even though (it is said that/someone says that); admitting that; that being said; however; nevertheless
explanation: A conjunctive phrase meaning “although it is said that”
japanese: ノートブック型とは言え、ディスプレイは１７インチ、プロセッサーは2.4GHz、内臓ドライブは２５０GBもあり、DVD/CD-RWコンボドライブ付きという優れものだ。
reading: ノートブック型とは言え、ディスプレイは１７インチ、プロセッサーは2.4GHz、内臓ドライブは２５０GBもあり、DVD/CD-RWコンボドライブ付きという優れものだ。
english: Although it is a laptop, it is an excellent machine, with a 17-inch display, a 2.4GHz processor, a voluminous 250GB internal drive and a DVD/CD-RW combo drive.

translation: Although (it is said that/someone says that); even though (it is said that/someone says that); admitting that; that being said; however; nevertheless
explanation: A conjunctive phrase meaning “although it is said that”
japanese: 安いとは言え、都会の高級マンションだ。普通の者が簡単に買える代物ではない。
reading: 安いとは言え、都会の高級マンションだ。普通の者が簡単に買える代物ではない。
english: Although I say (it is) reasonable, it is an upscale condominium in the city. It's not something ordinary people can easily afford.

translation: Although (it is said that/someone says that); even though (it is said that/someone says that); admitting that; that being said; however; nevertheless
explanation: A conjunctive phrase meaning “although it is said that”
japanese: いかに暫定的処置とは言え、これはずさんすぎる。
reading: いかに暫定的処置とは言え、これはずさんすぎる。
english: No matter how temporary these measures are supposed to be, this is just too slipshod.

translation: Although (it is said that/someone says that); even though (it is said that/someone says that); admitting that; that being said; however; nevertheless
explanation: A conjunctive phrase meaning “although it is said that”
japanese: 怪我をして動けないとは言え、ものを考えることはできる。
reading: 怪我をして動けないとは言え、ものを考えることはできる。
english: Even though I cannot move because of my injury, I can still think.

translation: Although (it is said that/someone says that); even though (it is said that/someone says that); admitting that; that being said; however; nevertheless
explanation: A conjunctive phrase meaning “although it is said that”
japanese: 毎日走っているとは言え、1キロほどジョギングするだけだから大した運動にはならない。
reading: 毎日走っているとは言え、1キロほどジョギングするだけだから大した運動にはならない。
english: Although I say I run every day, it's just one kilometre of jogging, so I don't get much exercise.

translation: Although (it is said that/someone says that); even though (it is said that/someone says that); admitting that; that being said; however; nevertheless
explanation: A conjunctive phrase meaning “although it is said that”
japanese: 退職したとは言え、毎日やることがたくさんあるので忙しい。
reading: 退職したとは言え、毎日やることがたくさんあるので忙しい。
english: Although I've retired, I have lots of things to do every day, which keeps me busy.

translation: Although (it is said that/someone says that); even though (it is said that/someone says that); admitting that; that being said; however; nevertheless
explanation: A conjunctive phrase meaning “although it is said that”
japanese: 燃料電池は将来化石燃料に代わる主要エネルギーになるだろう。とは言え、これにはまだ解決すべき技術的な問題が多く残っている。
reading: 燃料電池は将来化石燃料に代わる主要エネルギーになるだろう。とは言え、これにはまだ解決すべき技術的な問題が多く残っている。
english: Fuel cells will probably become a major source of energy in the future, replacing fossil fuels. Having said that, many technical problems (with this technology) remain to be solved.

translation: Unintentionally; without being able to control onself; without meaning to; carelessly; involuntarily; in spite of oneself; just; only
explanation: An adverb used to describe someone doing something without being able to control himself/herself or used to indicate the closeness of a time or a place.
japanese: 楽しかったので、つい飲みすぎてしまった。
reading: 楽しかったので、つい飲みすぎてしまった。
english: Because I had such a good time, I ended up drinking too much (without meaning to).

translation: Unintentionally; without being able to control onself; without meaning to; carelessly; involuntarily; in spite of oneself; just; only
explanation: An adverb used to describe someone doing something without being able to control himself/herself or used to indicate the closeness of a time or a place.
japanese: ついさっきまで山口さんが来ていたんです。
reading: ついさっきまで山口さんが来ていたんです。
english: Mr. Yamaguchi was here until just a little while ago.

translation: Unintentionally; without being able to control onself; without meaning to; carelessly; involuntarily; in spite of oneself; just; only
explanation: An adverb used to describe someone doing something without being able to control himself/herself or used to indicate the closeness of a time or a place.
japanese: 人のお金を使うのは悪いとは知りながら、つい使ってしまった。
reading: 人のお金を使うのは悪いとは知りながら、つい使ってしまった。
english: I know it's a bad thing to use someone else's money but I just couldn't control myself (and used it).

translation: Unintentionally; without being able to control onself; without meaning to; carelessly; involuntarily; in spite of oneself; just; only
explanation: An adverb used to describe someone doing something without being able to control himself/herself or used to indicate the closeness of a time or a place.
japanese: 安かったのでつい買ってしまった。
reading: 安かったのでつい買ってしまった。
english: It was cheap, so I just bought it (even though I didn't mean to).

translation: Unintentionally; without being able to control onself; without meaning to; carelessly; involuntarily; in spite of oneself; just; only
explanation: An adverb used to describe someone doing something without being able to control himself/herself or used to indicate the closeness of a time or a place.
japanese: 恵美につい亜紀の秘密を話してしまった。
reading: 恵美につい亜紀の秘密を話してしまった。
english: I carelessly told Aki's secret to Emi.

translation: Unintentionally; without being able to control onself; without meaning to; carelessly; involuntarily; in spite of oneself; just; only
explanation: An adverb used to describe someone doing something without being able to control himself/herself or used to indicate the closeness of a time or a place.
japanese: 彼の仕事を見ているとじれったいのでつい手を貸してしまう。
reading: 彼の仕事を見ているとじれったいのでつい手を貸してしまう。
english: I feel impatient when I see him doing his work, so, without intending to, I end up extending a hand.

translation: Unintentionally; without being able to control onself; without meaning to; carelessly; involuntarily; in spite of oneself; just; only
explanation: An adverb used to describe someone doing something without being able to control himself/herself or used to indicate the closeness of a time or a place.
japanese: あの人は面白いのでついからかいたくなる。
reading: あの人は面白いのでついからかいたくなる。
english: He's so funny it's hard to resist teasing him.

translation: Unintentionally; without being able to control onself; without meaning to; carelessly; involuntarily; in spite of oneself; just; only
explanation: An adverb used to describe someone doing something without being able to control himself/herself or used to indicate the closeness of a time or a place.
japanese: この店は感じがいいのでつい入ってみたくなる。
reading: この店は感じがいいのでつい入ってみたくなる。
english: This shop has such a good atmosphere that I can't help wanting to go in.

translation: Unintentionally; without being able to control onself; without meaning to; carelessly; involuntarily; in spite of oneself; just; only
explanation: An adverb used to describe someone doing something without being able to control himself/herself or used to indicate the closeness of a time or a place.
japanese: ついこの間、新年を祝ったと思ったら今日はもうバレンタインデーだ。
reading: ついこの間、新年を祝ったと思ったら今日はもうバレンタインデーだ。
english: It feels like we just celebrated New Year's the other day, and here it is Valentine's Day already.

translation: Unintentionally; without being able to control onself; without meaning to; carelessly; involuntarily; in spite of oneself; just; only
explanation: An adverb used to describe someone doing something without being able to control himself/herself or used to indicate the closeness of a time or a place.
japanese: 彼女からは、つい２、3日前にメールをもらった。
reading: 彼女からは、つい２、3日前にメールをもらった。
english: I received an email from her only two or three days ago.

translation: Unintentionally; without being able to control onself; without meaning to; carelessly; involuntarily; in spite of oneself; just; only
explanation: An adverb used to describe someone doing something without being able to control himself/herself or used to indicate the closeness of a time or a place.
japanese: ついそこに喫茶店がありますからそこで話しましょう。
reading: ついそこに喫茶店がありますからそこで話しましょう。
english: There's a tea house just over there, so let's talk there.

translation: When; while (~ at it); as; on one’s way to; since ~ (anyway); as well; at one’s convenience
explanation: A phrase used to express the idea that someone does a second thing at the same time as the first because it takes less time or effort.
japanese: 京都へ来たついでに龍安寺の石庭を見に行こうと思っている。
reading: 京都へ来たついでに龍安寺の石庭を見に行こうと思っている。
english: Since I'm in Kyoto, I'm thinking of going to see the rock garden at Ryoanji Temple.

translation: When; while (~ at it); as; on one’s way to; since ~ (anyway); as well; at one’s convenience
explanation: A phrase used to express the idea that someone does a second thing at the same time as the first because it takes less time or effort.
japanese: 頼みついでにもう一つお願いしてもいいですか。
reading: 頼みついでにもう一つお願いしてもいいですか。
english: While I'm at it, may I ask another favour of you?

translation: When; while (~ at it); as; on one’s way to; since ~ (anyway); as well; at one’s convenience
explanation: A phrase used to express the idea that someone does a second thing at the same time as the first because it takes less time or effort.
japanese: この仕事は大変だが、大変ついでに来週の分もいま方づけておけば後が楽だ。
reading: この仕事は大変だが、大変ついでに来週の分もいま方づけておけば後が楽だ。
english: This job is a real chore, but while we're at it if we ﬁnish the work for next week, too, we'll have an easier time later.

translation: When; while (~ at it); as; on one’s way to; since ~ (anyway); as well; at one’s convenience
explanation: A phrase used to express the idea that someone does a second thing at the same time as the first because it takes less time or effort.
japanese: 生活費を抑えるために電気や水を節約し始めたが、節約ついでにエアコンも止めることにした。
reading: 生活費を抑えるために電気や水を節約し始めたが、節約ついでにエアコンも止めることにした。
english: I began to conserve electricity and water to lower my living expenses and as I'm cutting back, I decided to stop using the air conditioner as well.

translation: When; while (~ at it); as; on one’s way to; since ~ (anyway); as well; at one’s convenience
explanation: A phrase used to express the idea that someone does a second thing at the same time as the first because it takes less time or effort.
japanese: 話のついでにこのことも言っておきます。
reading: 話のついでにこのことも言っておきます。
english: While I'm telling you the story, let me add this, too.

translation: When; while (~ at it); as; on one’s way to; since ~ (anyway); as well; at one’s convenience
explanation: A phrase used to express the idea that someone does a second thing at the same time as the first because it takes less time or effort.
japanese: コピーしに行くの？じゃ、これもついでにお願いできる？
reading: コピーしに行くの？じゃ、これもついでにお願いできる？
english: Are you going to make copies? Then, could I ask you to do this as well?

translation: When; while (~ at it); as; on one’s way to; since ~ (anyway); as well; at one’s convenience
explanation: A phrase used to express the idea that someone does a second thing at the same time as the first because it takes less time or effort.
japanese: バンクーバーへ行くついでにシアトルの友達のところに寄る予定だ。
reading: バンクーバーへ行くついでにシアトルの友達のところに寄る予定だ。
english: I plan to stop by my friend's place in Seattle on my way to Vancouver.

translation: When; while (~ at it); as; on one’s way to; since ~ (anyway); as well; at one’s convenience
explanation: A phrase used to express the idea that someone does a second thing at the same time as the first because it takes less time or effort.
japanese: 車を洗ったついでに中も掃除しておいた。
reading: 車を洗ったついでに中も掃除しておいた。
english: When I washed my car, I cleaned the inside as well.

translation: When; while (~ at it); as; on one’s way to; since ~ (anyway); as well; at one’s convenience
explanation: A phrase used to express the idea that someone does a second thing at the same time as the first because it takes less time or effort.
japanese: 恥かきついでにもう一つお聞きしますが、アメリカも大学入試はあるんですか。
reading: 恥かきついでにもう一つお聞きしますが、アメリカも大学入試はあるんですか。
english: Now that I've been embarrassed (by my ignorance) once, let me ask you another question. Are there college entrance exams in America, too?

translation: When; while (~ at it); as; on one’s way to; since ~ (anyway); as well; at one’s convenience
explanation: A phrase used to express the idea that someone does a second thing at the same time as the first because it takes less time or effort.
japanese: 叱られついでに、もう一つの失敗のことも話してしまいます。
reading: 叱られついでに、もう一つの失敗のことも話してしまいます。
english: Since you've already told me off once, let me go ahead and tell you about another mistake I made.

translation: When; while (~ at it); as; on one’s way to; since ~ (anyway); as well; at one’s convenience
explanation: A phrase used to express the idea that someone does a second thing at the same time as the first because it takes less time or effort.
japanese: 今回は高級ホテルに泊まっているので、贅沢ついでにホテルのレストランで食事をすることにした。
reading: 今回は高級ホテルに泊まっているので、贅沢ついでにホテルのレストランで食事をすることにした。
english: I'm staying at a ﬁrst-class hotel this time, and if that isn't luxurious enough, I've decided to have dinner at the hotel restaurant.

translation: When; while (~ at it); as; on one’s way to; since ~ (anyway); as well; at one’s convenience
explanation: A phrase used to express the idea that someone does a second thing at the same time as the first because it takes less time or effort.
japanese: ご苦労ついでにこの翻訳も手伝ってもらえませんか。
reading: ご苦労ついでにこの翻訳も手伝ってもらえませんか。
english: Since you're working hard anyway, could I ask you to help me with this translation, too?

translation: When; while (~ at it); as; on one’s way to; since ~ (anyway); as well; at one’s convenience
explanation: A phrase used to express the idea that someone does a second thing at the same time as the first because it takes less time or effort.
japanese: 厚かましいついでにお願いがもう一つあります。
reading: 厚かましいついでにお願いがもう一つあります。
english: I've already been shameless (in asking you favours), but I have another favour to ask of you.

translation: When; while (~ at it); as; on one’s way to; since ~ (anyway); as well; at one’s convenience
explanation: A phrase used to express the idea that someone does a second thing at the same time as the first because it takes less time or effort.
japanese: 新しい電気自動車の取材ついでに自分も少し運転させてもらった。
reading: 新しい電気自動車の取材ついでに自分も少し運転させてもらった。
english: When I went to report on the new electric car, I got to drive it a little myself.

translation: When; while (~ at it); as; on one’s way to; since ~ (anyway); as well; at one’s convenience
explanation: A phrase used to express the idea that someone does a second thing at the same time as the first because it takes less time or effort.
japanese: 買い物のついでに銀行に寄って少し現金を下ろしていきます。
reading: 買い物のついでに銀行に寄って少し現金を下ろしていきます。
english: I'll stop by the bank and withdraw some cash when I go shopping.

translation: When; while (~ at it); as; on one’s way to; since ~ (anyway); as well; at one’s convenience
explanation: A phrase used to express the idea that someone does a second thing at the same time as the first because it takes less time or effort.
japanese: 以上が今週の予定ですが、ついでに来週の予定も言っておきます。
reading: 以上が今週の予定ですが、ついでに来週の予定も言っておきます。
english: That is the schedule for this week, and while I'm at it, let me tell you the schedule for next week as well.

translation: Therefore; thus; so; because of this; for this reason; with regard to this
explanation: A sentence-initial conjunction that means “with regard to this,” referring to what is stated in the preceding sentence.
japanese: コンピュータウイルスが全国的に広がっています。ついては、不審なメールが届いた場合は、添付ファイルを開くことなく当該メールを削除して下さい。
reading: コンピュータウイルスが全国的に広がっています。ついては、不審なメールが届いた場合は、添付ファイルを開くことなく当該メールを削除して下さい。
english: Computer viruses are spreading across the country. Because of this, if you receive a suspicious e-mail (literally: in the event a suspicious e-mail arrives), delete the email without opening the attached ﬁle.

translation: Therefore; thus; so; because of this; for this reason; with regard to this
explanation: A sentence-initial conjunction that means “with regard to this,” referring to what is stated in the preceding sentence.
japanese: この書類は契約文の日本語抄訳です。ついては、本訳をご参照の上、ウェブの英文契約書にご同意いただく必要があります。
reading: この書類は契約文の日本語抄訳です。ついては、本訳をご参照の上、ウェブの英文契約書にご同意いただく必要があります。
english: This document is the abridged Japanese translation of the agreement. Therefore, it is necessary for you to refer to this translation and accept the English agreement posted online.
extra_notes: の上　＝〔…の後〕 after…; 〔…の結果〕 on…; upon…; 〔…した時〕 when….

translation: Therefore; thus; so; because of this; for this reason; with regard to this
explanation: A sentence-initial conjunction that means “with regard to this,” referring to what is stated in the preceding sentence.
japanese: 11月分授業料は10月15日に指定預金口座から引き落とさせていただきます。ついては、前日までに預金残高の確認をお願いします。
reading: 11月分授業料は10月15日に指定預金口座から引き落とさせていただきます。ついては、前日までに預金残高の確認をお願いします。
english: We are going to withdraw the November tuition and fees from your designated bank account on October 15. Therefore, please be sure to check the account balance by the previous day.

translation: Therefore; thus; so; because of this; for this reason; with regard to this
explanation: A sentence-initial conjunction that means “with regard to this,” referring to what is stated in the preceding sentence.
japanese: 夏の省エネ対策について本社から通知がありました。ついては、別紙を参照の上、夏季のエネルギー節約にご協力をお願いいたします。
reading: 夏の省エネ対策について本社から通知がありました。ついては、別紙を参照の上、夏季のエネルギー節約にご協力をお願いいたします。
english: Headquarters has sent a notification with regard to summer energy conservation measures. We therefore request your cooperation with the summer energy saving in accordance with the measures listed in the attachment (literally: after referring to the attachment).

translation: Therefore; thus; so; because of this; for this reason; with regard to this
explanation: A sentence-initial conjunction that means “with regard to this,” referring to what is stated in the preceding sentence.
japanese: 深刻な雇用問題に対しては、再就職や雇用流動性を促進させる必要がある。ついては、以下の施策を積極的に展開されたい。
reading: 深刻な雇用問題に対しては、再就職や雇用流動性を促進させる必要がある。ついては、以下の施策を積極的に展開されたい。
english: To counter the serious unemployment (literally: employment) problem, it is necessary to promote reemployment and employment mobility. With regard to this, we'd like the following measures to be actively implemented.

translation: Therefore; thus; so; because of this; for this reason; with regard to this
explanation: A sentence-initial conjunction that means “with regard to this,” referring to what is stated in the preceding sentence.
japanese: 新しくインターネット販売の事業を始める計画です。つきましては、その資金を融資していただきたいのです。
reading: 新しくインターネット販売の事業を始める計画です。つきましては、その資金を融資していただきたいのです。
english: We plan to launch a new Internet sales business. Therefore, we would like to request ﬁnancing for it.

translation: Therefore; thus; so; because of this; for this reason; with regard to this
explanation: A sentence-initial conjunction that means “with regard to this,” referring to what is stated in the preceding sentence.
japanese: 今月は「リサイクル強化月間」になっています。つきましては、皆様方のご理解とご協力をお願いいたします。
reading: 今月は「リサイクル強化月間」になっています。つきましては、皆様方のご理解とご協力をお願いいたします。
english: This is a "recycling reinforcement month." We therefore request your understanding and cooperation.

translation: So; extremely; indescribably; indescribable; incredibly; awfully; terribly; cannot tell you/describe/etc. how; too much of
explanation: A phrase used to express a strong sensation or emotion.
japanese: つまらないミスで試合に負けて悔しい(と言)ったらない。
reading: つまらないミスで試合に負けて悔しい(と言)ったらない。
english: I'm so mortiﬁed because I lost the game due to a stupid mistake.
extra_notes: つまらない can also mean absurd, foolish, silly, stupid

translation: So; extremely; indescribably; indescribable; incredibly; awfully; terribly; cannot tell you/describe/etc. how; too much of
explanation: A phrase used to express a strong sensation or emotion.
japanese: 老眼が進んで眼鏡なしでは近くの字が読めないので、不便(と言)ったらない。
reading: 老眼が進んで眼鏡なしでは近くの字が読めないので、不便(と言)ったらない。
english: My farsightedness has gotten worse so I can't read words up close without my glasses—it's so inconvenient!

translation: So; extremely; indescribably; indescribable; incredibly; awfully; terribly; cannot tell you/describe/etc. how; too much of
explanation: A phrase used to express a strong sensation or emotion.
japanese: 大きな書類を保存するのを忘れてコンピュータがフリーズした時の情けなさ(と言)ったらない。
reading: 大きな書類を保存するのを忘れてコンピュータがフリーズした時の情けなさ(と言)ったらない。
english: The miserable feeling you get when the computer freezes and you forgot to save a large ﬁle is indescribable.

translation: So; extremely; indescribably; indescribable; incredibly; awfully; terribly; cannot tell you/describe/etc. how; too much of
explanation: A phrase used to express a strong sensation or emotion.
japanese: この辞書は使いにくいこと(と言)ったらない。
reading: この辞書は使いにくいこと(と言)ったらない。
english: This dictionary is incredibly hard to use.

translation: So; extremely; indescribably; indescribable; incredibly; awfully; terribly; cannot tell you/describe/etc. how; too much of
explanation: A phrase used to express a strong sensation or emotion.
japanese: 5分ごとにジェット機が離陸するのでうるさいと言ったらない。
reading: 5分ごとにジェット機が離陸するのでうるさいと言ったらない。
english: There's a jet taking off every ﬁve minutes—I can't even describe (to you) how noisy it is.

translation: So; extremely; indescribably; indescribable; incredibly; awfully; terribly; cannot tell you/describe/etc. how; too much of
explanation: A phrase used to express a strong sensation or emotion.
japanese: いつもよくしゃべる俊子が慎一の前で赤くなって何も言えないので、おかしいったらなかった。
reading: いつもよくしゃべる 俊子[としこ]が 慎一[しんいち]の前で赤くなって何も言えないので、おかしいったらなかった。
english: It was so funny to see Toshiko, who is usually talkative, blush and turn speechless in front of Shin'ichi.
extra_notes: おかしい can also mean funny, amusing, comical, laughable, ridiculous

translation: So; extremely; indescribably; indescribable; incredibly; awfully; terribly; cannot tell you/describe/etc. how; too much of
explanation: A phrase used to express a strong sensation or emotion.
japanese: ティムにデートをすっぽかされて頭に来るったらない。
reading: ティムにデートをすっぽかされて頭に来るったらない。
english: Tim stood me up, and that makes me so mad.

translation: So; extremely; indescribably; indescribable; incredibly; awfully; terribly; cannot tell you/describe/etc. how; too much of
explanation: A phrase used to express a strong sensation or emotion.
japanese: この仕事は一日中細かい字を見ているので目が疲れると言ったらない。
reading: この仕事は一日中細かい字を見ているので目が疲れると言ったらない。
english: Because I look at small print all day for this job, my eyes get awfully tired.

translation: So; extremely; indescribably; indescribable; incredibly; awfully; terribly; cannot tell you/describe/etc. how; too much of
explanation: A phrase used to express a strong sensation or emotion.
japanese: 出張したところはインターネットも携帯も使えず、不便と言ったらなかった。
reading: 出張したところはインターネットも携帯も使えず、不便と言ったらなかった。
english: In the area where I went on my business trip I couldn't use the Internet or my cell phone; I can't tell you how inconvenient it was.

translation: So; extremely; indescribably; indescribable; incredibly; awfully; terribly; cannot tell you/describe/etc. how; too much of
explanation: A phrase used to express a strong sensation or emotion.
japanese: プロジェクトに変更があるたびに関係者全員に知らせた上で承認を得なければならないので、面倒と言ったらない。
reading: プロジェクトに変更があるたびに関係者全員に知らせた上で承認を得なければならないので、面倒と言ったらない。
english: Every time there is a change to the project, we have to notify everybody involved and get their approval, so it is incredibly tiresome.

translation: So; extremely; indescribably; indescribable; incredibly; awfully; terribly; cannot tell you/describe/etc. how; too much of
explanation: A phrase used to express a strong sensation or emotion.
japanese: 夏、暑い外から帰ってきた後の冷えたビールのうまさったらない。
reading: 夏、暑い外から帰ってきた後の冷えたビールのうまさったらない。
english: In summer, the taste of a cold beer is indescribably good after coming in from the heat outside.

translation: So; extremely; indescribably; indescribable; incredibly; awfully; terribly; cannot tell you/describe/etc. how; too much of
explanation: A phrase used to express a strong sensation or emotion.
japanese: この国ではインターネットが自由に使えないので、その不便さったらない。
reading: この国ではインターネットが自由に使えないので、その不便さったらない。
english: In this country we cannot use the Internet freely, so it's so inconvenient.

translation: So; extremely; indescribably; indescribable; incredibly; awfully; terribly; cannot tell you/describe/etc. how; too much of
explanation: A phrase used to express a strong sensation or emotion.
japanese: ハイヒールで砂利道を歩かされたので歩きにくいことと言ったらなかった。
reading: ハイヒールで砂利道を歩かされたので歩きにくいことと言ったらなかった。
english: I had to walk on gravel in high heels, and I can't tell you how hard it was!

translation: So; extremely; indescribably; indescribable; incredibly; awfully; terribly; cannot tell you/describe/etc. how; too much of
explanation: A phrase used to express a strong sensation or emotion.
japanese: 雪に覆われた山々が早朝の朝日を受けて宝石のように輝く姿の美しいことと言ったらない。
reading: 雪に覆われた山々が早朝の朝日を受けて宝石のように輝く姿の美しいことと言ったらない。
english: When the snow-covered mountains receive the early morning sun and sparkle like gems, they are indescribably beautiful.

translation: So; extremely; indescribably; indescribable; incredibly; awfully; terribly; cannot tell you/describe/etc. how; too much of
explanation: A phrase used to express a strong sensation or emotion.
japanese: 昔、痛風にかかったことがあるが、その痛みと言ったらなかった。
reading: 昔、痛風にかかったことがあるが、その痛みと言ったらなかった。
english: I've suffered from gout before; the pain was indescribable.

translation: So; extremely; indescribably; indescribable; incredibly; awfully; terribly; cannot tell you/describe/etc. how; too much of
explanation: A phrase used to express a strong sensation or emotion.
japanese: 学生がいいのは、学期が終わったら次の学期の始まりまでは自由なことだ。試験やレポートが全部終わった時の解放感と言ったらない。
reading: 学生がいいのは、学期が終わったら次の学期の始まりまでは自由なことだ。試験やレポートが全部終わった時の解放感と言ったらない。
english: One good thing about being a student is that after the term is over, you're free until the next term begins. The feeling of release after ﬁnishing all the exams and term papers is indescribable.

translation: Even though there is; although there is; there is ~ but
explanation: A phrase expressing the idea “even though there is something”
japanese: インターフェースに若干の違いはあれ、この二つのプログラムは機能的には全く変わらない。
reading: インターフェースに若干の違いはあれ、この二つのプログラムは機能的には全く変わらない。
english: Although their interfaces are slightly different, these two programs are just the same in terms of their functions.

translation: Even though there is; although there is; there is ~ but
explanation: A phrase expressing the idea “even though there is something”
japanese: 歴史の違いはあれ、米国には１２０万を越す非営利団体(NPO)が存在します。
reading: 歴史の違いはあれ、米国には１２０万を越す非営利団体(NPO)が存在します。
english: Although their histories are different (literally: there are differences in their histories), there are more than 1,200,000 non-profit organizations in America.

translation: Even though there is; although there is; there is ~ but
explanation: A phrase expressing the idea “even though there is something”
japanese: ほとんどの者が、程度の差はあれ、マスメディアの影響を受けていると言える。
reading: ほとんどの者が、程度の差はあれ、マスメディアの影響を受けていると言える。
english: One can say that most people are affected by mass media, although there are differences in degree.

translation: Even though there is; although there is; there is ~ but
explanation: A phrase expressing the idea “even though there is something”
japanese: レベルに違いはあれ、この課にいる者は全員英語を話せる。
reading: レベルに違いはあれ、この課にいる者は全員英語を話せる。
english: Although their (skill) levels are different (literally: there are differences in their skill levels), everybody in this section can speak English.

translation: Even though there is; although there is; there is ~ but
explanation: A phrase expressing the idea “even though there is something”
japanese: 海外旅行に興味はあれ、先立つ費用がない。
reading: 海外旅行に興味はあれ、先立つ費用がない。
english: Even though I'm interested in traveling abroad, I don't have the money for it.
extra_notes: 先立つ = to be prerequisite

translation: Even though there is; although there is; there is ~ but
explanation: A phrase expressing the idea “even though there is something”
japanese: 若干の不満はあれ、今の職場を離れるつもりはない。
reading: 若干の不満はあれ、今の職場を離れるつもりはない。
english: Even though I have some complaints (literally: dissatisfaction), I don't intend to leave my current job.

translation: Even though there is; although there is; there is ~ but
explanation: A phrase expressing the idea “even though there is something”
japanese: 今まで自分を使ってくれた上司に対して感謝する気持ちはあれ、非難する気持ちは全くありません。
